original: viya ārāmarukkhe kariṃsu. Tāvadeva ca attano attano pattacīvaramādāya mahābhikkhusaṅgho
analyzed: viya ārāma rukkhe kariṃsu tāvat eva ca attano attano patta cīvaram ādāya mahā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ
translated: Then, taking their own bowls and robes, the great Community of monks

original: bhagavantaṃ parivāresi. Te pana parivāretvā ṭhitā bhikkhū evarūpā ahesuṃ appicchā
analyzed: bhagavantam parivāresi te pana parivāretvā ṭhitāḥ bhikkhū evarūpāḥ ahesuṃ appicchāḥ
translated: surrounded the Lord. Those monks who stood surrounding him were such that they were few in wishes,

original: santuṭṭhā pavivittā asaṃsaṭṭhā āraddhavīriyā vattāro vacanakkhamā codakā pāpagarahī
analyzed: santuṭṭhāḥ pavivittāḥ asaṃsaṭṭhāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ vattāraḥ vacana khamā codakā pāpa garahī
translated: content, secluded, aloof from society, strenuous, respectful of the training, reproving,

original: sīlasampannā samādhisampannā paññāvimuttivimuttiñāṇadassanasampannāti. Tehi parivārito🔽bhagavā rattakambalaparikkhitto viya suvaṇṇakkhandho rattapadumasaṇḍamajjhagatā viya
analyzed: sīla sampannā samādhi sampannā paññā vimutti vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampannā ati tehi parivāritaḥ  bhagavā ratta kambala parikkhittaḥ viya suvaṇṇa kkhandhaḥ ratta paduma saṇḍa majjha gatā viya
translated: blaming indulgence, perfected in virtue, perfected in concentration, perfected in wisdom, perfected in being freed, perfected in the knowledge and insight of freedom. Surrounded by them,🔽the Lord shone like a golden mountain surrounded by a grove of coral trees,

original: suvaṇṇanāvā pavāḷavedikāparikkhitto viya suvaṇṇapāsādo virocittha. Sāriputtamoggallānādayo
analyzed: suvaṇṇa nāvā pavāḷa vedikā parikkhittaḥ viya suvaṇṇa pāsādaḥ virocittha sāriputta moggallāna ādayo
translated: like a golden ship in the midst of a grove of red lotuses, like a golden palace surrounded by a rampart of rubies. The great elders Sāriputta, Moggallāna,

original: mahātherāpi naṃ meghavaṇṇaṃ paṃsukūlaṃ pārupitvā maṇivammavammikā viya mahānāgā parivārayiṃsu
analyzed: mahā therāḥ api nam megha vaṇṇam paṃsukūlam pārupitvā maṇi vamma vammikāḥ viya mahā nāgā parivārayiṃsu
translated: and the others, too, wearing their dusty rags the colour of rainclouds, surrounded him like great nāgas with their crests turned blue,

original: vantarāgā bhinnakilesā vijaṭitajaṭā chinnabandhanā kule vā gaṇe vā alaggā.
analyzed: vanta rāgā bhinna kilesā vijaṭita jaṭā chinna bandhanā kule vā gaṇe vā a laggā
translated: their inner tangle unraveled, their bonds cut, not clinging to any clan or group.

original: Iti bhagavā sayaṃ vītarāgo vītarāgehi, vītadoso vītadosehi, vītamoho vītamohehi,
analyzed: iti bhagavā sayam vīta rāgaḥ vīta rāgehi vīta dosaḥ vīta dosehi vīta mohaḥ vīta mohehi
translated: Thus the Blessed One, himself free from lust, was surrounded by those free from lust; himself free from hate, by those free from hate; himself free from delusion, by those free from delusion;

original: nittaṇho nittaṇhehi, nikkileso nikkilesehi, sayaṃ buddho bahussutabuddhehi parivārito,
analyzed: nittaṇhaḥ nittaṇhehi nikkilesaḥ nikkilesehi sayam buddhaḥ bahussuta buddhehi parivāritaḥ
translated: himself free from craving, by those free from craving; himself free from defilements, by those free from defilements; himself enlightened, by those enlightened in discipleship;

original: pattaparivāritaṃ viya kesaraṃ, kesaraparivāritā viya kaṇṇikā, aṭṭhanāgasahassaparivārito🔽viya chaddanto nāgarājā, navutihaṃsasahassaparivārito viya dhataraṭṭho haṃsarājā,🔽senaṅgaparivārito viya cakkavatti, marugaṇaparivārito viya sakko devarājā, brahmagaṇaparivārito🔽viya hāritamahābrahmā, tārāgaṇaparivārito viya puṇṇacando, asamena buddhavesena aparimāṇena
analyzed: patta parivāritam viya kesaram kesara parivāritā viya kaṇṇikā aṭṭha nāga sahassa parivārito  viya chaddantaḥ nāga rājā navuti haṃsa sahassa parivāritaḥ viya dhataraṭṭhaḥ haṃsa rājā  senaṅga parivāritaḥ viya cakkavatti maru gaṇa parivāritaḥ viya sakkaḥ devarājā brahma gaṇa parivāritaḥ  viya hārita mahā brahmā tārā gaṇa parivāritaḥ viya puṇṇa candaḥ asamena buddha vesena aparimāṇena
translated: surrounded by a retinue like a lotus by a surrounding ring of petals, like a jasmine flower by a surrounding ring of jasmine flowers, like the king of elephants by a thousand elephants,🔽like the king of geese by a flock of ninety thousand geese, like a universal monarch by his regents, like Sakka, king of the gods, by his retinue of gods, like the great Brahma Hārita by the hosts of Brahmas,

original: buddhavilāsena kapilavatthugamanamaggaṃ paṭipajji.
analyzed: buddha vilāsena kapilavatthu gamana maggam paṭipajji
translated: like the full moon by the stars, he set out on the road to Kapilavatthu with his incomparable Buddha-beauty and his immeasurable Buddha-glory.

original: Athassa puratthimakāyato suvaṇṇavaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā asītihatthaṭṭhānaṃ aggahesi.
analyzed: athassa puratthima kāyataḥ suvaṇṇa vaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā asīti hattha ṭṭhānam aggahesi
translated: Then from his front part a golden-colored ray shot forth and pervaded an area of eighty leagues.

original: Pacchimakāyato dakkhiṇahatthato, vāmahatthato suvaṇṇavaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā asītihatthaṭṭhānaṃ🔽aggahesi. Upari kesantato paṭṭhāya sabbakesāvattehi moragīvavaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā🔽gaganatale asītihatthaṭṭhānaṃ aggahesi. Heṭṭhā pādatalehi pavāḷavaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: pacchima kāyataḥ dakkhiṇa hatthataḥ vāma hatthataḥ suvaṇṇa vaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā asīti hattha ṭṭhānam  upari kesantato paṭṭhāya sabba kesāvattehi moragī vavaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā  gagana tale asīti hattha ṭṭhānam aggahesi heṭṭhā pāda talehi pavāḷa vaṇṇā rasmī uṭṭhahitvā
translated: From the back of his body, from his right hand, and from his left hand, golden-coloured rays issued forth and filled a space of eighty cubits.🔽From the top of his head, beginning from the hair-line, from all the hair-pores, peacock-coloured rays issued forth and filled a space of eighty cubits in the firmament.

original: ghanapathaviyaṃ asītihatthaṭṭhānaṃ aggahesi. Evaṃ samantā asītihatthamattaṃ ṭhānaṃ🔽chabbaṇṇā buddharasmiyo vijjotamānā vipphandamānā kañcanadaṇḍadīpikāhi niccharitvā
analyzed: ghana pathaviyam asīti hattha ṭṭhānam aggahesi evam samantā asīti hattha mattam ṭhānam  chabbaṇṇāḥ buddha rasmiyaḥ vijjotamānāḥ vipphandamānā kañcana daṇḍa dīpikāhi niccharitvā
translated: From the soles of his feet, ruby-coloured rays issued forth and filled a space of eighty cubits in the solid earth. Thus on all sides, a space of eighty cubits was filled

original: ākāsaṃ pakkhandajālā viya cātuddīpikamahāmeghato nikkhantavijjullatā viya vidhāviṃsu.
analyzed: ākāsam pakkhanda jālāḥ viya cātuddīpika mahā meghataḥ nikkhanta vijjullatāḥ viya vidhāviṃsu
translated: with the six-coloured rays of the Buddha, which shone and spread out like golden lamps hanging down from the sky, like lightning flashes issuing from a great cloud with four sources of rain.

original: Sabbadisābhāgā suvaṇṇacampakapupphehi vikiriyamānā viya, suvaṇṇaghaṭā nikkhantasuvaṇṇarasadhārāhi
analyzed: sabba disā bhāgā suvaṇṇa campaka pupphehi vikiriyamānā viya suvaṇṇa ghaṭā nikkhanta suvaṇṇa rasa dhārāhi
translated: All the directions were as if strewn with golden campaka flowers, as if golden streams were flowing from golden pitchers.

original: siñcamānā viya, pasāritasuvaṇṇapaṭaparikkhittā viya, verambhavātasamuṭṭhitakiṃsukakaṇikārapupphacuṇṇasamokiṇṇā viya vippakiriṃsu.
analyzed: siñcamānāḥ viya pasārita suvaṇṇa paṭa parikkhittāḥ viya verambha vāta samuṭṭhita kiṃsuka kaṇikāra puppha cuṇṇa samokiṇṇāḥ viya vippakiriṃsu
translated: and they seemed to sprinkle him, as if they were golden cloths spread out, as if they were covered with the pollen of the Kimsuka and Kanikara flowers stirred up by the Verambha wind.

original: Bhagavatopi asītianubyañjanabyāmappabhādvattiṃsavaralakkhaṇasamujjalaṃ sarīraṃ samuggatatārakaṃ
analyzed: bhagavataḥ pi asi iti anubyañjana byāma ppabhā advat tiṃsa vara lakkhaṇa samujjalam sarīram samuggata tārakam
translated: The body of the Blessed One, shining with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man and the eighty minor characteristics,

original: viya gaganatalaṃ, vikasitamiva padumavanaṃ, sabbapāliphullo viya yojanasatiko pāricchattako,
analyzed: viya gagana talam vikasitam iva paduma vanam sabba pāli phullaḥ viya yojana satikaḥ pāricchattako
translated: shone like the sky with the stars, like a lotus pond with the lotuses, like a coral tree with its blossoms,

original: paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapitānaṃ dvattiṃsūcandānaṃ dvattiṃsasūriyānaṃ dvattiṃsacakkavattīnaṃ
analyzed: paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapitānam dvattiṃsū candānam dvattiṃsa sūriyānam dvattiṃsa cakkavattīnam
translated: like the thirty-two moons, the thirty-two suns, the thirty-two world-rulers,🔽the thirty-two gods, the thirty-two great Brahmas, all combined, in splendor.

original: dvattiṃsadevarājānaṃ dvattiṃsamahābrahmānaṃ siriyā siriṃ abhibhavamānaṃ viya virocittha,
analyzed: dvattiṃsa devarājānam dvattiṃsa mahābrahmānam siriyā sirim abhibhavamānam viya virocittha
translated: It was adorned with the thirty-two perfections,

original: yathā taṃ dasahi pāramīhi dasahi upapāramīhi dasahi paramatthapāramīhi supūritāhi
analyzed: yathā tam dasahi pāramīhi dasahi upapāramīhi dasahi paramattha pāramīhi su pūritāhi
translated: which were fulfilled by the ten perfections, the ten minor perfections, and the ten ultimate perfections.

original: samatiṃsapāramitāhi alaṅkataṃ. Kappasatasahasādhikāni cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni dinnadānaṃ
analyzed: sama tiṃsa pāramitāhi alaṅkatam kappa sata sahasā adhikāni cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni dinna dānam
translated: For four incalculable ages and a hundred thousand eons, he gave gifts,

original: rakkhitasīlaṃ katakalyāṇakammaṃ ekasmiṃ attabhāve osaritvā vipākaṃ dātuṃ ṭhānaṃ alabhamānaṃ🔽sambādhapattaṃ viya ahosi. Nāvāsahassabhaṇḍaṃ ekanāvaṃ āropanakālo viya, sakaṭasahassabhaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: rakkhita sīlam kata kalyāṇa kammam ekasmin atta bhāve osaritvā vipākam dātum ṭhānam a labhamānam  sambādha pattam viya ahosi eka nāvam āropana kālaḥ viya sakaṭa sahassa bhaṇḍam
translated: and the good deeds he had done, were unable to find room to give their fruit in that existence,🔽and they were like a narrow passage. It was as if a thousand ships were being loaded on to one ship,

original: ekasakaṭaṃ āropanakālo viya, pañcavīsatiyā nadīnaṃ oghassa sambhijja mukhadvāre ekato🔽rāsībhūtakālo viya ca ahosi.
analyzed: eka sakaṭam āropana kālaḥ viya pañcavīsatiyā nadīnam oghassa sambhijja mukha dvāre ekatas  rāsībhūta kālaḥ ca ahosi
translated: as if a thousand carts were being loaded on to one cart, as if the flood of the twenty-five rivers, having been dammed up, were being released all together at the mouth of the river.

original: Imāya buddhasiriyā obhāsamānassāpi ca bhagavato purato anekāni daṇḍadīpikasahassāni
analyzed: imāya buddha siriyā obhāsamānassa api ca bhagavataḥ puratas anekāni daṇḍadīpika sahassāni
translated: And even though the Blessed One was shining with this glory of the Buddha, they raised many thousands of torches

original: ukkhipiṃsu. Tathā pacchato. Vāmapasse dakkhiṇapasse. Jātikusumacampakavanamallikarattuppalanīluppalamakulasinduvārapupphāni
analyzed: ukkhipiṃsu tathā pacchatas vāma passe dakkhiṇa passe jāti kusuma campaka vanamallika rattuppala nīluppala makula sinduvāra pupphāni
translated: in front of him, and likewise behind him, on the left and on the right. And they scattered flowers of the coral tree, the white cloud tree, the jasmine, the royal jasmine, the blue water lily, the white water lily, the honey tree, and the leadwort,

original: ceva nīlapītādivaṇṇasugandhagandhacuṇṇāni ca cātuddīpikameghavissaṭṭhodakavuṭṭhiyo
analyzed: ca iva nīla pīta ādi vaṇṇa sugandha gandha cuṇṇāni ca cātuddīpika megha vissaṭṭha udaka vuṭṭhiyaḥ
translated: and fragrant powders of blue, yellow, and other colors, as if they were showers of rain from clouds raining on the four continents.

original: viya vippakiriṃsu. Pañcaṅgikatūriyanigghosā ceva buddhadhammasaṅghaguṇappaṭisaṃyuttā
analyzed: viya pañcaṅgika tūriya nigghosā ca iva buddha dhamma saṅgha guṇa ppaṭisaṃyuttā
translated: And there was the sound of the five-part musical ensemble, and the virtues of the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha were proclaimed,

original: thutighosā ca sabbadisā pūrayiṃsu. Devamanussanāgasupaṇṇagandhabbayakkhādīnaṃ akkhīni
analyzed: thuti ghosā ca sabbadisā pūrayiṃsu deva manussa nāga supaṇṇa gandhabba yakkha ādīnam akkhīni
translated: and they filled all quarters with their shouts of praise. The eyes of gods, men, Nāgas, Supaṇṇas, Gandhabbas, Yakkhas, etc.,

original: amatapānaṃ viya labhiṃsu. Imasmiṃ pana ṭhāne ṭhatvā padasahassena gamanavaṇṇaṃ vattuṃ
analyzed: amata pānam viya labhiṃsu imasmin pana ṭhāne ṭhatvā pada sahassena gamana vaṇṇam vattum
translated: received as it were the drink of immortality. But it is not possible to describe the beauty of the going in a thousand verses, standing here.

original: vaṭṭati. Tatridaṃ mukhamattaṃ –
analyzed: vaṭṭati tatra idam mukha mattam
translated: Here is a mere beginning:

original: “Evaṃ sabbaṅgasampanno, kampayanto vasundharaṃ;
analyzed: evam kampayantaḥ vasundharam
translated: “Thus endowed with all limbs, shaking the earth,

original: Aheṭhayanto pāṇāni, yāti lokavināyako.
analyzed: a heṭhayantaḥ pāṇāni yāti loka vināyakaḥ
translated: without harming living beings, the Leader of the world goes.

original: Dakkhiṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ, uddharanto narāsabho;
analyzed: dakkhiṇam paṭhamam pādam uddharantaḥ narāsabhaḥ
translated: Raising his right foot first, the Best of Men,

original: Gacchanto sirisampanno, sobhate dvipaduttamo.
analyzed: gacchantaḥ siri sampannaḥ sobhate dvipad uttamaḥ
translated: going, endowed with glory, shines, the Best of bipeds.

original: Gacchato buddhaseṭṭhassa, heṭṭhā pādatalaṃ mudu;
analyzed: gacchataḥ buddha seṭṭhassa heṭṭhā pāda talam mudu
translated: Under the sole of the foot of the Best of Buddhas, who goes,

original: Samaṃ samphusate bhūmiṃ, rajasā nupalippati.
analyzed: samam samphusate bhūmim rajasā nu upalippati
translated: the soft earth is pressed down evenly, and is not covered with dust.

original: Ninnaṭṭhānaṃ unnamati, gacchante lokanāyake;
analyzed: ninna ṭṭhānam unnamati gacchante loka nāyake
translated: The low place rises up, when the Leader of the world goes;

original: Unnatañca samaṃ hoti, pathavī ca acetanā.
analyzed: unnatam ca samam pathavī ca acetanā
translated: and the high place becomes even, and the earth is without thought.

original: Pāsāṇā sakkharā ceva, kathalā khāṇukaṇṭakā;
analyzed: pāsāṇā sakkharā ca iva kathalā khāṇukaṇṭakā
translated: Stones and pebbles, and also stumps and thorns,

original: Sabbe maggā vivajjanti, gacchante lokanāyake.
analyzed: sabbe maggāḥ vivajjanti gacchante loka nāyake
translated: all avoid the road, when the Leader of the world goes.

original: Nātidūre uddharati, naccāsanne ca nikkhipaṃ;
analyzed: na atidūre uddharati na ca āsanne ca nikkhipaṃ
translated: He does not lift his feet too high, nor puts them down too far away.

original: Aghaṭṭayanto niyyāti, ubho jāṇū ca gopphake.
analyzed: a ghaṭṭayantaḥ niyyāti ubho jāṇū ca gopphake
translated: He does not go too fast, nor too slow, nor with his knees knocking together.

original: Nātisīghaṃ pakkamati, sampannacaraṇo muni;
analyzed: na ati sīgham pakkamati sampanna caraṇaḥ muni
translated: He does not go too fast, the sage with his well-developed feet.

original: Na cātisaṇikaṃ yāti, gacchamāno samāhito.
analyzed: na ca ati saṇikam yāti gacchamānaḥ samāhitaḥ
translated: Nor does he go too slow, going along with his mind concentrated.

original: Uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyaṃ, disañca vidisaṃ tathā;
analyzed: uddham adhas ca tiriyam disam ca vidisam tathā
translated: Upwards, downwards, and across, and in the directions and quarters,

original: Na pekkhamāno so yāti, yugamattamhi pekkhati.🔽Nāgavikkantacāro so, gamane sobhate jino;
analyzed: na pekkhamāno so yāti yuga mattamhi pekkhati  nāga vikkanta cāraḥ saḥ gamane sobhate jinaḥ
translated: He does not go looking around, but looks a plough-yoke’s length ahead.🔽He goes with the gait of an elephant, the Victorious One shines in his going.

original: Cāruṃ gacchati lokaggo, hāsayanto sadevake.
analyzed: cārum gacchati lokaggaḥ hāsayantaḥ sa devake
translated: The foremost in the world goes beautifully, making the world with its gods laugh.

original: Uḷurājāva sobhanto, catucārīva kesarī;
analyzed: catucārī iva kesarī
translated: Shining like the king of the stars, like a lion in the four directions,

original: Tosayanto bahū satte, puraṃ seṭṭhaṃ upāgamī”ti.
analyzed: tosayantaḥ bahū satte puram seṭṭham upāgami iti
translated: Satisfying many beings, he came to the best city.”

original: Vaṇṇakālo nāma kiresa, evaṃvidhesu kālesu buddhassa sarīravaṇṇe vā guṇavaṇṇe vā dhammakathikassa
analyzed: vaṇṇa kālaḥ nāma kiresa evaṃvidhesu kālesu buddhassa sarīra vaṇṇe vā guṇa vaṇṇe vā dhamma kathikassa
translated: The time for praise is this: at such times, in the Buddha’s bodily appearance or in the praise of his qualities, the preacher of the Dhamma

original: thāmoyeva pamāṇaṃ cuṇṇiyapadehi vā gāthābandhena vā yattakaṃ sakkoti, tattakaṃ vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: pamāṇam cuṇṇiya padehi vā gāthābandhena vā yattakam sakkoti tattakam vattabbam
translated: should measure his own strength, and he should speak as much as he is able, whether in prose or in verse.

original: Dukkathitanti na vattabbaṃ. Appamāṇavaṇṇā hi buddhā, tesaṃ buddhāpi anavasesato vaṇṇaṃ🔽vattuṃ asamatthā, pageva itarā pajāti. Iminā sirivilāsena alaṅkatappaṭiyattaṃ sakyarājapuraṃ
analyzed: dukkathitam ti na vattabbam appamāṇa vaṇṇāḥ hi buddhā tesam buddhā api anavasesataḥ vaṇṇam  vattum asamatthā pagā iva itarā iminā sirivilāsena alaṅkata paṭiyattam sakya rāja puram
translated: He should not be called “ill-spoken.” For the Buddhas are immeasurable in their beauty. Even the Buddhas themselves are unable to describe their beauty without exception, much less others.🔽Having entered the city of the Sakyan king, which was adorned and prepared with this splendor, the Blessed One,

original: pavisitvā bhagavā pasannacittena janena gandhadhūmavāsacuṇṇādīhi pūjayamāno santhāgāraṃ
analyzed: pavisitvā bhagavā pasanna cittena janena gandha dhūma vāsa cuṇṇa ādīhi pūjayamānaḥ santhāgāram
translated: being worshipped by the people with a serene mind with incense, incense smoke, scented powder, etc., entered the assembly hall.

original: pāvisi. Tena vuttaṃ – “atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghena
analyzed: pāvisi tena vuttam atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: Therefore it is said: “Then the Blessed One, having dressed and taking his bowl and robe,

original: yena evaṃ santhāgāraṃ tenupasaṅkamī”ti.
analyzed: yena evam santhāgāram tena upasaṅkamī iti
translated: approached the assembly hall together with the Sangha of bhikkhus.”

original: Bhagavantaṃyeva purakkhatvāti bhagavantaṃ purato katvā. Tattha bhagavā bhikkhūnañceva🔽upāsakānañca majjhe nisinno gandhodakena nhāpetvā dukūlacumbaṭakena vodakaṃ katvā
analyzed: bhagavantam yeva purakkhatvā iti bhagavantam puratas katvā tattha bhagavā bhikkhūnam ca iva  upāsakānam ca majjhe nisinnaḥ gandha udakena nhāpetvā dukūla cumbaṭakena vā udakam katvā
translated: Having placed the Blessed One in front: having made the Blessed One foremost. There, the Blessed One, sitting in the midst of the bhikkhus🔽and lay followers, after bathing with scented water, drying with a cotton cloth,

original: jātihiṅgulakena majjitvā rattakambalapaliveṭhite pīṭhe ṭhapitarattasuvaṇṇaghanapaṭimā
analyzed: jāti hiṅgulakena majjitvā ratta kambala paliveṭhite pīṭhe ṭhapita ratta suvaṇṇa ghana paṭimā
translated: anointing with jati-hingula, placing on a seat covered with a red blanket, a solid golden image

original: viya ativirocittha. Ayaṃ panettha porāṇānaṃ vaṇṇabhaṇanamaggo –
analyzed: viya ativirocittha ayam pana ittha porāṇānam vaṇṇa bhaṇana maggo
translated: This is the ancient description of the Buddha’s radiance:

original: “Gantvāna maṇḍalamāḷaṃ, nāgavikkantacaraṇo;
analyzed: gantvāna maṇḍalam āḷam nāga vikkanta caraṇaḥ
translated: “Having gone to the pavilion, he, the one with the gait of a majestic elephant,

original: Obhāsayanto lokaggo, nisīdi varamāsane.
analyzed: obhāsayantaḥ lokaggaḥ nisīdi varamāsane
translated: illuminating the world, sat down on the excellent seat.

original: Tasmiṃ nisinno naradammasārathi,
analyzed: tasmin nisinnaḥ nara damma sārathi
translated: The charioteer of men, sitting there,

original: Devātidevo satapuññalakkhaṇo;
translated: the god above the gods, the one with the marks of a hundred merits,

original: Buddhāsane majjhagato virocati,
analyzed: buddha āsane majjha gataḥ virocati
translated: in the middle of the Buddha’s seat, shines forth,

original: Suvaṇṇanekkhaṃ viya paṇḍukambale.
analyzed: suvaṇṇa nekkham viya paṇḍu kambale
translated: like a golden necklace on a white cloth.

original: Nekkhaṃ jambonadasseva, nikkhittaṃ paṇḍukambale;🔽Virocati vītamalo, maṇiverocano yathā.
analyzed: nekkham jambonadassa iva nikkhittam paṇḍu kambale  virocati vīta malaḥ maṇi verocanaḥ yathā
translated: A necklace of gold from the Jambu River, placed on a white cloth,🔽shines forth, stainless, like the light of a jewel.

original: Mahāsālova samphullo, nerurājāvalaṅkato;
analyzed: samphullaḥ
translated: Like a great sāla tree in full bloom, adorned with a garland of coral flowers,

original: Suvaṇṇayūpasaṅkāso, padumo kokanado yathā.
analyzed: suvaṇṇa yūpa saṅkāsaḥ padumaḥ kokanadaḥ yathā
translated: shining like a golden pillar, like a lotus or a kokanada flower.

original: Jalanto dīparukkhova, pabbatagge yathā sikhī;
analyzed: jalantaḥ dīpa rukkhaḥ uva pabbata agge yathā sikhī
translated: Shining like a lamp tree, like a flame on a mountain peak,

original: Devānaṃ pāricchattova, sabbaphullo virocathā”ti.
analyzed: devānam pāricchattaḥ uva sabba phullaḥ virocatha ati
translated: like the pāricchattaka of the gods, in full bloom, shines forth.”

original: Kāpilavatthave sakye bahudeva rattiṃ dhammiyā kathāyāti ettha dhammī kathā nāma santhāgāraanumodanappaṭisaṃyuttā
analyzed: kāpilavatthave sakye bahu deva rattim dhammiyā kathāyā ati ettha dhammī kathā nāma santhāgāra anumodana paṭisaṃyuttā
translated: “In the Sakyan town of Kapilavatthu, after spending much of the night instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the people with a Dhamma talk connected with the Āṭānāṭiya protection,” here, a Dhamma talk is a talk connected with the Āṭānāṭiya protection and with the expression of appreciation in the assembly hall.

original: pakiṇṇakakathā veditabbā. Tadā hi bhagavā ākāsagaṅgaṃ otārento viya pathavojaṃ ākaḍḍhanto
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka kathā veditabbā tadā hi bhagavā ākāsagaṅgam otārentaḥ viya pathavojam ākaḍḍhantaḥ
translated: The story of the “Miscellaneous Discourses” should be understood.

original: viya mahājambuṃ khandhe gahetvā cālento viya yojanikaṃ madhubhaṇḍaṃ cakkayantena
analyzed: viya mahā jambum khandhe gahetvā cālentaḥ viya yojanikam madhu bhaṇḍam cakkayantena
translated: For at that time the Blessed One, as if drawing the earth with a plough, as if shaking a great rose-apple tree, as if taking a yoke-bearing bull by the horns and shaking him, as if pressing a ten-league sugar-cane with a millstone,

original: pīḷetvā madhupānaṃ pāyamāno viya kāpilavatthavānaṃ sakyānaṃ hitasukhāvahaṃ pakiṇṇakakathaṃ
analyzed: pīḍetvā madhu pānam pāyamānaḥ viya kāpilavatthavānam sakyānam hita sukha āvaham pakiṇṇaka katham
translated: as if drinking honey with a drinking straw, gave the Sakyans of Kapilavatthu a discourse on the “Miscellaneous Discourses” that was conducive to welfare and happiness.

original: kathesi. “Āvāsadānaṃ nāmetaṃ mahārāja mahantaṃ, tumhākaṃ āvāso mayā paribhutto bhikkhusaṅghena
analyzed: kathesi āvāsadānam nāma etam mahā rāja mahantam tumhākam āvāsaḥ mayā paribhuttaḥ bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: “Great king, this gift of a dwelling is not great. Your dwelling has been used by me,

original: paribhutto mayā ca bhikkhusaṅghena ca paribhutto pana dhammaratanena paribhutto yevāti
analyzed: paribhuttaḥ mayā ca bhikkhu saṅghena ca paribhuttaḥ pana dhamma ratanena paribhuttaḥ yeva ati
translated: and it has been used by the Sangha of bhikkhus. But it has been used by the Dhamma Jewel and by me and by the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: tīhi ratanehi paribhutto nāma hoti. Āvāsadānasmiñhi dinne sabbadānaṃ dinnameva hoti.
analyzed: tīhi ratanehi paribhuttaḥ nāma hoti āvāsa dānasmin hi dinne sabba dānam dinnam eva hoti
translated: Thus it has been used by the Three Jewels. When a gift of a dwelling is given, all gifts are given.

original: Bhūmaṭṭhakapaṇṇasālāya vā sākhāmaṇḍapassa vāpi ānisaṃso nāma paricchindituṃ na sakkā”ti
analyzed: bhūmaṭṭhaka paṇṇasālāya vā sākhāmaṇḍapassa vā api ānisaṃsaḥ nāma paricchinditum na sakkā ati
translated: For when a dwelling is given, even if it be only a leaf hut or a hut of branches, the benefits are such that they cannot be measured.”

original: nānānayavicittaṃ bahuṃ dhammakathaṃ kathetvā –
analyzed: nānā naya vicittam bahum dhamma katham kathetvā
translated: After giving them a variety of edifying talks, he said:

original: “Sītaṃ uṇhaṃ paṭihanti, tato vāḷamigāni ca;
analyzed: sītam uṇham paṭihanti tatas vāḍamigāni ca
translated: “Cold and heat are warded off, and wild beasts as well,

original: Sarīsape ca makase, sisire cāpi vuṭṭhiyo.
analyzed: sarīsape ca makase sisire ca api
translated: And snakes and scorpions, and dew in wintertime.

original: Tato vātātapo ghoro, sañjāto paṭihaññati;
analyzed: tatas vāta ātapaḥ ghoro sañjātaḥ paṭihaññati
translated: And then the fierce hot winds are warded off,

original: Leṇatthañca sukhatthañca, jhāyituñca vipassituṃ.
analyzed: leṇattham ca sukhattham ca jhāyitum ca vipassitum
translated: For shelter’s sake and comfort’s sake, for jhana and insight’s sake.

original: Vihāradānaṃ saṅghassa, aggaṃ buddhena vaṇṇitaṃ;
analyzed: vihāra dānam saṅghassa aggam buddhena vaṇṇitam
translated: The gift of a dwelling to the Sangha, the Buddha has declared the best,

original: Tasmā hi paṇḍito poso, sampassaṃ atthamattano.
analyzed: tasmā hi paṇḍitaḥ posaḥ sampassam attham attano
translated: So a wise man, seeing his own good,

original: Vihāre kāraye ramme, vāsayettha bahussute;
analyzed: vihāre ramme vāsayettha bahu sute
translated: Should have a pleasant dwelling built, and there should dwell the learned.

original: Tesaṃ annañca pānañca, vatthasenāsanāni ca.
analyzed: tesam annam ca pānam ca vattha senāsanāni ca
translated: And he should give them food and drink, and clothes, and lodging too,

original: Dadeyya ujubhūtesu, vippasannena cetasā;
analyzed: dadeyya uju bhūtesu vippasannena cetasā
translated: With a mind of perfect purity to those who are upright and sincere.

original: Te tassa dhammaṃ desenti, sabbadukkhāpanūdanaṃ;
analyzed: te tassa dhammam desenti sabba dukkha apanūdanam
translated: They will teach him the Dhamma that removes all suffering,

original: Yaṃ so dhammaṃ idhaññāya, parinibbāti anāsavo”ti. –🔽Evaṃ ayampi āvāse ānisaṃso, ayampi ānisaṃsoti bahudevarattiṃ atirekataraṃ diyaḍḍhayāmaṃ
analyzed: yam saḥ dhammam idhaññāya parinibbāti anāsavaḥ ti  evam ayam pi āvāse ānisaṃsaḥ ayam pi ānisaṃsaḥ uti bahu deva rattim atirekataram diyaḍḍha yāmam
translated: And having understood the Dhamma here, he attains extinction, untainted.”🔽Thus the benefits of a dwelling are also these:

original: āvāsānisaṃsakathaṃ kathesi. Tattha imā gāthāva saṅgahaṃ āruḷhā, pakiṇṇakadhammadesanā
analyzed: āvāsa anisaṃsa katham kathesi tattha imāḥ gāthā ava saṅgaham āruḷhā pakiṇṇaka dhamma desanā
translated: For more than half the night he spoke on the benefits of a dwelling. Herein, these verses are included: The teaching of the miscellaneous Dhamma

original: pana saṅgahaṃ na ārohati. Sandassesītiādīni vuttatthāneva.🔽Āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesīti dhammakathaṃ kathāpetukāmo jānāpesi. Atha kasmā sāriputtamahāmoggallānamahākassapādīsu
analyzed: pana saṅgaham na ārohati sandassesi iti ādīni vutta tthāni eva  āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi iti dhamma katham kathā petu kāmaḥ jānāpesi atha kasmā sāriputta mahāmoggallāna mahākassapādīsu
translated: but he did not rise to the occasion. The meaning of the words “he addressed” and so on is already given.

original: asītimahātheresu vijjamānesu bhagavā ānandattherassa bhāramakāsīti. Parisajjhāsayavasena.🔽Āyasmā hi ānando bahussutānaṃ aggo, pahosi parimaṇḍalehi padabyañjanehi madhuradhammakathaṃ
analyzed: asīti mahā theresu vijjamānesu bhagavā ānanda therassa bhāram akāsi iti parisajjhāsaya vasena  āyasmā hi ānandaḥ bahu sutānam aggaḥ pahosi parimaṇḍalehi pada byañjanehi madhura dhamma katham
translated: He addressed the venerable Ananda: he made him understand, desiring to have a talk on the True Idea. But why did the Blessed One make the venerable Ananda bear the burden when eighty great elders such as the venerable Sariputta, the venerable Maha Moggallana, the venerable Maha Kassapa,🔽were available? On the ground of the disposition of the audience.🔽For the venerable Ananda was foremost among those who were learned, and he was well known and famous for expounding the True Idea with its text and its word-commentary in a way that was sweet to the ear.

original: kathetunti sākiyamaṇḍale pākaṭo paññāto. Tassa sakyarājūhi vihāraṃ gantvāpi dhammakathā
analyzed: kathetum ti sākiya maṇḍale pākaṭaḥ paññāto tassa sakya rājūhi vihāram gantvā api dhamma kathā
translated: So the Sakyan princes went to the monastery and heard the Dhamma talk.

original: sutapubbā, orodhā pana nesaṃ na yathāruciyā vihāraṃ gantuṃ labhanti, tesaṃ etadahosi
analyzed: suta pubbāḥ orodhāḥ pana nesam na yathāruciyā vihāram gantum labhanti tesam etat ahosi
translated: But the Sakyan princesses could not go to the monastery as they wished, and they thought,

original: – “aho vata bhagavā appaṃyeva dhammakathaṃ kathetvā amhākaṃ ñātiseṭṭhassa ānandassa
analyzed: aho vata bhagavā dhamma katham kathetvā amhākam ñāti seṭṭhassa ānandassa
translated: “Oh, if the Blessed One would give us a little Dhamma talk and make our kinsman’s kinsman, the venerable Ananda,

original: bhāraṃ kareyyā”ti. Tesaṃ ajjhāsayavasena bhagavā tasseva bhāramakāsi.
analyzed: bhāram kareyya iti tesam ajjhāsaya vasena bhagavā tassa iva bhāram akāsi
translated: bear the burden!” The Blessed One made him bear the burden on the ground of their disposition.

original: Sekho pāṭipadoti paṭipannako sekhasamaṇo. So tuyhaṃ paṭibhātu upaṭṭhātu, tassa paṭipadaṃ🔽desehīti paṭipadāya puggalaṃ niyametvā dasseti. Kasmā pana bhagavā imaṃ paṭipadaṃ🔽niyamesi? Bahūhi kāraṇehi. Ime tāva sakyā maṅgalasālāya maṅgalaṃ paccāsīsanti vaḍḍhiṃ🔽icchanti, ayañca sekhapaṭipadā mayhaṃ sāsane maṅgalapaṭipadā vaḍḍhamānakapaṭipadātipi
analyzed: sekhaḥ pāṭipadaḥ ti paṭipannakaḥ sekha samaṇo so tuyham paṭibhātu upaṭṭhātu tassa paṭipadam  desehi iti paṭipadāya puggalam niyametvā dasseti kasmai pana bhagavā imam paṭipadam  bahūhi kāraṇehi ime tāva sakyāḥ maṅgala sālāya maṅgalam vaḍḍhim  icchanti ayam ca sekha paṭipadā sāsane maṅgala paṭipadā vaḍḍhamānaka paṭipadā atipi
translated: “The learner, the one on the way” is the one who has entered upon the way, the trainee bhikkhu. “Let it be clear to you, let it be evident to you, let it be plain to you” : he shows the person in the way by specifying the way. But why did the Blessed One specify this way? For many reasons. For a start, these Sakyans are seeking good fortune in the auspicious hall and are hoping for prosperity. And this learner’s way is a way of good fortune in my Dispensation, a way that prospers.🔽🔽

original: imaṃ paṭipadaṃ niyamesi. Tassañca parisati sekhāva bahū nisinnā, te attanā paṭividdhaṭṭhāne🔽kathīyamāne akilamantāva sallakkhessantītipi imaṃ paṭipadaṃ niyamesi. Āyasmā ca ānando🔽sekhapaṭisambhidāpattova, so attanā paṭividdhe paccakkhaṭṭhāne kathento akilamanto🔽viññāpetuṃ sakkhissatītipi imaṃ paṭipadaṃ niyamesi. Sekhapaṭipadāya ca tissopi sikkhā
analyzed: imam paṭipadam niyamesi tassan ca parisati sekhāva bahū nisinnā te attanā paṭividdha ṭṭhāne 🔽kathīyamāne imam paṭipadam niyamesi āyasmā ca ānando 🔽sekha paṭisambhidā patto va so attanā paṭividdhe paccakkha ṭṭhāne kathentaḥ a kilamanto 🔽viññāpetum sakkhissati iti pi imam paṭipadam niyamesi sekha paṭipadāya ca tissaḥ api sikkhā
translated: “The learner, the one on the path” is the one who has entered upon the way, the learner, the monk. “Let it occur to you to teach him the way” means “Let it occur to you to teach the way to him.” He shows that he is referring to the person by way of the way. But why did the Blessed One refer to this way? For many reasons. For these Sakyans are seeking a blessing in the auspicious hall and are wishing for prosperity. And this learner’s way is a way of blessing in my dispensation, a way of prosperity. For this reason he referred to this way. And in that assembly there were many learners seated. If he were to speak about the stage he himself had penetrated, they would be perplexed. For this reason he referred to this way. And the venerable Ananda had attained only the learner’s discrimination of perspicuity. If he were to speak about the stage he himself had penetrated, he would be perplexed. For this reason the Blessed One referred to this way. And the three trainings are included in the learner’s way.

original: osaṭā, tattha adhisīlasikkhāya kathitāya sakalaṃ vinayapiṭakaṃ kathitameva hoti,🔽adhicittasikkhāya kathitāya sakalaṃ suttantapiṭakaṃ kathitaṃ hoti, adhipaññāsikkhāya
analyzed: osaṭā tattha adhi sīla sikkhāya kathitāya sakalam vinaya piṭakam kathitam eva hoti  adhi citta sikkhāya kathitāya sakalam suttanta piṭakam kathitam hoti adhi paññā sikkhāya
translated: When the training in the higher virtue is expounded, the entire Vinaya Piṭaka is expounded.🔽When the training in the higher consciousness is expounded, the entire Sutta Piṭaka is expounded. When the training in the higher wisdom is expounded, the entire Abhidhamma Piṭaka is expounded.

original: kathitāya sakalaṃ abhidhammapiṭakaṃ kathitaṃ hoti, ānando ca bahussuto tipiṭakadharo,
analyzed: kathitāya sakalam abhidhamma piṭakam kathitam hoti ānandaḥ ca bahussuto ti piṭaka dharo
translated: Ānanda is a man of great learning, a master of the three Piṭakas.

original: so pahoti tīhi piṭakehi tisso sikkhā kathetuṃ, evaṃ kathite sakyānaṃ maṅgalameva
analyzed: saḥ pahoti tīhi piṭakehi tissaḥ sikkhāḥ kathetum evam kathite sakyānam maṅgalam eva
translated: He is able to expound the three trainings with the three Piṭakas. If this is done, the Sakyans’ good fortune and prosperity will increase.”

original: vaḍḍhiyeva bhavissatītipi imaṃ paṭipadaṃ niyamesi.
analyzed: vaḍḍhiyā iva bhavissati itipi imam paṭipadam niyamesi
translated: He also laid down this rule of conduct:🔽“My back aches” : Why did it ache?

original: Piṭṭhi me āgilāyatīti kasmā āgilāyati? Bhagavato hi chabbassāni padhānaṃ padahantassa
analyzed: me āgilāyati iti kasmai āgilāyati bhagavataḥ hi chabbassāni padhānam padahantassa
translated: For six years the Blessed One was engaged in austerities.

original: mahantaṃ kāyadukkhaṃ ahosi, athassa aparabhāge mahallakakāle piṭṭhivāto uppajji.
analyzed: mahantam kāya dukkham ahosi athassa aparabhāge mahallaka kāle piṭṭhivātaḥ uppajji
translated: As a result of that, in his later years, he suffered from a back wind.

original: Akāraṇaṃ vā etaṃ. Pahoti hi bhagavā uppannaṃ vedanaṃ vikkhambhetvā ekampi dvepi sattāhe
analyzed: akāraṇam vā etam pahoti hi bhagavā uppannam vedanam vikkhambhetvā ekam pi dve pi sattāhe
translated: Or this may be taken as a mere statement of fact. For the Blessed One was able to suppress any arising of feeling by his own mind. He could remain in that state for one or two weeks,

original: ekapallaṅkena nisīdituṃ. Santhāgārasālaṃ pana catūhi iriyāpathehi paribhuñjitukāmo
analyzed: eka pallaṅkena nisīditum santhā āgāra sālam pana catūhi iriyāpathehi paribhuñjitu kāmaḥ
translated: and to sit cross-legged. But he wanted to use the rest-house by all the four postures,

original: ahosi, tattha pādadhovanaṭṭhānato yāva dhammāsanā agamāsi, ettake ṭhāne gamanaṃ nipphannaṃ.
analyzed: ahosi tattha pāda dhovana ṭṭhānato yāva dhamma āsanā agamāsi ettake ṭhāne gamanam nipphannam
translated: so he went from the foot-washing place up to the Dhamma seat. The going was accomplished in that place.

original: Dhammāsanaṃ patto thokaṃ ṭhatvā nisīdi, ettake ṭhānaṃ. Diyaḍḍhayāmaṃ dhammāsane nisīdi,
analyzed: dhammāsanam patto thokam ṭhatvā nisīdi ettake ṭhānam diyaḍḍha yāmam dhammāsane nisīdi
translated: He sat down on the Dhamma seat, and after standing for a little while he sat down. The sitting was accomplished in that place. He sat on the Dhamma seat for two and a half watches of the night,

original: ettake ṭhāne nisajjā nipphannā. Idāni dakkhiṇena passena thokaṃ nipanne sayanaṃ nipphajjissatīti
analyzed: ettake ṭhāne nisajjā nipphannā idāni dakkhiṇena passena thokam nipanne sayanam nipphajjissati iti
translated: and the lying down was accomplished in that place. Now, if he were to lie down a little on his right side, the lying down would be accomplished.

original: evaṃ catūhi iriyāpathehi paribhuñjitukāmo ahosi. Upādinnakasarīrañca nāma “no āgilāyatī”ti
analyzed: evam catūhi iriyāpathehi paribhuñjitu kāmaḥ ahosi upādinnaka sarīram ca nāma no āgilāyati iti
translated: So he wanted to use it by all the four postures. But a body that is appropriated cannot be said to be “uncomfortable,”

original: na vattabbaṃ, tasmā ciraṃ nisajjāya sañjātaṃ appakampi āgilāyanaṃ gahetvā evamāha.
analyzed: na vattabbam tasmā ciram nisajjāya sañjātam appakampi āgilāyanam gahetvā evam āha
translated: so he said this, taking the slight discomfort that arose from sitting so long as a reason.

original: Saṅghāṭiṃ paññāpetvāti santhāgārassa kira ekapasse te rājāno paṭṭasāṇiṃ parikkhipāpetvā
analyzed: saṅghāṭim paññāpetvā ti santhāgārassa kira eka passe te rājānaḥ paṭṭa sāṇim parikkhipāpetvā
translated: And he arranged his outer robe: it seems that on one side of the rest-house the kings had a curtain hung,

original: kappiyamañcakaṃ paññapetvā kappiyapaccattharaṇena attharitvā upari suvaṇṇa-tāraka-gandhamālā-dāmapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ🔽vitānaṃ bandhitvā gandhatelappadīpaṃ āropayiṃsu “appeva nāma satthā dhammāsanato🔽vuṭṭhāya thokaṃ vissamanto idha nipajjeyya, evaṃ no imaṃ santhāgāraṃ bhagavatā catūhi
analyzed: kappiya mañcakam paññapetvā kappiya paccattharaṇena attharitvā upari suvaṇṇa tāraka gandha mālā dāma paṭimaṇḍitam  vitānam bandhitvā gandha tela ppadīpam āropayiṃsu appā iva nāma satthā dhamma āsanataḥ  vuṭṭhāya thokam vissamantaḥ idha nipajjeyya evam no imam santhāgāram bhagavatā catūhi
translated: having prepared a suitable bed, having covered it with a suitable coverlet, having hung up a canopy decorated with golden stars,🔽having lit a perfumed oil lamp, (thinking): “Perhaps the Teacher, having come down from the Dhamma seat,🔽will rest here for a while”, in this way our meeting hall will have been used by the Fortunate One,🔽and we will have great merit.

original: iriyāpathehi paribhuttaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissatī”ti. Satthāpi tadeva🔽sandhāya tattha saṅghāṭiṃ paññapetvā nipajji. Uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvāti ettakaṃ
analyzed: iriyāpathehi paribhuttam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya bhavissati iti satthā api tat eva  sandhāya tattha saṅghāṭim paññapetvā nipajji uṭṭhāna saññam manasi karitvā ati ettakam
translated: and they spread out a couch with the right side uppermost, and they hung up a canopy over it, and they put a lamp of fragrant oil underneath it, thinking, “Perhaps the Teacher, rising from his seat of preaching, will rest awhile and lie down here,” and thus the meeting-hall would be used by the Buddha in all four postures, and would be for their welfare and happiness for a long time. The Teacher, thinking of this, spread out his outer robe and lay down.

original: kālaṃ atikkamitvā vuṭṭhahissāmīti vuṭṭhānasaññaṃ citte ṭhapetvā.
analyzed: kālam atikkamitvā vuṭṭhahissāmi iti vuṭṭhāna saññam citte ṭhapetvā
translated: “Having set up the perception of rising”: thinking, “After so much time has passed, I will rise up,” he set up the perception of rising in his mind.

original: 23. Mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ āmantesīti so kira tasmiṃ kāle tassaṃ parisati jeṭṭhako pāmokkho,
analyzed: mahānāmam sakkam āmantesi iti saḥ kira tasmin kāle jeṭṭhakaḥ pāmokkho
translated: “He addressed the Sakyan Mahānāma”: it seems that at that time he was the most senior and foremost in that assembly,

original: tasmiṃ saṅgahite sesaparisā saṅgahitāva hotīti thero tameva āmantesi. Sīlasampannoti
analyzed: tasmin saṅgahite sesa parisā saṅgahitā ava hoti iti theraḥ tam eva āmantesi sīla sampannaḥ ti
translated: and when he was included the rest of the assembly was included as well, so the Elder addressed him. “Endowed with virtue”:

original: sīlena sampanno, sampannasīlo paripuṇṇasīloti attho. Saddhammehīti sundaradhammehi,
analyzed: sīlena sampannaḥ sampanna sīlo paripuṇṇa sīlo ti attho saddhammehi iti sundara dhammehi
translated: “Endowed with virtue” : his virtue is fulfilled, is what is meant. “In the good Dhamma” : in the good qualities of the noble ones,

original: sataṃ vā sappurisānaṃ dhammehi.
analyzed: satam vā sappurisānam dhammehi
translated: or in the Dhamma of the hundred noble persons.

original: 24. Kathañca mahānāmāti iminā ettakena ṭhānena sekhapaṭipadāya mātikaṃ ṭhapetvā paṭipāṭiyā🔽vitthāretukāmo evamāha. Tattha sīlasampannotiādīni “sampannasīlā, bhikkhave, viharathā”ti
analyzed: kathañca mahānāmā ati iminā ettakena ṭhānena sekha paṭipadāya mātikam ṭhapetvā paṭipāṭiyā  vitthāretu kāmaḥ evam āha tattha sīla sampannaḥ ti ādīni sampanna sīlāḥ bhikkhave viharatha ati
translated: “And how, Mahānāma?” : here the Blessed One, having set forth the basic pattern of the disciple’s progress up to this point,🔽now wishes to explain it in detail in the reverse order.

original: ākaṅkheyyasuttādīsu vuttanayeneva veditabbāni.🔽25. Kāyaduccaritenātiādīsu upayogatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, hiriyitabbāni kāyaduccaritādīni🔽hiriyati jigucchatīti attho. Ottappaniddese hetvatthe karaṇavacanaṃ, kāyaduccaritādīhi
analyzed: ākaṅkheyya sutta ādīsu vutta nayena iva veditabbāni  kāya duccaritena ati ādīsu upayoga atthe karaṇa vacanam kāya duccarita ādīni  hiriyati jigucchati iti atthaḥ ottappa niddese hetu atthe karaṇa vacanam kāya duccarita ādīhi
translated: “Endowed with virtue” and so on should be understood in the way stated in the Ākaṅkheyya-sutta and so on .🔽“Bodily misconduct” and so on: the gerundive is used in the sense of instrument. The meaning is: he is ashamed of, he is disgusted with, bodily misconduct, etc.🔽In the description of conscience, the gerundive is used in the sense of cause. The meaning is: he is afraid of, he is frightened of, bodily misconduct, etc.,

original: ottappassa hetubhūtehi ottappati bhāyatīti attho. Āraddhavīriyoti paggahitavīriyo
analyzed: ottappassa hetu bhūtehi ottappati bhāyati iti attho āraddha vīriyaḥ ti paggahita vīriyaḥ
translated: which are the causes of conscience. “Endowed with energy” : his energy is exerted,

original: anosakkitamānaso. Pahānāyāti pahānatthāya. Upasampadāyāti paṭilābhatthāya. Thāmavāti
analyzed: anosakkita mānasaḥ pahānāya ati pahāna atthāya upasampadāya ati paṭilābha atthāya thām avāti
translated: his mind is not slack. “For the abandoning” : for the purpose of abandoning. “For the realization” : for the purpose of obtaining.

original: vīriyathāmena samannāgato. Daḷhaparakkamoti thiraparakkamo. Anikkhittadhuro kusalesu
analyzed: vīriya thāmena samannāgataḥ daḷha parakkamo ti thira parakkamaḥ a nikkhitta dhuraḥ kusalesu
translated: He is endowed with energy that is strenuous. He is of steadfast endeavour: his endeavour is firm. He is not cast down: he is not depressed.🔽He is not lacking in resoluteness: he is not lacking in the resolution to undertake the profitable.

original: dhammesūti kusalesu dhammesu anoropitadhuro anosakkitavīriyo. Paramenāti uttamena.
analyzed: dhammesu uti kusalesu dhammesu anoropita dhuraḥ anosakkita vīriyo paramena ati uttamena
translated: He is of the highest: he is of the supreme.🔽He is possessed of full awareness and possesses full understanding: he is possessed of full awareness and he possesses full understanding.

original: Satinepakkenāti satiyā ca nipakabhāvena ca. Kasmā pana satibhājaniye paññā āgatāti?
analyzed: sati nepakkena ati satiyā ca nipaka bhāvena ca kasmā pana sati bhājaniye paññā āgatā ti
translated: But why is understanding, which is included among the faculties, etc., mentioned here?

original: Satiyā balavabhāvadīpanatthaṃ. Paññāvippayuttā hi sati dubbalā hoti, sampayuttā balavatīti.
analyzed: satiyāḥ balava bhāva dīpana ttham paññā vippayuttā hi sati dubbalā hoti sampayuttā balavatī iti
translated: In order to show the strength of mindfulness. For mindfulness without understanding is weak, but with understanding it is strong.

original: Cirakatampīti attanā vā parena vā kāyena cirakataṃ cetiyaṅgaṇavattādi asīti mahāvattapaṭipattipūraṇaṃ.
analyzed: cirakatam pi iti attanā vā parena vā kāyena cirakatam asi iti mahāvatta paṭipatti pūraṇam
translated: Long since: either by himself or by others, long since done by body, such things as paying homage at shrines and monasteries, and fulfilling the duties of the ten-day period, etc.

original: Cirabhāsitampīti attanā vā parena vā vācāya cirabhāsitaṃ sakkaccaṃ uddisana-uddisāpana-dhammosāraṇa-dhammadesanā-upanisinnakathā-anumodaniyādivasena
analyzed: cira bhāsitam pi iti attanā vā parena vā vācāya cira bhāsitam sakkaccam uddisana auddisāpana dhamma usāraṇa dhamma desanā upanisinna kathā anumoda niyā ādi vasena
translated: Long since spoken: either by himself or by others, long since spoken by speech, such verbal acts as reciting the scriptures, giving teachings, holding discussions, and expressing appreciation, etc.

original: pavattitaṃ vacīkammaṃ. Saritā anussaritāti tasmiṃ kāyena cirakate “kāyo nāma kāyaviññatti,
analyzed: pavattitam vacī kammam saritā anussaritā ati tasmin kāyena cirakate kāyaḥ nāma kāya viññatti
translated: Remembering, recollecting: in regard to what has been done by body long since, “The body is bodily intimation,

original: cirabhāsite vācā nāma vacīviññatti. Tadubhayampi rūpaṃ, taṃsamuṭṭhāpikā cittacetasikā
analyzed: cira bhāsite vācā nāma vacī viññatti tad ubhayam pi rūpam tad samuṭṭhāpikā citta cetasikā
translated: The speech called “vocal intimation” is the sound that is the mode of intimation by body and by speech. Both these are materiality. The consciousness and the states that originate it are immaterial.

original: arūpaṃ. Iti ime rūpārūpadhammā evaṃ uppajjitvā evaṃ niruddhā”ti sarati ceva anussarati
analyzed: arūpam iti ime rūpa arūpa dhammāḥ evam uppajjitvā evam niruddhā ati sarati ca iva anussarati
translated: So he remembers and recollects thus: ‘These states, material and immaterial, arose in such a way and ceased in such a way.’🔽The meaning is that he generates the enlightenment factor of mindfulness.

original: ca, satisambojjhaṅgaṃ samuṭṭhāpetīti attho. Bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpikā hi sati idha adhippetā.
analyzed: ca sati sambojjhaṅgam samuṭṭhāpeti iti atthaḥ bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpikā hi satī idha adhippetā
translated: For it is mindfulness that generates the enlightenment factors that is intended here.

original: Tāya satiyā esa sakimpi saraṇena saritā, punappunaṃ saraṇena anussaritāti veditabbā.
analyzed: tāya satiyā esa sakimpi saraṇena saritā punappunam saraṇena anussaritā iti veditabbā
translated: He should be understood as one who remembers by remembering once and recollects by recollecting again and again.

original: Udayatthagāminiyāti pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ udayavayagāminiyā udayañca vayañca paṭivijjhituṃ
analyzed: udaya ttha gāminiyā ti pañcannam khandhānam udaya vaya gāminiyā udayam ca vayam ca paṭivijjhitum
translated: With insight into rise and fall: with insight that is able to penetrate the rise and fall of the five aggregates.

original: samatthāya. Ariyāyāti vikkhambhanavasena ca samucchedavasena ca kilesehi ārakā ṭhitāya
analyzed: samatthāya ariyāya ati vikkhambhana vasena ca samuccheda vasena ca kilesehi ārakā ṭhitāya
translated: With the noble truth of suffering: with the clear comprehension that is established far away from defilements by way of abandoning and by way of eradication.

original: parisuddhāya. Paññāya samannāgatoti vipassanāpaññāya ceva maggapaññāya ca samaṅgībhūto.🔽Nibbedhikāyāti sāyeva nibbijjhanato nibbedhikāti vuccati, tāya samannāgatoti attho.
analyzed: parisuddhāya paññāya samannāgataḥ ti vipassanā paññāya ca iva magga paññāya ca samaṅgībhūtaḥ 🔽nibbedhikāya ati sāya iva nibbijjhanataḥ nibbedhikā ati vuccati tāya samannāgataḥ ti attho
translated: Endowed with the knowledge of their ending: endowed with the insight that is able to penetrate the ending of the five aggregates.🔽With the noble truth of the cessation of suffering: with the clear comprehension that is established far away from defilements by way of abandoning and by way of eradication.🔽Endowed with the knowledge and vision of things as they really are: endowed with the insight that is able to penetrate the way leading to the cessation of the five aggregates.

original: Tattha maggapaññāya samucchedavasena anibbiddhapubbaṃ apadālitapubbaṃ lobhakkhandhaṃ
analyzed: tattha magga paññāya samuccheda vasena a nibbiddha pubbam a padālita pubbam lobha kkhandham
translated: Herein, the path understanding is penetrating in the sense of cutting off, since it cuts off and penetrates the greed aggregate, etc., which have not been penetrated and cut off before.

original: dosakkhandhaṃ mohakkhandhaṃ nibbijjhati padāletīti nibbedhikā. Vipassanāpaññāya tadaṅgavasena
analyzed: dosa kkhandham moha kkhandham nibbijjhati padāleti iti nibbedhikā vipassanā paññāya tad aṅga vasena
translated: Insight is penetrating in the sense of a condition by a factor of conditionality,

original: nibbedhikāya maggapaññāya paṭilābhasaṃvattanato cāti vipassanā “nibbedhikā”ti vattuṃ🔽vaṭṭati. Sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyāti idhāpi maggapaññā “sammā hetunā nayena vaṭṭadukkhaṃ
analyzed: nibbedhikāya magga paññāya paṭilābha saṃvattanato ca ati vipassanā nibbedhikā iti vattum  vaṭṭati sammā dukkha khaya gāminiyā ti idha api magga paññā sammā hetunā nayena vaṭṭa dukkham
translated: and it is also so called because it leads to the acquisition of path understanding that is penetrating in the sense of cutting off.🔽“Correctly leads to the destruction of suffering”: here too path understanding is called “correctly leading to the destruction of suffering” because it goes by the right means, by the right method, destroying suffering in the round of rebirths.

original: khepayamānā gacchatīti sammā dukkhakkhayagāminī nāma. Vipassanā tadaṅgavasena vaṭṭadukkhañca🔽kilesadukkhañca khepayamānā gacchatīti dukkhakkhayagāminī. Dukkhakkhayagāminiyā vā
analyzed: khepayamānā gacchati iti sammā dukkha kkhaya gāminī nāma vipassanā tad aṅga vasena vaṭṭa dukkham ca  kilesa dukkhañca khepayamānā gacchati iti dukkha khaya gāminī dukkha khaya gāminiyā vā
translated: Insight is called “leading to the destruction of suffering” because it goes destroying suffering in the round of rebirths and the suffering of defilements by a factor of conditionality.

original: maggapaññāya paṭilābhasaṃvattanato esā dukkhakkhayagāminī”ti veditabbā.
analyzed: magga paññāya paṭilābha saṃvattanato esā dukkha kkhaya gāminī iti veditabbā
translated: Or it should be understood that it is called “leading to the destruction of suffering” because it leads to the acquisition of path understanding that is “leading to the destruction of suffering.”🔽“To the higher wisdoms”: the higher mind is the best mind, the mind of the noble ones.

original: 26. Abhicetasikānanti abhicittaṃ seṭṭhacittaṃ sitānaṃ nissitānaṃ. Diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānanti
analyzed: abhicetasikānam ti abhicittam seṭṭha cittam sitānam nissitānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam
translated: “To a pleasant dwelling in this very life”:

original: appitappitakkhaṇe sukhapaṭilābhahetūnaṃ. Nikāmalābhīti icchiticchitakkhaṇe samāpajjitā.
analyzed: appita ppita khaṇe sukha paṭilābha hetūnam nikāma lābhī iti icchiticchita khaṇe samāpajjitā
translated: and the conditions for the acquisition of pleasure are available whenever he wants them.🔽He is one who obtains them without trouble, without difficulty.

original: Akicchalābhīti nidukkhalābhī. Akasiralābhīti vipulalābhī. Paguṇabhāvena eko icchiticchitakkhaṇe🔽samāpajjituṃ sakkoti, samādhipāripanthikadhamme pana akilamanto vikkhambhetuṃ na
analyzed: a kiccha lābhī iti nidukkha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti vipula lābhī paguṇa bhāvena ekaḥ icchiti chita khaṇe  samāpajjitum sakkoti samādhi pāripanthika dhamme pana a kilamantaḥ vikkhambhetum na
translated: He is one who obtains them without delay, without lingering.🔽By virtue of his proficiency he is able to attain whenever he wants. But he is unable, without exerting himself, to suppress the things that counter concentration.

original: sakkoti, so attano anicchāya khippameva vuṭṭhāti, yathāparicchedavasena samāpattiṃ🔽ṭhapetuṃ na sakkoti ayaṃ kicchalābhī kasiralābhī nāma. Eko icchiticchitakkhaṇe ca
analyzed: sakkoti saḥ attanaḥ anicchāya khippam eva vuṭṭhāti yathā pariccheda vasena samāpattim  ṭhapetum na sakkoti ayam kiccha lābhī kasira lābhī nāma ekaḥ icchiti chita khaṇe ca
translated: He emerges quickly, unwillingly, unable to prolong the attainment as long as he would wish. He is one who obtains them with trouble, with difficulty.🔽He is one who obtains them with delay, with lingering.

original: samāpajjituṃ sakkoti, samādhipāripanthikadhamme ca akilamanto vikkhambheti, so yathāparicchedavaseneva
analyzed: samāpajjitum sakkoti samādhi pāripanthika dhamme ca a kilamantaḥ vikkhambheti saḥ yathā pariccheda vasena iva
translated: By virtue of his proficiency he is able to attain whenever he wants. And he is able, without exerting himself, to suppress the things that counter concentration.🔽He emerges willingly, able to prolong the attainment as long as he would wish. He is one who obtains them without trouble, without difficulty.

original: vuṭṭhātuṃ sakkoti, ayaṃ akicchalābhī akasiralābhī nāma.
analyzed: vuṭṭhātum sakkoti ayam a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī nāma
translated: He is one who obtains them without delay, without lingering.

original: 27. Ayaṃ vuccati mahānāma ariyasāvako sekho pāṭipadoti mahānāma ariyasāvako sekho
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahā nāma ariya sāvako sekho mahā nāma ariya sāvako sekho
translated: He is called a noble disciple in training, Mahānāma, who is practising the way,

original: pāṭipado vipassanāgabbhāya vaḍḍhamānakapaṭipadāya samannāgatoti vuccatīti dasseti.
analyzed: pāṭipadaḥ vipassanā gabbhāya vaḍḍhamānaka paṭipadāya samannāgataḥ iti vuccati iti dasseti
translated: He shows that he is endowed with the “path-footing” which is the “womb” of insight, the “developing” way.🔽“Not rotten”: not putrid.

original: Apuccaṇḍatāyāti apūtiaṇḍatāya. Bhabbo abhinibbhidāyāti vipassanādiñāṇappabhedāya🔽bhabbo. Sambodhāyāti ariyamaggāya. Anuttarassa yogakkhemassāti arahattaṃ anuttaro
analyzed: a puccaṇḍa tāya ati a pūti aṇḍa tāya bhabbaḥ abhinibbhidāya ati vipassanā ādi ñāṇa ppabhedāya  bhabbaḥ sambodhāya ati ariya maggāya anuttarassa yogakkhemassa ati arahattam anuttaro
translated: “Is able to penetrate”: is able to penetrate the knowledge classed as insight, etc.🔽“To full enlightenment”: to the noble path.

original: yogakkhemo nāma, tadabhigamāya bhabboti dasseti. Yā panāyamettha atthadīpanatthaṃ
analyzed: yogakkhemaḥ nāma tad abhigamāya bhabbaḥ ti dasseti yā pana ayam ettha attha dīpana attham
translated: “To the supreme security from bondage”: arahatship is called the supreme security from bondage. He shows that he is able to reach that.🔽But the simile that is given here for the purpose of illustrating the meaning should be understood in the way given in the Cetokhila Sutta.

original: upamā āhaṭā, sā cetokhilasutte vuttanayeneva veditabbā. Kevalañhi tattha “tassā kukkuṭiyā
analyzed: upamā āhaṭā sā cetokhila sutte vutta nayena iva veditabbā kevalam hi tattha tassā kukkuṭiyā
translated: For there it is said: “Just as that hen’s chicks,🔽for it is said: “Just as that hen’s chicks,🔽though furnished with wings and feathers, are unable to fly up and alight except on the mother hen, so too, though this bhikkhu is furnished with the fifteen factors beginning with zeal,

original: aṇḍesu tividhakiriyakaraṇaṃ viya hi imassa bhikkhuno ussoḷhipannarasehi aṅgehi samannāgatabhāvo”ti🔽yaṃ evaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ āgataṃ, taṃ idha evaṃ sīlasampanno hotītiādivacanato “tassā
analyzed: aṇḍesu tividha kiriya karaṇam viya hi imassa bhikkhuno ussoḷhi panna rasehi aṅgehi samannāgata bhāvaḥ ti  yam evam opamma saṃsandanam āgatam tam idha evam sīla sampannaḥ hoti iti ādi vacanato tassā
translated: ”🔽This is the way the simile is applied. But here, from the words “Endowed with virtue,” etc.,

original: kukkuṭiyā aṇḍesu tividhakiriyakaraṇaṃ viya imassa bhikkhuno sīlasampannatādīhi pannarasehi
analyzed: kukkuṭiyāḥ aṇḍesu tividha kiriya karaṇam viya imassa bhikkhuno sīla sampanna tā ādīhi pannarasehi
translated: it is said: “Just as that hen’s chicks, though furnished with wings and feathers, are unable to fly up and alight except on the mother hen, so too, though this bhikkhu is furnished with the fifteen factors beginning with virtue,

original: dhammehi samaṅgibhāvo”ti. Evaṃ yojetvā veditabbaṃ. Sesaṃ sabbattha vuttasadisameva.🔽28. Imaṃyeva anuttaraṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhinti imaṃ paṭhamādijjhānehi asadisaṃ uttamaṃ
analyzed: dhammehi samaṅgi bhāvaḥ ti evam yojetvā veditabbam sesam sabbattha vutta sadisam eva  imam yeva anuttaram upekkhā sati pārisuddhin ti imam paṭhama ādi jhānehi asadisam uttamam
translated: The rest is as already stated.🔽This unsurpassed purification of mindfulness by equanimity: this fourth meditation, which is unequalled by the first meditation, etc., is the best.

original: catutthajjhānikaṃ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṃ. Paṭhamābhinibbhidāti paṭhamo ñāṇabhedo.
analyzed: catuttha jhānikam upekkhā sati pārisuddhim paṭhama abhinibbhidā ti paṭhamaḥ ñāṇa bhedaḥ
translated: The first penetration: the first kind of knowledge.🔽The same method applies to the second, and so on.

original: Dutiyādīsupi eseva nayo. Kukkuṭacchāpako pana ekavāraṃ mātukucchito ekavāraṃ aṇḍakosatoti
analyzed: dutiya ādīsu pi esā iva nayo pana eka vāram mātukucchitaḥ eka vāram
translated: But the cock’s chick is born twice, once from the womb and once from the shell.

original: dve vāre jāyati. Ariyasāvako tīhi vijjāhi tāyo vāre jāyati. Pubbenivāsacchādakaṃ🔽tamaṃ vinodetvā pubbenivāsañāṇena paṭhamaṃ jāyati, sattānaṃ cutipaṭisandhicchādakaṃ
analyzed: dve vāre jāyati ariyasāvako tīhi vijjāhi vāre jāyati pubbenivāsa chādakam  tamam vinodetvā pubbenivāsa ñāṇena paṭhamam jāyati sattānam cuti paṭisandhi chādakam
translated: The ariyan disciple is born three times with the three kinds of true knowledge.🔽Having dispelled the darkness that conceals past existence, he is born once with knowledge of past existence.🔽Having dispelled the darkness that conceals the passing away and reappearance of beings, he is born once with knowledge of the divine eye.

original: tamaṃ vinodetvā dibbacakkhuñāṇena dutiyaṃ jāyati, catusaccapaṭicchādakaṃ tamaṃ vinodetvā
analyzed: tamam vinodetvā dibba cakkhu ñāṇena dutiyam jāyati catu sacca paṭicchādakam tamam vinodetvā
translated: Having dispelled the darkness that conceals the four noble truths,

original: āsavakkhayañāṇena tatiyaṃ jāyati.
analyzed: āsava khaya ñāṇena tatiyam jāyati
translated: he is born once with knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: 29. Idampissa hoti caraṇasminti idampi sīlaṃ assa bhikkhuno caraṇaṃ nāma hotīti attho.
analyzed: idam pi issa hoti caraṇasmin ti idam pi sīlam assa bhikkhuno caraṇam nāma hoti iti attho
translated: This is his way of life: this virtue is called his way of life.

original: Caraṇaṃ nāma bahu anekavidhaṃ, sīlādayo pannarasadhammā, tattha idampi ekaṃ caraṇanti
analyzed: caraṇam nāma bahu anekavidham sīla ādayo pannarasa dhammā tattha idam pi ekam caraṇan ti
translated: The meaning is that there are many ways of life, fifteen in all, beginning with virtue. Herein, this is one of his ways of life.

original: attho. Padattho pana carati tena agatapubbaṃ disaṃ gacchatīti caraṇaṃ. Esa nayo sabbattha.
analyzed: atthaḥ padatthaḥ pana carati tena a gata pubbam disam gacchati iti caraṇam esa nayaḥ sabbattha
translated: The word by word meaning is this. He goes by it, he goes to a quarter that he has not gone to before, thus it is a way of life . The same method of explanation applies in all the following passages.

original: Idampissa hoti vijjāyāti idaṃ pubbenivāsañāṇaṃ tassa vijjā nāma hotīti attho. Vijjā
analyzed: idam pi ssa hoti vijjāya ati idam pubbenivāsa ñāṇam tassa vijjā nāma hoti iti atthaḥ vijjā
translated: This is his knowledge: this knowledge of past lives is called his knowledge.

original: nāma bahu anekavidhā, vipassanañāṇādīni aṭṭha ñāṇāni, tattha idampi ñāṇaṃ ekā vijjātipi
analyzed: nāma bahu anekavidhā vipassana ñāṇa ādīni aṭṭha ñāṇāni tattha idam pi ñāṇam ekā vijjā atipi
translated: The meaning is that there are many kinds of knowledge, eight in all, beginning with insight knowledge. Herein, this is one of his kinds of knowledge.

original: attho. Padattho pana vinivijjhitvā etāya jānātīti vijjā. Esa nayo sabbattha. Vijjāsampanno🔽itipīti tīhi vijjāhi vijjāsampanno itipi. Caraṇasampanno itipīti pañcadasahi dhammehi
analyzed: atthaḥ padatthaḥ pana vinivijjhitvā etāya jānāti iti vijjā esa nayo sabbattha vijjā sampanno  itipi iti tīhi vijjāhi vijjā sampannaḥ itipi caraṇa sampannaḥ itipi iti pañcadasahi dhammehi
translated: The word by word meaning is this. He knows by it, thus it is knowledge . The same method of explanation applies in all the following passages.🔽Endowed with knowledge and conduct: endowed with the three kinds of knowledge.🔽Endowed with conduct: endowed with the fifteen kinds of conduct.

original: caraṇasampanno itipi. Tadubhayena pana vijjācaraṇasampanno itipīti.
analyzed: caraṇa sampannaḥ tad ubhayena pana vijjā caraṇa sampannaḥ iti
translated: Endowed with both: endowed with the three kinds of knowledge and the fifteen kinds of conduct.

original: 30. Sanaṅkumārenāti porāṇakakumārena, cirakālato paṭṭhāya kumāroti paññātena. So
analyzed: sanak kumārena ati porāṇaka kumārena cira kālataḥ paṭṭhāya kumāro ti paññātena so
translated: “As Sanaṅkumāra”: as the ancient Kumāra, the one who has been known as Kumāra for a long time.

original: kira manussapathe pañcacūḷakakumārakakāle jhānaṃ nibbattetvā aparihīnajjhāno brahmaloke
analyzed: kira manussapathe pañcacūḷaka kumāraka kāle jhānam nibbattetvā a parihīna jjhānaḥ brahma loke
translated: It is said that he, while still on the human plane, produced jhāna as a five-year-old boy and was reborn in the Brahmā-world without ever losing his jhāna attainment.

original: nibbatti, tassa so attabhāvo piyo ahosi manāpo, tasmā tādiseneva attabhāvena carati,
analyzed: nibbatti tassa saḥ atta bhāvaḥ piyaḥ ahosi manāpaḥ tasmā tādisena iva atta bhāvena carati
translated: That existence was dear and pleasing to him, and so he continued to live in such an existence.🔽Therefore they know him as Sanaṅkumāra.

original: tena naṃ sanaṅkumāroti sañjānanti. Janetasminti janitasmiṃ, pajāyāti attho. Ye gottapaṭisārinoti
analyzed: tena nam sanaṅkumāraḥ iti sañjānanti janetasmin ti janitasmin pajāyāti atthaḥ ye gotta paṭisārino ti
translated: “In the world of men”: in the world of those who are born. The meaning is: in the world of those who are reborn.

original: ye janetasmiṃ gottaṃ paṭisaranti “ahaṃ gotamo, ahaṃ kassapo”ti, tesu loke gottapaṭisārīsu
analyzed: ye gottam paṭisaranti aham gotamaḥ aham kassapaḥ ti tesu loke gotta paṭisārīsu
translated: “Among those who trace their lineage”: among those who trace their lineage in the world of those who are born, saying “I am a Gotama,” “I am a Kassapa.”🔽“The noble one is the best among them”: among those in the world who trace their lineage, the noble one is the best.

original: khattiyo seṭṭho. Anumatā bhagavatāti mama pañhabyākaraṇena saddhiṃ saṃsanditvā desitāti
analyzed: khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ anumatā bhagavatā ati mama pañha byākaraṇena saddhim saṃsanditvā desitā ati
translated: “This has been approved by the Blessed One”: this has been taught by the Blessed One in conjunction with my answering of the question.🔽In the Ambattha Sutta the Blessed One says:

original: ambaṭṭhasutte buddhena bhagavatā “ahampi, ambaṭṭha, evaṃ vadāmi –
analyzed: ambaṭṭha sutte buddhena bhagavatā aham pi ambaṭṭha evam vadāmi
translated: “Ambattha, I too say:🔽‘The noble one is the best among them,

original: ‘Khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṃ, ye gottapaṭisārino;
analyzed: khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ janetasmin ye gotta paṭisārinaḥ
translated: Among those who trace their lineage,🔽He who is endowed with knowledge and conduct,

original: Vijjācaraṇasampanno, so seṭṭho devamānuse’ti”. –
analyzed: vijjā ācaraṇa sampanno so seṭṭhaḥ deva mānusa iti
translated: The best among gods and men.’ ”

original: Evaṃ bhāsantena anuññātā anumoditā. Sādhu sādhu ānandāti, bhagavā kira ādito paṭṭhāya🔽niddaṃ anokkamantova imaṃ suttaṃ sutvā ānandena sekhapaṭipadāya kūṭaṃ gahitanti ñatvā
analyzed: evam bhāsantena anuññātā anumoditā sādhu sādhu ānanda ati bhagavā kira āditas paṭṭhāya  imam suttam sutvā ānandena sekha paṭipadāya kūṭam gahitanti ñatvā
translated: In saying this, he gave his consent and expressed his appreciation. “Good, good, Ānanda! ” —the Exalted One, it seems, heard this sutta from the beginning🔽while still in his bed, and knowing that Ānanda had taken the hint about the training of a disciple,

original: uṭṭhāya pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā nisinno sādhukāraṃ adāsi. Ettāvatā ca pana idaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: uṭṭhāya pallaṅkam ābhujitvā nisinnaḥ sādhukāram adāsi ettāvatā ca pana idam suttam
translated: he rose up, sat cross-legged, and gave his approval. At this point the sutta

original: jinabhāsitaṃ nāma jātaṃ. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: jinabhāsitam nāma jātam sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati
translated: became the word of the Victor. The rest is clear throughout.

original: Papañcasūdaniyā majjhimanikāyaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: papañcasūdaniyā majjhima nikāya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the Majjhima Nikāya, called “The Clearing of the Forest of the Suttas,”🔽is finished.

original: Sekhasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sekha sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sekha sutta is finished.

original: 4. Potaliyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: potaliya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Potaliya sutta

original: 31. Evaṃ me sutanti potaliyasuttaṃ. Tattha aṅguttarāpesūti aṅgāyeva so janapado,🔽mahiyā panassa uttarena yā āpo, tāsaṃ avidūrattā uttarāpotipi vuccati. Kataramahiyā
analyzed: evam me sutanti potaliya suttam tattha aṅguttarāpesu iti aṅgāya iva saḥ janapadaḥ  mahiyā pana assa uttarena yāḥ āpaḥ tāsam avidūra ttā uttarāpā iti pi vuccati kataramahiyā
translated: “Thus have I heard” — the Potaliya sutta. Herein, in the Aṅguttarāpa country means in the Aṅga country itself,

original: uttarena yā āpoti, mahāmahiyā. Tatthāyaṃ āvibhāvakathā – ayaṃ kira jambudīpo dasasahassayojanaparimāṇo.
analyzed: uttarena yāḥ āpaḥ iti mahā mahiyā tattha ayam āvi bhāva kathā ayam kira jambudīpaḥ dasa sahassa yojana parimāṇaḥ
translated: but because of its proximity to the water to the north of the great lake, it is called the Uttarāpa country. What is the water to the north of the great lake? The great lake. Herein, the explanation is this: this Rose-Apple Island is ten thousand leagues in extent.

original: Tattha ca catusahassayojanappamāṇo padeso udakena ajjhotthaṭo samuddoti saṅkhaṃ gato.
analyzed: tattha ca catu sahassa yojana ppamāṇaḥ padesaḥ udakena ajjhotthaṭaḥ samuddaḥ iti saṅkham gataḥ
translated: And the part of it which is four thousand leagues across and submerged in water is known as the ocean.

original: Tisahassayojanappamāṇe manussā vasanti. Tisahassayojanappamāṇe himavā patiṭṭhito🔽ubbedhena pañcayojanasatiko caturāsītikūṭasahassapaṭimaṇḍito samantato sandamānapañcasatanadīvicitto,
analyzed: ti sahassa yojana ppamāṇe manussāḥ vasanti ti sahassa yojana ppamāṇe himavā patiṭṭhitaḥ  ubbedhena pañca yojana satikaḥ catur āsīti kūṭa sahassa paṭimaṇḍito samantataḥ sandamāna pañca sata nadī vicittaḥ
translated: In the three-thousandfold world-system men live in the three-thousandfold world-system. The Himalayas are established in the three-thousandfold world-system.🔽They are five hundred leagues high and are adorned with eighty-four thousand peaks. They are surrounded by five hundred rivers.

original: yattha āyāmavitthārena ceva gambhīratāya ca paṇṇāsapaṇṇāsayojanā diyaḍḍhayojanasataparimaṇḍalā
analyzed: āyāma vitthārena ca iva gambhīra tāya ca paṇṇāsa paṇṇāsa yojanā diyaḍḍha yojana sata parimaṇḍalā
translated: There is the lake Anotatta, fifty leagues long and fifty leagues wide, with a surrounding area of two hundred and fifty leagues,

original: anotattadaho kaṇṇamuṇḍadaho rathakāradaho chaddantadaho kuṇāladaho mandākinīdaho
analyzed: anotatta daho kaṇṇamuṇḍa dahaḥ rathakāra daho chaddanta daho kuṇāla daho mandākinī daho
translated: and the lakes Kaṇṇamuṇḍa, Rathakāra, Chaddanta, Kuṇāla, Mandākinī,

original: sīhapapātadahoti satta mahāsarā patiṭṭhitā. Tesu anotattadaho sudassanakūṭaṃ citrakūṭaṃ
analyzed: sīha papāta daho ti satta mahā sarā patiṭṭhitā tesu anotatta daho sudassanakūṭam citrakūṭam
translated: and Sīhapapātā. These are the seven great lakes. Of these, the lake Anotatta is surrounded by five mountains, namely, Sudassana, Citta,

original: kāḷakūṭaṃ gandhamādanakūṭaṃ kelāsakūṭanti imehi pañcahi pabbatehi parikkhitto.
analyzed: kāḷakūṭam gandhamādanakūṭam kelāsakūṭam ti imehi pañcahi pabbatehi parikkhittaḥ
translated: Kāḷaka, Gandhamādana, and Kelāsa.

original: Tattha sudassanakūṭaṃ sovaṇṇamayaṃ dviyojanasatubbedhaṃ antovaṅkaṃ kākamukhasaṇṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tattha sudassana kūṭam sovaṇṇa mayam dvi yojana satubbedham antovaṅkam kākamukha saṇṭhānam
translated: Of these, Sudassana is golden, two hundred leagues high, and bent inwards like a bow. It is shaped like a crow’s head.

original: tameva saraṃ paṭicchādetvā ṭhitaṃ. Citrakūṭaṃ sabbaratanamayaṃ. Kāḷakūṭaṃ añjanamayaṃ.
analyzed: tam eva saram paṭicchādetvā ṭhitam citrakūṭam sabbaratana mayam kāḷakūṭam añjana mayam
translated: and it stands covering the lake. Citrakūṭa is all-gem-made. Kāḷakūṭa is made of collyrium.

original: Gandhamādanakūṭaṃ sānumayaṃ abbhantare muggavaṇṇaṃ, mūlagandho sāragandho pheggugandho
analyzed: gandhamādana kūṭam sānu mayam abbhantare mugga vaṇṇam mūla gandho sāra gandho pheggu gandho
translated: Gandhamādana is made of sandalwood, and inside it is the colour of green gram. The fragrance of the root, the fragrance of the heartwood, the fragrance of the sapwood,

original: tacagandho papaṭikagandho rasagandho pattagandho pupphagandho phalagandho gandhagandhoti
analyzed: taca gandho papaṭika gandho rasa gandho patta gandho puppha gandho phala gandhaḥ gandha gandho ti
translated: the fragrance of the bark, the fragrance of the leaves, the fragrance of the flowers, the fragrance of the fruits, the fragrance of the resin—

original: imehi dasahi gandhehi ussannaṃ nānappakāraosadhasañchannaṃ, kāḷapakkhauposathadivase
analyzed: imehi dasahi gandhehi ussannam nānappakāra osadha sañchannam kāḷapakkha uposatha divase
translated: these are the ten fragrances that are abundant there. It is covered with many kinds of herbs, and on the dark of the full moon day of the last month of the rainy season

original: ādittamiva aṅgāraṃ jalantaṃ tiṭṭhati. Kelāsakūṭaṃ rajatamayaṃ. Sabbāni sudassanena🔽samānubbedhasaṇṭhānāni, tameva saraṃ paṭicchādetvā ṭhitāni. Tāni sabbāni devānubhāvena
analyzed: ādittam iva aṅgāram jalantam tiṭṭhati kelāsa kūṭam rajata mayam sabbāni sudassanena  samānubbedha saṇṭhānāni tam eva saram paṭicchādetvā ṭhitāni tāni sabbāni deva anubhāvena
translated: it stands burning like a charcoal pit. Kelāsakūṭa is silver-made. All of them🔽are the same in height and shape, and they stand covering the lake. They all rain

original: nāgānubhāvena ca vassanti, nadiyo ca tesu sandanti. Taṃ sabbampi udakaṃ anotattameva
analyzed: nāga anubhāvena ca vassanti nadiyaḥ ca tesu sandanti tam sabbam pi udakam anotattam eva
translated: through the power of the gods and the power of the nāgas, and rivers flow in them. All that water enters the Anotatta Lake🔽only. The moon and sun, as they go south or north, go there

original: pavisati. Candimasūriyā dakkhiṇena vā uttarena vā gacchantā pabbatantarena tattha
analyzed: pavisati candima sūriyā dakkhiṇena vā uttarena vā gacchantā pabbata antarena tattha
translated: through the mountain range.

original: obhāsaṃ karonti, ujuṃ gacchantā na karonti, tenevassa anotattanti saṅkhā udapādi.
analyzed: obhāsam karonti ujum gacchantāḥ na karonti tena iva assa saṅkhā udapādi
translated: and the light is not reflected, hence the name Anotatta.

original: Tattha manoharasilātalāni nimmacchakacchapāni phalikasadisanimmaludakāni nhānatitthāni
analyzed: tattha manohara silā talāni nimmaccha kacchapāni phalika sadisa nimmala udakāni nhāna titthāni
translated: Herein, there are bathing places with lovely rock terraces, free from mud, with water like slabs of crystal,

original: supaṭiyattāni honti, yesu buddhapaccekabuddhakhīṇāsavā ca iddhimanto ca isayo nhāyanti,
analyzed: su paṭiyattāni honti yesu buddha paccekabuddha khīṇa āsavā ca iddhimanto ca isayaḥ nhāyanti
translated: where Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and perfected bhikkhus, and also the seers possessing supernormal powers, bathe,

original: devayakkhādayo uyyānakīḷakaṃ kīḷanti.
analyzed: devayakkha ādayaḥ uyyāna kīḷakam kīḷanti
translated: and where gods, ogres, etc., play games like those of a pleasure park.

original: Tassa catūsu passesu sīhamukhaṃ hatthimukhaṃ assamukhaṃ usabhamukhanti cattāri mukhāni
analyzed: tassa catūsu passesu sīha mukham hatthi mukham assa mukham usabha mukhanti cattāri mukhāni
translated: It has four faces, an elephant’s, a horse’s, a bull’s, and a lion’s,

original: honti, yehi catasso nadiyo sandanti. Sīhamukhena nikkhantanadītīre sīhā bahutarā
analyzed: honti yehi catasso nadiyaḥ sandanti sīha mukhena nikkhanta nadī tīre sīhāḥ bahutarā
translated: from which flow four rivers. On the bank of the river flowing from the lion’s face lions are numerous,

original: honti. Hatthimukhādīhi hatthiassausabhā. Puratthimadisato nikkhantanadī anotattaṃ
analyzed: honti hatthi mukha ādīhi hatthi assa usabhā puratthima disataḥ nikkhanta nadī anotattam
translated: and so on. The river flowing from the east is the Anotattā.

original: tikkhattuṃ padakkhiṇaṃ katvā itarā tisso nadiyo anupagamma pācīnahimavanteneva amanussapathaṃ
analyzed: tikkhattum padakkhiṇam katvā itarāḥ tissaḥ nadiyaḥ an upagamma pācīna himavantena iva amanussa patham
translated: It goes round the other three rivers clockwise and, without entering the ocean, disappears in the Eastern Sea by way of the Himalayas.

original: gantvā mahāsamuddaṃ pavisati. Pacchimadisato ca uttaradisato ca nikkhantanadiyopi
analyzed: gantvā mahā samuddam pavisati pacchima disatas ca uttara disatas ca nikkhanta nadiyo pi
translated: and after going round the ocean clockwise it enters the ocean. The rivers that flow out from the west and the north

original: tatheva padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pacchimahimavanteneva uttarahimavanteneva ca amanussapathaṃ🔽gantvā mahāsamuddaṃ pavisanti. Dakkhiṇadisato nikkhantanadī pana taṃ tikkhattuṃ padakkhiṇaṃ
analyzed: tathā iva padakkhiṇam katvā pacchima himavantena iva uttara himavantena iva ca amanussa patham  gantvā mahā samuddam pavisanti dakkhiṇa disatas nikkhanta nadī pana tam tikkhattum padakkhiṇam
translated: after going round the ocean clockwise in the same way, by the southern and northern sides of the Himalayas respectively,🔽and after going by the path of the non-humans, enter the ocean. But the river that flows out from the south after going round the ocean three times

original: katvā dakkhiṇena ujukaṃ pāsāṇapiṭṭheneva saṭṭhiyojanāni gantvā pabbataṃ paharitvā
analyzed: katvā dakkhiṇena ujukam pāsāṇa piṭṭhena iva saṭṭhi yojanāni gantvā pabbatam paharitvā
translated: and after going straight by the south side of the rock for sixty leagues, strikes the mountain,

original: vuṭṭhāya parikkhepena tigāvutappamāṇā udakadhārā ca hutvā ākāsena saṭṭhiyojanāni🔽gantvā tiyaggaḷe nāma pāsāṇe patitā, pāsāṇo udakadhārāvegena bhinno. Tattha paññāsayojanappamāṇā
analyzed: vuṭṭhāya parikkhepena tigau utappamāṇāḥ udaka dhārā ca hutvā ākāsena saṭṭhi yojanāni  gantvā tiyaggaḷe nāma pāsāṇe patitā pāsāṇaḥ udaka dhārā vegena bhinnaḥ tattha paññāsa yojana ppamāṇā
translated: and after emerging, with a water-fall of the size of a ploughshare for three leagues, and after going through the air for sixty leagues,🔽it falls on a rock called the Three-Fissured (Rock), and the rock is split by the force of the water-fall. There a lotus-pond called the Three-Fissures is formed, fifty leagues in size,

original: tiyaggaḷā nāma pokkharaṇī jātā, pokkharaṇiyā kūlaṃ bhinditvā pāsāṇaṃ pavisitvā saṭṭhiyojanāni
analyzed: tiyaggaḷā nāma pokkharaṇī jātā pokkharaṇiyā kūlam bhinditvā pāsāṇam pavisitvā saṭṭhi yojanāni
translated: and after splitting the bank of the lotus-pond and entering the rock, for sixty leagues

original: gatā. Tato ghanapathaviṃ bhinditvā umaṅgena saṭṭhiyojanāni gantvā viñjhuṃ nāma tiracchānapabbataṃ
analyzed: gatā tatas ghana pathavim bhinditvā umaṅgena saṭṭhi yojanāni gantvā viñjhum nāma tiracchāna pabbatam
translated: Then it breaks through the solid earth, goes sixty leagues with Umoggalāyana, and falls on the mountain called Viñjhā.

original: paharitvā hatthatale pañcaṅgulisadisā pañcadhārā hutvā pavattanti. Sā tikkhattuṃ🔽anotattaṃ padakkhiṇaṃ katvā gataṭṭhāne āvaṭṭagaṅgāti vuccati. Ujukaṃ pāsāṇapiṭṭhena

translated: “A certain householder named Potaliya”: a householder of such a name. “With his full set of robes and bowl”: with his full set of robes and bowl,🔽meaning that he was wearing one long inner robe and one outer robe. “With his sunshade and sandals”: meaning that he took his sunshade and🔽put on his sandals. “His seats”: his couches, chairs, etc.; even a seat made of grass is called a “seat.” “With the words ‘householder’”: with the words “householder.” “He approached”: he spoke.🔽“He said to the Blessed One”: unable to get the Blessed One to consent to a third “householder” address, he said this to the Blessed One.

original: “tayidaṃ, bho, gotamā”tiādivacanaṃ avoca. Tattha nacchannanti na anucchavikaṃ. Nappatirūpanti🔽na sāruppaṃ. Ākārātiādīni sabbāneva kāraṇavevacanāni. Dīghadasavatthadhāraṇa-kesamassunakhaṭhapanādīni

translated: A householder named Potaliya. With well-filled bowl and robe: with a bowl and a robe that are well filled, well supplied. He said to the Blessed One: unable to get him to consent to a third “householder!” he said to the Blessed One the words beginning with “But, Master Gotama,” in order to get him to consent. Wearing long hair on the head and face, keeping nails long, etc.,
