analyzed: pasannanti atta bhāvam nissāya geha sita chanda rāgaḥ na kattabbaḥ iti mahārāhulovāda suttam kathesi
translated: is clear,” having shown the body, desire and lust for the household life should not be made. To show this, he preached the Mahārāhulovāda Sutta.

original: Tattha rāhulasuttaṃ imasmiṃ nāma kāle vuttanti na vattabbaṃ. Tañhi abhiṇhovādavasena
analyzed: tattha rāhula suttam imasmin nāma kāle vuttan ti na vattabbam tat hi abhiṇhovāda vasena
translated: For that was spoken by way of the frequent exhortation.

original: vuttaṃ. Rāhulasaṃyuttaṃ sattavassikakālato paṭṭhāya yāva avassikabhikkhukālā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam rāhulasaṃyuttam satta vassika kālataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva avassika bhikkhu kālā vuttam
translated: The Rāhula-samyutta was spoken from the time of his being seven years old as a novice up till the time of his being a monk for a year.🔽The Great Advice to Rāhula was spoken at the time of his being a novice for eighteen years. The Short Advice to Rāhula was spoken

original: Mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ aṭṭhārasa vassasāmaṇerakāle vuttaṃ. Cūḷarāhulovādasuttaṃ avassikabhikkhukāle🔽vuttaṃ. Kumārakapañhañca idañca ambalaṭṭhikarāhulovādasuttaṃ sattavassikasāmaṇerakāle
analyzed: mahārāhulovāda suttam aṭṭhārasa vassa sāmaṇera kāle vuttam cūḷarāhulovāda suttam avassika bhikkhu kāle  vuttam kumāraka pañham ca idam ca ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovāda suttam satta vassika sāmaṇera kāle
translated: at the time of his being a monk for a year.🔽The Boy’s Questions and this Advice to Rāhula at Ambalaṭṭhikā were spoken at the time of his being a novice for seven years.

original: vuttaṃ. Tesu rāhulasuttaṃ abhiṇhovādatthaṃ, rāhulasaṃyuttaṃ, therassa vipassanāgabbhagahaṇatthaṃ,
analyzed: vuttam tesu rāhula suttam abhiṇhā uvāda ttham rāhula saṃyuttam therassa vipassanā gabbha gahaṇa ttham
translated: Herein, the Thread called Rāhula was spoken for the frequent exhortation, the Rāhula-samyutta for the elder’s taking up the conception of insight,

original: mahārāhulovādaṃ gehassitachandarāgavinodanatthaṃ, cūḷarāhulovādaṃ therassa pañcadasa-vimuttiparipācanīya-dhammaparipākakāle🔽arahattagāhāpanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Idañca pana sandhāya rāhulatthero bhikkhusaṅghamajjhe
analyzed: mahārāhulovādam geha ssita chanda rāga vinodana attham cūḷarāhulovādam therassa pañcadasa vimutti paripācanīya dhamma paripāka kāle  arahatta gāhāpana attham vuttam idam ca pana sandhāya rāhula theraḥ bhikkhu saṅgha majjhe
translated: the Great Advice to Rāhula for the purpose of removing his sensual desire and lust for the house life, the Short Advice to Rāhula for the purpose of the elder’s taking up arahatship at the time of his maturing the fifteen ideas that ripen for deliverance,🔽and this Advice to Rāhula at Ambalaṭṭhikā for the purpose of the elder’s taking up arahatship at the time of his maturing the fifteen ideas that ripen for deliverance.🔽And it was with reference to this that the Elder Rāhula,

original: tathāgatassa guṇaṃ kathento idamāha –
analyzed: tathāgatassa guṇam kathentaḥ idam āha
translated: when telling the True Man’s virtue in the midst of the Community of Bhikkhus, said as follows:

original: “Kikīva bījaṃ rakkheyya, cāmarī vālamuttamaṃ;
analyzed: kikī iva bījam rakkheyya cāmarī vālam uttamam
translated: As a yak’s-tail fanner guards his best plume,🔽So the watchful one perfected in virtue

original: Nipako sīlasampanno, mamaṃ rakkhi tathāgato”ti. ;
analyzed: nipako sīla sampanno mamam rakkhi tathāgatoti
translated: Guards me, the Tathāgata.”

original: Sāmaṇerapañhaṃ ayuttavacanapahānatthaṃ, idaṃ ambalaṭṭhikarāhulovādasuttaṃ sampajānamusāvādassa akaraṇatthaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sāmaṇera pañham ayutta vacana pahāna attham idam ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovāda suttam sampajāna musāvādassa a karaṇa ttham vuttam
translated: This Ambalatthika-Rāhula-Sutta was spoken for the purpose of abandoning the statement that is not proper to the question of the novice monk, and for the purpose of not doing a conscious lie.

original: Tattha passasi noti passasi nu. Parittanti thokaṃ. Sāmaññanti samaṇadhammo. Nikkujjitvāti adhomukhaṃ katvā. Ukkujjitvāti uttānaṃ katvā.🔽108. Seyyathāpi, rāhula, rañño nāgoti ayaṃ upamā sampajānamusāvāde saṃvararahitassa
analyzed: tattha passasi no ti passasi nu parittam ti thokam sāmaññam nikkujjitvā ati adhomukham katvā ukkujjitvā ati uttānam katvā  sā iyyathā api rāhula raññaḥ nāgo ti ayam upamā sampajāna musāvāde saṃvara rahitassa
translated: Herein, do you see? means do you see? A little means a small amount. The state of a recluse means the recluse’s state . Having turned it over means having made it face downwards. Having turned it upright means having made it face upwards.

original: opammadassanatthaṃ vuttā. Tattha īsādantoti rathīsāsadisadanto. Uruḷhavāti abhivaḍḍhito
analyzed: opamma dassana tham vuttā tattha īsā danto ti uruḷhavā ati abhivaḍḍhitaḥ
translated: Just as, Rāhula, a king’s war-horse means this simile was spoken for the purpose of showing the example of one who is devoid of restraint in a conscious lie. Herein, with tusks like a chariot’s shaft means with tusks like a chariot’s pole. With a large body means with a large body.

original: ārohasampanno. Abhijātoti sujāto jātisampanno. Saṅgāmāvacaroti saṅgāmaṃ otiṇṇapubbo.
analyzed: āroha sampannaḥ abhijātaḥ ti su jātaḥ jāti sampanno saṅgāma avacaro ti saṅgāmam otiṇṇa pubbo
translated: With a good mount means with a good mount. Of good birth means of good birth, with a good birth. Having gone to war means having gone to war before.

original: Kammaṃ karotīti āgatāgate pavaṭṭento ghāteti. Puratthimakāyādīsu pana puratthimakāyena
analyzed: kammam karoti iti āgata āgate pavaṭṭentaḥ ghāteti puratthima kāya ādīsu pana puratthima kāyena
translated: He does his work means he kills by going here and there. But in the case of the front part of the body, etc.,

original: tāva paṭisenāya phalakakoṭṭhakamuṇḍapākārādayo pāteti, tathā pacchimakāyena. Sīsena🔽kammaṃ nāma niyametvā etaṃ padesaṃ maddissāmīti nivattitvā oloketi, ettakena satampi
analyzed: tāva paṭisenāya phalaka koṭṭhaka muṇḍapa ākāra ādayo pāta iti tathā pacchima kāyena sīsena  kammam nāma niyametvā etam padesam mad dissāmi iti nivattitvā oloketi ettakena satam pi
translated: He throws down the wall, the moat, the rampart, the watch-tower, and so on, with the front part of his body, and likewise with the hind part.🔽As to the head: he turns round and looks back, thinking, “I will crush this place,” and so on. At this much, even a thousand of them split in two.

original: sahassampi dvedhā bhijjati. Kaṇṇehi kammaṃ nāma āgatāgate sare kaṇṇehi paharitvā🔽pātanaṃ. Dantehi kammaṃ nāma paṭihatthiassahatthārohaassārohapadādīnaṃ vijjhanaṃ.
analyzed: sahassam pi dvedhā bhijjati kaṇṇehi kammam nāma āgata āgate sare kaṇṇehi paharitvā  pātanam dantehi kammam nāma
translated: As to the ears: he strikes with his ears anyone who comes or goes.🔽As to the tusks: he tears apart the hands, feet, and so on, of an elephant- rider who has offended him.

original: Naṅguṭṭhena kammaṃ nāma naṅguṭṭhe bandhāya dīghāsilaṭṭhiyā vā ayamusalena vā chedanabhedanaṃ.
analyzed: naṅguṭṭhena kammam nāma naṅguṭṭhe bandhāya vā aya musalena vā chedana bhedanam
translated: As to the tail: he binds it and cuts and breaks it with a long stick or an iron bar.

original: Rakkhateva soṇḍanti soṇḍaṃ pana mukhe pakkhipitvā rakkhati.🔽Tatthāti tasmiṃ tassa hatthino karaṇe. Apariccattanti anissaṭṭhaṃ, paresaṃ jayaṃ
analyzed: rakkhatā iva soṇḍanti soṇḍam pana mukhe pakkhipitvā rakkhati  tattha ati tasmin tassa hatthino karaṇe a pariccattanti a nissaṭṭham paresam jayam
translated: He keeps it in his mouth: he keeps it in his mouth.🔽There: in that action of the elephant. Not released: not let go. He thinks: he thinks “I will see the victory of others and my own defeat.”

original: amhākañca parājayaṃ passīti maññati. Soṇḍāyapi kammaṃ karotīti ayamuggaraṃ vā khadiramusalaṃ
analyzed: amhākam ca parājayam passi iti maññati kammam karoti iti vā khadira musalam
translated: He does the work with his trunk: he does the work with his trunk, with a heavy log or an iron bar.

original: vā gahetvā samantā aṭṭhārasahatthaṭṭhānaṃ maddati. Pariccattanti vissaṭṭhaṃ, idāni
analyzed: vā gahetvā samantā aṭṭhārasa hatthaṭṭhānam maddati pariccattanti vissaṭṭham idāni
translated: and he would trample the ground all around him to a distance of eighteen cubits. ‘Abandoned’: rejected.

original: hatthiyodhādīsu na kutoci bhāyati, amhākaṃ jayaṃ paresañca parājayaṃ passīti maññati.🔽Nāhaṃ tassa kiñci pāpanti tassa dukkaṭādiāpattivītikkame vā mātughātakādikammesu🔽vā kiñci pāpaṃ akattabbaṃ nāma natthi. Tasmā tiha teti yasmā sampajānamusāvādino
analyzed: hatthi yodha ādīsu na kutocid bhāyati amhākam jayam paresam ca parājayam passi iti maññati  na aham tassa kiñci pāpanti tassa dukkaṭa ādi āpatti vītikkame vā mātughātaka ādi kammesu  vā kiñci pāpam a kattabbam nāma natthi tasmai tiha te iti yasmai sampajāna musāvādinaḥ
translated: He has no fear from anywhere, and he thinks ‘I see our victory and the others’ defeat.’🔽‘I have nothing to do with his evil’: there is nothing at all that I should not do, either in the way of an offence such as wrong-doing, etc.,🔽or in the way of such actions as matricide, etc. Therefore, since there is nothing evil that should not be done by one who consciously tells lies,

original: akattabbaṃ pāpaṃ nāma natthi, tasmā tayā hasāyapi davakamyatāyapi musā na bhaṇissāmīti
analyzed: a kattabbam pāpam nāma natthi tasmā tayā hasāya api dava kamyatāya api musā na bhaṇissāmi iti
translated: you should train thus: ‘I will not tell lies even in jest or in play.’

original: sikkhitabbaṃ. Paccavekkhaṇatthoti olokanattho, yaṃ mukhe vajjaṃ hoti, tassa dassanatthoti
analyzed: sikkhitabbam paccavekkhaṇa atthaḥ olokana atthaḥ yam mukhe vajjam hoti tassa dassana atthaḥ
translated: ‘For the purpose of reflection’: for the purpose of looking. What is meant is: for the purpose of seeing what is wrong in the mouth.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvāti oloketvā oloketvā.
analyzed: vuttam hoti paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā ti oloketvā oloketvā
translated: ‘Having reflected, having reflected’: having looked, having looked.

original: 109. Sasakkaṃ na karaṇīyanti ekaṃseneva na kātabbaṃ. Paṭisaṃhareyyāsīti nivatteyyāsi
analyzed: sa sakkam na karaṇīyanti ekaṃsena iva na kātabbam paṭisaṃhareyyāsi iti nivatteyyāsi
translated: ‘Should not be done at all’: should not be done in any way. ‘Should withdraw’: should turn away.

original: mā kareyyāsi. Anupadajjeyyāsīti anupadeyyāsi upatthambheyyāsi punappunaṃ kareyyāsi.
analyzed: mā kareyyāsi an upadajjeyyāsi iti an upadeyyāsi upatthambheyyāsi punappunam kareyyāsi
translated: You should not do it. You should not commit it: you should not commit it again and again.

original: Ahorattānusikkhīti rattiñca divañca sikkhamāno.
analyzed: ahorattā anusikkhi iti rattiñca divañca sikkhamānaḥ
translated: You should train day and night: you should train by day and by night.

original: 111. Aṭṭīyitabbanti aṭṭena pīḷitena bhavitabbaṃ. Harāyitabbanti lajjitabbaṃ. Jigucchitabbanti
analyzed: aṭṭīyitabbanti aṭṭena pīḷitena bhavitabbam harāyitabbanti lajjitabbam jigucchitabbanti
translated: You should be ashamed: you should be ashamed, you should be humiliated.

original: gūthaṃ disvā viya jigucchā uppādetabbā. Manokammassa pana adesanāvatthukattā idha
analyzed: gūtham disvā viya jigucchā uppādetabbā manaḥ kammassa pana a desanā vatthuka ttā idha
translated: You should be disgusted: you should arouse disgust, as if you had seen a piece of excrement. But since mental action is not a subject for confession,🔽it is not said here, “You should confess it.”

original: desetabbanti na vuttaṃ. Kittake pana ṭhāne kāyakammavacīkammāni sodhetabbāni, kittake
analyzed: desetabbanti na vuttam kittake pana ṭhāne kāya kamma vacī kammāni sodhetabbāni kittake
translated: But in how many places should bodily action and verbal action be purified?🔽In how many places should mental action be purified?

original: manokammanti. Kāyakammavacīkammāni tāva ekasmiṃ purebhatteyeva sodhetabbāni. Bhattakiccaṃ🔽katvā divāṭṭhāne nisinnena hi paccavekkhitabbaṃ “aruṇuggamanato paṭṭhāya yāva imasmiṃ
analyzed: manaḥ kammanti kāya kamma vacī kammāni tāva ekasmin purebhatteya iva sodhetabbāni bhatta kiccam  katvā divāṭṭhāne nisinnena hi paccavekkhitabbam aruṇuggamanataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva imasmin
translated: Bodily action and verbal action should be purified in one place, namely, in the morning.🔽For one who has done his breakfast and is sitting in the day-quarters should review thus: “From the time of dawn until now, was there or was there not any bodily action or verbal action on my part that was displeasing to others?”

original: ṭhāne nisajjā atthi nu kho me imasmiṃ antare paresaṃ appiyaṃ kāyakammaṃ vā vacīkammaṃ
analyzed: ṭhāne nisajjā atthi nu kho me imasmim antare paresam appiyam kāya kammam vā vacī kammam
translated: If he finds that there was,

original: vā”ti. Sace atthīti jānāti, desanāyuttaṃ desetabbaṃ, āvikaraṇayuttaṃ āvikātabbaṃ.
analyzed: vāti sace atthi iti jānāti desanā yuttam desetabbam āvikaraṇa yuttam āvikātabbam
translated: If he knows there is, he should confess it if it is a thing to be confessed, and reveal it if it is a thing to be revealed.

original: Sace natthi, teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ. Manokammaṃ pana etasmiṃ piṇḍapātapariyesanaṭṭhāne🔽sodhetabbaṃ. Kathaṃ? “Atthi nu kho me ajja piṇḍapātapariyesanaṭṭhāne rūpādīsu chando
analyzed: sace na atthi tena iva pīti pāmojjena vihātabbam mano kammam pana etasmim piṇḍapāta pariyesana ṭhāne  sodhetabbam katham atthi nu kho me ajja piṇḍapāta pariyesana ṭhāne rūpa ādīsu chandaḥ
translated: If there is not, he should still continue to abide in that rapture and gladness.🔽But the mental action in the search for alms should be purified. How? “Was there in me today any desire or lust or aversion in regard to visible objects, etc.,

original: vā rāgo vā paṭighaṃ vā”ti? Sace atthi, “puna na evaṃ karissāmī”ti citteneva adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā rāgaḥ vā paṭigham vā ati sace atthi puna naḥ evam karissāmi iti cittena iva adhiṭṭhātabbam
translated: that I saw or heard about?” If there was, he should resolve that it shall not happen again.

original: Sace natthi, teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṃ.
analyzed: sace na atthi tena iva pīti pāmojjena vihātabbam
translated: If there was not, he should still continue to abide in that rapture and gladness.🔽“Ascetics or brahmans”: Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and disciples of Buddhas.

original: 112. Samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vāti buddhā vā paccekabuddhā vā tathāgatasāvakā vā. Tasmātihāti
analyzed: samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā ati buddhāḥ vā paccekabuddhāḥ vā tathāgata sāvakāḥ vā tasmā atihāti
translated: Therefore:

original: yasmā atītepi evaṃ parisodhesuṃ, anāgatepi parisodhessanti, etarahipi parisodhenti,
analyzed: yasmai atīte api evam parisodhesum anāgate api parisodhessanti etarahi pi parisodhenti
translated: since they purified it in the past, will purify it in the future, and are purifying it in the present,

original: tasmā tumhehipi tesaṃ anusikkhantehi evaṃ sikkhitabbanti attho. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānameva.
analyzed: tasmā tumhehi pi tesam anusikkhantehi evam sikkhitabbanti attho sesam sabbattha uttānam eva
translated: the meaning is that you should train by following their example. The rest is clear.

original: Imaṃ pana desanaṃ bhagavā yāva bhavaggā ussitassa ratanarāsino yojaniyamaṇikkhandhena
analyzed: imam pana desanam bhagavā yāva bhavaggāḥ ussitassa ratana rāsinaḥ yojaniya maṇi khandhena
translated: The Blessed One’s teaching rose up to the highest realm of existence, to the realm of the highest lord of the gods, to the realm of the Thirty-three, to the realm of the Yāma gods, to the realm of the Tusita gods, to the realm of the gods who delight in creating, to the realm of the gods who control the creations of others,

original: kūṭaṃ gaṇhanto viya neyyapuggalavasena pariniṭṭhāpesīti.🔽Papañcasūdaniyā majjhimanikāyaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: kūṭam gaṇhantaḥ viya neyya puggala vasena pariniṭṭhāpesi iti  papañcasūdaniyā majjhima nikāya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: The Blessed One concluded this teaching for the kind of person who is to be trained by indirect methods, as if he were taking hold of the peak of the world-sphere by means of the jewel-bearing peak of the Sineru mountain.🔽The commentary on the Ambalatthika-Rāhula Sutta in the Majjhima Nikāya,

original: Ambalaṭṭhikarāhulovādasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovāda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: the fifth sutta in the Mahāvagga, is finished.

original: 2. Mahārāhulovādasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Mahā-Rāhula Sutta

original: 113. Evaṃ me sutanti mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ. Tattha piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhīti dassanaṃ🔽avijahitvā gamanaṃ abbocchinnaṃ katvā pacchato pacchato iriyāpathānubandhanena anubandhi.
analyzed: evam me sutanti mahārāhulovāda suttam tattha piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ anubandhi iti dassanam  a vijahitvā gamanam abbocchinnam katvā pacchatas pacchatas iriyāpatha anubandhanena anubandhi
translated: Thus I heard. This is the Mahā-Rāhula Sutta. Here, following close behind means following without missing the sight of the Blessed One, by following the postures in the rear.

original: Tadā hi bhagavā pade padaṃ nikkhipanto vilāsitagamanena purato purato gacchati, rāhulatthero
analyzed: tadā hi bhagavā pade padam nikkhipantaḥ vilāsita gamanena puratas puratas gacchati rāhula tthero
translated: For at that time the Blessed One was going forward, forward, with a graceful gait, placing his foot down and lifting it up. The Elder Rāhula

original: dasabalassa padānupadiko hutvā pacchato pacchato.
analyzed: dasabalassa padānupadikaḥ hutvā pacchatas pacchatas
translated: was following behind, behind, following the steps of the One of Ten Powers.

original: Tattha bhagavā supupphitasālavanamajjhagato subhūmiotaraṇatthāya nikkhantamattavaravāraṇo
analyzed: tattha bhagavā su pupphita sāla vana majjha gataḥ su bhūmi otaraṇa tthāya nikkhanta matta vara vāraṇaḥ
translated: There, the Blessed One, like a fine tusker just emerged from a forest of flowering sāla trees,

original: viya virocittha, rāhulabhaddo ca varavāraṇassa pacchato nikkhantagajapotako viya.
analyzed: viya virocittha rāhulabhaddo ca vara vāraṇassa pacchatas nikkhanta gaja potakaḥ viya
translated: and Rāhulabhaddā like a young elephant that had come out after a fine bull elephant.

original: Bhagavā sāyanhasamaye maṇiguhato nikkhamitvā gocaraṃ paṭipanno kesarasīho viya, rāhulabhaddo
analyzed: bhagavā sāyanha samaye maṇi guhataḥ nikkhamitvā gocaram paṭipannaḥ kesarasīhaḥ viya rāhulabhaddo
translated: The Fortunate One, after coming out from the jewel cave in the evening time, was going for alms like a lion, and Rāhulabhaddā

original: ca sīhamigarājānaṃ anubandhanto nikkhantasīhapotako viya. Bhagavā maṇipabbatasassirikavanasaṇḍato
analyzed: ca sīha miga rājānam anubandhantaḥ nikkhanta sīha potakaḥ viya bhagavā maṇi pabbata sassirika vana saṇḍataḥ
translated: like a young lion that had come out following the lion king. The Fortunate One from the jewel mountain, the red-wood forest,

original: dāṭhabalo mahābyaggho viya, rāhulabhaddo ca byaggharājānaṃ anubandhabyagghapotako
analyzed: dāṭhabalaḥ mahābyagghaḥ viya rāhulabhaddo ca byaggha rājānam anubandha byaggha potako
translated: like a great tiger with a broken fang, and Rāhulabhaddā like a young tiger that had followed the tiger king.

original: viya. Bhagavā simbalidāyato nikkhantasupaṇṇarājā viya, rāhulabhaddo ca supaṇṇarājassa
analyzed: viya bhagavā simbalidāyataḥ nikkhanta supaṇṇa rājā viya rāhulabhaddo ca supaṇṇa rājassa
translated: The Fortunate One like a king of the Supaṇṇas that had come out from the Simbalivana, and Rāhulabhaddā

original: pacchato nikkhantasupaṇṇapotako viya. Bhagavā cittakūṭapabbatato gaganatalaṃ pakkhandasuvaṇṇahaṃsarājā
analyzed: pacchatas nikkhanta supaṇṇa potakaḥ viya bhagavā cittakūṭa pabbatataḥ gagana talam pakkhanda suvaṇṇa haṃsa rājā
translated: like a young Supaṇṇa that had come out after the Supaṇṇa king. The Fortunate One like a golden goose king that had flown up into the sky from the Cittakūṭa mountain,

original: viya, rāhulabhaddo ca haṃsādhipatiṃ anupakkhandahaṃsapotako viya. Bhagavā mahāsaraṃ
analyzed: viya rāhulabhaddaḥ ca haṃsa adhipatim an upakkhanda haṃsa potakaḥ viya bhagavā mahā saram
translated: and Rāhulabhaddā like a young goose that had flown up after the goose lord. The Fortunate One like a great goose

original: ajjhogāḷhā suvaṇṇamahānāvā viya, rāhulabhaddo ca suvaṇṇanāvaṃ pacchā anubandhanāvāpotako🔽viya. Bhagavā cakkaratanānubhāvena gaganatale sampayātacakkavattirājā viya, rāhulabhaddo
analyzed: ajjhogāḷhā suvaṇṇa mahā nāvā viya rāhulabhaddo ca suvaṇṇa nāvam pacchā anubandha nāvā potako  viya bhagavā cakka ratana anubhāvena gagana tale sampayāta cakkavatti rājā viya rāhulabhaddaḥ
translated: and the ship was as deep as a great ship of gold. Rāhulabhaddas was like a little boat following behind a ship of gold.🔽The Blessed One was like a king who has set the wheel of his dominion in motion in the sky by the power of his wheel-gem. Rāhulabhaddas🔽

original: ca rājānaṃ anusampayātapariṇāyakaratanaṃ viya. Bhagavā vigatavalāhakaṃ nabhaṃ paṭipannatārakarājā🔽viya, rāhulabhaddo ca tārakādhipatino anumaggapaṭipannā parisuddhaosadhitārakā viya.🔽Bhagavāpi mahāsammatapaveṇiyaṃ okkākarājavaṃse jāto, rāhulabhaddopi. Bhagavāpi saṅkhe🔽pakkhittakhīrasadiso suparisuddhajātikhattiyakule jāto, rāhulabhaddopi. Bhagavāpi
analyzed: ca rājānam anusampayāta pariṇāyaka ratanam bhagavā vigata valāhakam nabham paṭipanna tāraka rājā  viya rāhulabhaddo ca tārakādhipatino anumagga paṭipannā parisuddha osadhi tārakā viya  bhagavā api mahāsammatapaveṇiyam okkāka rāja vaṃse jātaḥ rāhulabhaddaḥ pi bhagavā api saṅkhe  pakkhitta khīra sadisaḥ su parisuddha jāti khattiya kule jātaḥ rāhulabhaddaḥ api bhagavā api
translated: and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya was like the little boat that followed behind the great golden ship. The Blessed One was like the Wheel-Treasure, and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya was like the Counsellor-Treasure that followed the king. The Blessed One was like the moon in a cloudless sky, and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya was like the stars that follow the moon.

original: rajjaṃ pahāya pabbajito, rāhulabhaddopi. Bhagavatopi sarīraṃ dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ
analyzed: rajjam pahāya pabbajitaḥ rāhulabhaddaḥ api bhagavataḥ api sarīram dvattiṃsa mahā purisa lakkhaṇa paṭimaṇḍitam
translated: The Blessed One was born in the lineage of Mahāsammata, and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya was born in the lineage of Mahāsammata. The Blessed One was born in a very pure and noble khattiya family, like milk in a conch shell, and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya was born in a very pure and noble khattiya family. The Blessed One renounced the kingdom and went forth, and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya renounced the kingdom and went forth. The Blessed One's body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, and Rāhulabhaddakhattiya's body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: devanagaresu samussitaratanatoraṇaṃ viya sabbapāliphullo pāricchattako viya ca atimanoharaṇaṃ,
analyzed: deva nagaresu samussita ratana toraṇam viya sabba pāli phullaḥ pāricchattakaḥ viya ca ati manoharaṇam
translated: and was exceedingly lovely, like a jeweled triumphal arch in the city of the gods, or like a Pāricchattaka tree in full bloom.

original: rāhulabhaddassāpi. Iti dvepi abhinīhārasampannā, dvepi rājapabbajitā, dvepi khattiyasukhumālā,
analyzed: rāhulabhaddassa api iti dve pi abhinīhāra sampannā dve pi rāja pabbajitā dve pi khattiya sukhumālā
translated: Rāhulabhaddas also was endowed with the aspiration, and both had gone forth from the royal family, and both were of the warrior caste, and both were of delicate constitution,

original: dvepi suvaṇṇavaṇṇā, dvepi lakkhaṇasampannā ekamaggaṃ paṭipannā paṭipāṭiyā gacchantānaṃ
analyzed: dve api suvaṇṇa vaṇṇā dve api lakkhaṇa sampannā eka maggam paṭipannā paṭipāṭiyā gacchantānam
translated: and both were golden-hued, and both were endowed with the marks of distinction. They were traveling along the same road, but in opposite directions.

original: dvinnaṃ candamaṇḍalānaṃ dvinnaṃ sūriyamaṇḍalānaṃ dvinnaṃ sakkasuyāmasantusitasunimmitavasavattimahābrahmādīnaṃ
analyzed: dvinnam canda maṇḍalānam dvinnam sūriya maṇḍalānam dvinnam
translated: They shone like two moons or two suns, or like the glories of Sakka, Suyāma, Santusita, Sunimmita, and Vasavatti, the Great Brahmās,

original: siriyā siriṃ abhibhavamānā viya virociṃsu.
analyzed: siriyā sirim abhibhavamānāḥ viya virociṃsu
translated: and so on, outshining each other’s glory.

original: Tatrāyasmā rāhulo bhagavato piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gacchantova pādatalato yāva upari kesantā
analyzed: tatra āyasmā rāhulaḥ bhagavato piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ gacchantā uva pāda talataḥ yāva upari
translated: There, the venerable Rāhula, walking behind the Blessed One, looked at him from the soles of his feet up to the top of his head,

original: tathāgataṃ ālokesi. So bhagavato buddhavesavilāsaṃ disvā “sobhati bhagavā dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇavicittasarīro
analyzed: tathāgatam ālokesi saḥ bhagavataḥ buddha vesa vilāsam disvā sobhati bhagavā dvattiṃsa mahā purisa lakkhaṇa vicitta sarīro
translated: and then down to his feet again, and he saw the Blessed One’s beauty and grace as a Buddha. “The Blessed One is beautiful, with a body adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: byāmappabhāparikkhittatāya vippakiṇṇasuvaṇṇacuṇṇamajjhagato viya, vijjulatāparikkhitto
analyzed: byāma ppabhā parikkhitta tāya vippakiṇṇa suvaṇṇa cuṇṇa majjha gataḥ viya vijju latā parikkhitto
translated: and surrounded by a halo of light, like a mountain of gold surrounded by a halo of gold dust scattered over it,🔽like the Golden Mountain surrounded by lightning flashes,

original: kanakapabbato viya, yantasuttasamākaḍḍhitaratanavicittaṃ suvaṇṇaagghikaṃ viya, rattapaṃsukūlacīvarapaṭicchannopi🔽rattakambalaparikkhittakanakapabbato viya, pavāḷalatāpaṭimaṇḍitaṃ suvaṇṇaagghikaṃ
analyzed: kanaka pabbataḥ viya yanta sutta samākaḍḍhita ratana vicittam suvaṇṇa agghikam viya ratta paṃsukūla cīvara paṭicchannaḥ api  ratta kambala parikkhitta kanaka pabbataḥ viya pavāḷa latā paṭimaṇḍitam suvaṇṇa agghikam
translated: like a golden casket studded with various gems and fastened with clasps,🔽like a mountain of gold covered with a red blanket,🔽like a golden casket adorned with coral,🔽like a golden shrine anointed with red sandalwood ointment,

original: viya, cīnapiṭṭhacuṇṇapūjitaṃ suvaṇṇacetiyaṃ viya, lākhārasānulitto kanakayūpo viya,
analyzed: viya cīna piṭṭha cuṇṇa pūjitam suvaṇṇa cetiyam viya lākhā rasa anulitto kanaka yūpaḥ viya
translated: like a golden pillar anointed with red lac,🔽like the full moon rising in the sky at the end of the rainy season,

original: rattavalāhakantarato taṅkhaṇabbhuggatapuṇṇacando viya, aho samatiṃsapāramitānubhāvasajjitassa
analyzed: ratta valāha kantarataḥ viya aho sama tiṃsa pāramitā anubhāva sajjitassa
translated: Ah! the glory of a body prepared by the power of the thirty perfections!”

original: attabhāvassa sirīsampattī”ti cintesi. Tato attānampi oloketvā – “ahampi sobhāmi.
analyzed: attabhāvassa sirī sampatti iti cintesi tatas attānam pi oloketvā aham pi sobhāmi
translated: Then he looked at himself and thought, “I, too, am beautiful.

original: Sace bhagavā catūsu mahādīpesu cakkavattirajjaṃ akarissā, mayhaṃ pariṇāyakaṭṭhānantaraṃ
analyzed: sace bhagavā catūsu mahā dīpesu cakkavatti rajjam akarissāḥ mayham pariṇāyaka ṭṭhāna antaram
translated: If the Blessed One had become a universal monarch in the four great continents,

original: adassā. Evaṃ sante ativiya jambudīpatalaṃ asobhissā”ti attabhāvaṃ nissāya gehassitaṃ
analyzed: adassāḥ evam sante ativiya jambudīpa talam asobhissa ati atta bhāvam nissāya geha ssitam
translated: “If this were so, then the surface of the earth would be exceedingly beautiful.”

original: chandarāgaṃ uppādesi.
analyzed: chanda rāgam uppādesi
translated: He aroused a desire for the beauty of his own person.

original: Bhagavāpi purato gacchantova cintesi – “paripuṇṇacchavimaṃsalohito dāni rāhulassa
analyzed: bhagavā api puratas gacchantā uva cintesi paripuṇṇa chavi maṃsa lohitaḥ dāni rāhulassa
translated: The Exalted One, going on in front, thought: “Now Rāhula’s body is complete with flesh, skin, and blood.

original: attabhāvo. Rajanīyesu rūpārammaṇādīsu hi cittassa pakkhandanakālo jāto, kiṃ bahulatāya
analyzed: atta bhāvaḥ rajanīyesu rūpa ārammaṇa ādīsu hi cittassa pakkhandana kālaḥ jātaḥ kim bahula tāya
translated: The time has come for his mind to plunge into the delightful objects of sense. What is he doing?

original: nu kho rāhulo vītināmetī”ti. Atha sahāvajjaneneva pasannaudake macchaṃ viya, parisuddhe🔽ādāsamaṇḍale mukhanimittaṃ viya ca tassa taṃ cittuppādaṃ addasa. Disvāva – “ayaṃ🔽rāhulo mayhaṃ atrajo hutvā mama pacchato āgacchanto ‘ahaṃ sobhāmi, mayhaṃ vaṇṇāyatanaṃ
analyzed: nu khalu rāhulaḥ vītināmā iti iti atha saha āvajjanena iva pasanna audake maccham viya parisuddhe  ādāsa maṇḍale mukha nimittam viya ca tassa tam citta uppādam addasa disvāva ayam  rāhulaḥ mayham atrajaḥ hutvā mama pacchatas āgacchantaḥ aham sobhāmi mayham vaṇṇa āyatanam
translated: Is he passing his time in idleness?” Then, as a fish in clear water or an image in a mirror,🔽so did he see the thought that had arisen in Rāhula’s mind. Seeing it, he thought:

original: pasanna’nti attabhāvaṃ nissāya gehassitachandarāgaṃ uppādeti, atitthe pakkhando uppathaṃ
analyzed: pasannanti atta bhāvam nissāya geha ssita chanda rāgam uppādeti atitthe pakkhandaḥ uppatham
translated: “This Rāhula, my own son, going along behind me, is arousing a desire for the beauty of his own person, thinking: ‘I am beautiful, my complexion is clear.’ He is plunging into the delights of the objects of sense.

original: paṭipanno agocare carati, disāmūḷhaaddhiko viya agantabbaṃ disaṃ gacchati. Ayaṃ kho
analyzed: paṭipannaḥ agocare carati disāmūḷha addhikaḥ viya a gantabbam disam gacchati ayam kho
translated: He is practising in the wrong domain, like one who is confused about the directions and goes in the wrong direction.

original: panassa kileso abbhantare vaḍḍhanto attatthampi yathābhūtaṃ passituṃ na dassati,🔽paratthampi, ubhayatthampi. Tato nirayepi paṭisandhiṃ gaṇhāpessati, tiracchānayoniyampi,
analyzed: panassa kilesaḥ abbhantare vaḍḍhantaḥ attattham pi yathābhūtam passitum na dassati  parattham pi ubhayattham pi tatas niraye pi paṭisandhim gaṇhāpessati tiracchānayoniyam pi
translated: And this defilement, growing in him, will not let him see his own good as it really is,🔽nor that of another, nor that of both. Then it will make him take rebirth in hell, in the animal realm,🔽in the realm of ghosts, in the host of demons, or in a remote place of rebirth. Thus it will lead him to fall into the beginningless round of rebirths.

original: pettivisayepi, asurakāyepi, sambādhepi mātukucchisminti anamatagge saṃsāravaṭṭe paripātessati. Ayañhi –
analyzed: petti visaye pi asura kāye pi sambādhe pi mātukucchismin ti anamatagge saṃsāra vaṭṭe paripātessati ayam hi
translated: For this is said:

original: Anatthajanano lobho, lobho cittappakopano;
analyzed: anattha jananaḥ lobhaḥ lobho citta ppakopano
translated: Greed is the source of harm, greed is what disturbs the mind;

original: Bhayamantarato jātaṃ, taṃ jano nāvabujjhati.
analyzed: bhayam antarataḥ jātam tam janaḥ na avabujjhati
translated: This danger that arises from within, people do not understand.

original: Luddho atthaṃ na jānāti, luddho dhammaṃ na passati;
analyzed: luddhaḥ attham na jānāti luddhaḥ dhammam na passati
translated: The greedy man does not know what good is, the greedy man does not see Dhamma;

original: Andhatamaṃ tadā hoti, yaṃ lobho sahate naraṃ. –
analyzed: andhatamam tadā hoti yam lobhaḥ sahate naram
translated: It is as if there were a blinding darkness when a man is overcome by greed.

original: Yathā kho pana anekaratanapūrā mahānāvā bhinnaphalakantarena udakaṃ ādiyamānā muhuttampi
analyzed: yathā khalu pana aneka ratana pūrāḥ mahā nāvāḥ bhinna phalaka antarena udakam ādiyamānāḥ muhuttam pi
translated: Just as a great ship with its cargo of goods, with its planks broken and its seams opened, takes on water and quickly sinks,

original: na ajjhupekkhitabbā hoti, vegenassā vivaraṃ pidahituṃ vaṭṭati, evamevaṃ ayampi na🔽ajjhupekkhitabbo. Yāvassa ayaṃ kileso abbhantare sīlaratanādīni na vināseti, tāvadeva
analyzed: na ajjhupekkhitabbā hoti vegena assā vivaram pidahitum vaṭṭati evam evam ayam pi na  ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ yāva assa ayam kilesaḥ abbhantare sīla ratana ādīni na vināseti tāvat eva
translated: He should not be indifferent to it, but should quickly close the opening. So too, this defilement should not be ignored.🔽As long as it does not destroy the jewel of virtue, etc., within him, he should think: “I will suppress it.”

original: naṃ niggaṇhissāmī”ti ajjhāsayamakāsi. Evarūpesu pana ṭhānesu buddhānaṃ nāgavilokanaṃ
analyzed: nam niggaṇhissāmi iti ajjhāsa yamakā asi evarūpesu pana ṭhānesu buddhānam nāga vilokanam
translated: But in such cases the Buddhas have what is called the “lion’s glance.”

original: nāma hoti. Tasmā yantena parivattitasuvaṇṇapaṭimā viya sakalakāyeneva parivattetvā
analyzed: nāma hoti tasmai sakala kāyena iva parivattetvā
translated: Therefore, like a golden image turning on its base, he turned his whole body and addressed the venerable Rāhula.

original: ṭhito rāhulabhaddaṃ āmantesi. Taṃ sandhāya “atha kho bhagavā apaloketvā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ rāhulabhaddam āmantesi tam sandhāya atha kho bhagavā apaloketvā itiādi vuttam
translated: The words “Then the Blessed One looked back” refer to that.

original: Tattha yaṃkiñci rūpantiādīni sabbākārena visuddhimagge khandhaniddese vitthāritāni.
analyzed: tattha yaṃ kiñci rūpa nti ādīni sabba ākārena visuddhi magge khandha niddese vitthāritāni
translated: Herein, “Any kind of materiality” and so on are given in detail in the Description of the Aggregates in the Path of Purification.🔽The words “This is not mine” and so on are given in the Simile of the Great Tree Trunk .

original: Netaṃ mamātiādīni mahāhatthipadopame vuttāni. Rūpameva nu kho bhagavāti kasmā pucchati?
analyzed: na itam mama ati ādīni mahā hatthi pada upame vuttāni rūpam eva nu kho bhagavā ati kasmai pucchati
translated: Why does he ask, “Is material form permanent or impermanent, venerable sir? ”

original: Tassa kira – “sabbaṃ rūpaṃ netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi na meso attā”ti sutvā – “bhagavā
analyzed: tassa kira sabbam rūpam na itam mama na isā uham asmi na mā isā attā ati sutvā bhagavā
translated: It seems that after hearing the passage beginning, “Any kind of material form whatever, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or superior, far or near—all material form should be seen as it really is with correct wisdom thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self’ ” ,

original: sabbaṃ rūpaṃ vipassanāpaññāya evaṃ daṭṭhabbanti vadati, vedanādīsu nu kho kathaṃ
analyzed: sabbam rūpam vipassanā paññāya evam daṭṭhabbanti vadati vedanā ādīsu nu kho katham
translated: He says that all materiality should be seen thus with insight-understanding. But how is feeling, etc., to be seen?

original: paṭipajjitabba”nti nayo udapādi. Tasmā tasmiṃ naye ṭhito pucchati. Nayakusalo hesa🔽āyasmā rāhulo, idaṃ na kattabbanti vutte idampi na kattabbaṃ idampi na kattabbamevāti
analyzed: paṭipajjitabbanti nayaḥ udapādi tasmai tasmin naye ṭhitaḥ pucchati naya kusalaḥ ha isa  āyasmā rāhulaḥ idam na kattabbanti vutte idam api na kattabbam idam api na kattabbam eva ati
translated: He says that all material form should be seen thus with insight. But how should he proceed in the case of feeling, and so on? The method occurred to him. So he asks the question standing on that method.

original: nayasatenapi nayasahassenapi paṭivijjhati. Idaṃ kattabbanti vuttepi eseva nayo.
analyzed: naya satena api naya sahassena api paṭivijjhati idam kattabban ti vutte pi esā iva nayaḥ
translated: For the venerable Rāhula is skilled in the method. When it is said, “This should not be done,” he penetrates it by means of a hundred methods and a thousand methods thus: “This should not be done, this should not be done.”🔽And when it is said, “This should be done,” the method is the same.

original: Sikkhākāmo hi ayaṃ āyasmā, pātova gandhakuṭipariveṇe patthamattaṃ vālikaṃ okirati🔽– “ajja sammāsambuddhassa santikā mayhaṃ upajjhāyassa santikā ettakaṃ ovādaṃ ettakaṃ🔽paribhāsaṃ labhāmī”ti. Sammāsambuddhopi naṃ etadagge ṭhapento – “etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave,
analyzed: sikkhā kāmaḥ hi ayam āyasmā gandhakuṭi pariveṇe pattha mattam vālikam okirati  ajja sammāsambuddhassa santikā mayham upajjhāyassa santikā ettakam ovādam ettakam  paribhāsam labhāmi iti sammāsambuddhaḥ api nam etad agge ṭhapentaḥ etad aggam bhikkhave
translated: For this venerable Rāhula is eager to learn. He strews a mere handful of sand in the courtyard of the Fragrant Cottage in the morning, thinking,🔽“Today I shall receive so much advice and so much reproof from the Fully Enlightened One or from my preceptor.” And the Fully Enlightened One, placing him in the forefront thus, “Bhikkhus, the most eager to learn of all my bhikkhu disciples is Rāhula,”

original: mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhākāmānaṃ yadidaṃ rāhulo”ti sikkhāyameva aggaṃ katvā
analyzed: mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam sikkhā kāmānam yat idam rāhulaḥ ti sikkhāyam eva aggam katvā

analyzed: ṭhapesi saḥ api āyasmā bhikkhu saṅgha majjhe tam eva sīhanādam nadi
translated: The Elder, too, in the midst of the Community of Bhikkhus, roared his lion’s roar thus:

analyzed: sabbam etam abhiññāya dhamma rājā pitā mama
translated: “Having directly known all this, my Father, the King of Dhamma,

translated: And among those who have gone forth in faith, my friend is the most excellent.

original: Dhammarājā pitā mayhaṃ, dhammārakkho ca pettiyo;
analyzed: dhamma rājā pitā mayham dhamma ārakkhaḥ ca pettiyaḥ
translated: My Father is the King of Dhamma, and my Mother is the Protector of Dhamma;

original: Sāriputto upajjhāyo, sabbaṃ me jinasāsana”nti.
analyzed: sāriputto upajjhāyo sabbam me jina sāsanan ti
translated: Sariputta is my preceptor, and all is the Dispensation of the Victor.”

analyzed: atha assa bhagavā yasmā na kevalam rūpam eva vedanā ādayaḥ api evam daṭṭhabbā tasmā rūpam pi
translated: Then the Blessed One, because not only form but also feeling, etc., should be seen in this way, said this to Rāhula, beginning with the words, “Rāhula, whatever form there is, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or superior, far or near, all form should be seen as it really is with correct wisdom thus: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self.’

analyzed: rāhula ati ādim āha kaḥ najja ati kaḥ nu ajja therassa kira etat ahosi sammāsambuddhaḥ mayham
translated: “What is it today?” means “What is it today?” The Elder, it seems, thought thus: “The Fully Enlightened One,

analyzed: attabhāva nissitam chanda rāgam ñatvā samaṇena nāma evarūpaḥ vitakkaḥ na vitakkitabbaḥ ti

analyzed: na iva pariyāyena katham kathesi gaccha bhikkhu rāhulam vadehi mā punar evarūpam vitakkam

analyzed: vitakkesi iti na dūtam pesesi mam sammukkhe ṭhatvāya iva pana sa bhaṇḍakam coram cūḷāya  gaṇhantaḥ viya sammukhā sugatovādam adāsi sugatovādaḥ ca nāma asaṅkheyyehi pi kappehi
translated: “He is thinking” and sent no messenger. But he gave me the Sugata’s advice face to face, as if he were seizing a thief with his goods in front of his very eyes.

analyzed: dullabhaḥ evarūpassa buddhassa sammukhā ovādam labhitvā kaḥ nu viññū paṇḍita jātikaḥ  ajja gāmam piṇḍāya pavisissati iti atha isaḥ āyasmai āhāra kiccam pahāya yasmim nisinna ṭhāne
translated: And the Sugata’s advice is hard to find even in the course of countless eons. Having received the advice face to face from such a Buddha, what wise man, what man of discernment,

analyzed: ṭhitena ovādaḥ laddhaḥ tatas va paṭinivattetvā aññatarasmin rukkha mūle nisīdi bhagavā api  tam āyasmantam nivattamānam disvā naḥ evam āha mā nivatta tāva rāhula bhikkhā cāra kālo
translated: would enter the village for alms today?” Then the venerable one, having given up the business of eating, turned back from the very place where he was standing when he received the advice, and sat down at the foot of a certain tree. The Blessed One,

translated: One who lives alone has one duty, and another who lives with the Blessed One has another. When the two chief disciples

analyzed: ekākinaḥ vasanti tadā pātaḥ uva senāsanam sammajjitvā sarīra paṭijagganam katvā samāpattim  appetvā sannisinnāḥ attanaḥ citta ruciyā bhikkhācāram gacchanti bhagavatā saddhim viharantā
translated: live alone, then in the morning they sweep out their dwellings, attend to their bodies, and then, after entering their states of meditative absorption,

analyzed: pana therāḥ evam na karonti tadā hi bhagavā bhikkhu saṅgha parivāraḥ paṭhamam bhikkhācāraṃ

analyzed: gacchati tasmin gate theraḥ attano senāsanā nikkhamitvā bahūnam vasanaṭṭhāne nāma

analyzed: sabbe eva pāsādikam kātum sakkonti vā na vā sakkonti iti tattha tattha gantvā a sammaṭṭham  ṭhānam sammajjati sace kaca varaḥ a chaḍḍitaḥ hoti tam chaḍḍeti pānīya ṭṭhapetabba ṭṭhānamhi
translated: can they all be able to make things pleasant, or can they not?” He sweeps out any place that has not been swept,🔽and if any rubbish has not been removed, he removes it. If there is no water-trough in the place where the water for drinking is kept,

analyzed: pānīya kūṭe asati pānīya ghaṭam ṭhapeti gilānānam santikam gantvā āvuso tumhākam

analyzed: kim āharāmi kim vaḥ icchitabbanti pucchati avassika daharānam santikam gantvā
translated: Having gone to the monks who are spending the rains, he advises them:

analyzed: abhiramatha āvuso mā ukkaṇṭhittha paṭipatti sārakam buddha sāsananti ovadati

translated: so too the Blessed One, the Wheel-turner of the True Dhamma, sets out first, surrounded by the Community of monks,

original: tassa bhagavato pariṇāyakaratanabhūto dhammasenāpati imaṃ kiccaṃ katvā sabbapacchā
analyzed: tassa bhagavataḥ pariṇāyaka ratana bhūtaḥ dhamma senāpati imam kiccam katvā sabbapacchā
translated: and the General of the Dhamma, who is the Blessed One’s general of the army of the True Dhamma, does this task and sets out last.

original: nikkhamati. So evaṃ nikkhanto tasmiṃ divase aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ rāhulabhaddaṃ
analyzed: nikkhamati saḥ evam nikkhantaḥ tasmin divase aññatarasmim rukkha mūle nisinnam rāhulabhaddam
translated: Having set out in this way, he saw Rāhulabhaddavagga sitting at the root of a certain tree on that day.

original: addasa. Tena vuttaṃ “pacchā gacchanto addasā”ti.
analyzed: addasa tena vuttam pacchā gacchantaḥ addasa ati
translated: Therefore it was said: “He saw him going last. ”

original: Atha kasmā ānāpānassatiyaṃ niyojesi? Nisajjānucchavikattā. Thero kira “etassa bhagavatā
analyzed: atha kasmai āna apāna ssatiyam niyojesi nisajja anucchavi kattā theraḥ kira etassa bhagavatā
translated: Why did he advise him in mindfulness of breathing? Because it was suitable to his posture. The Elder, it seems, thought: “The Blessed One has taught this meditation subject to him,

original: rūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ kathita”nti anāvajjitvāva yenākārena ayaṃ acalo anobaddho hutvā🔽nisinno, idamassa etissā nisajjāya kammaṭṭhānaṃ anucchavikanti cintetvā evamāha.
analyzed: rūpa kammaṭṭhānam kathitanti an āvajjitvā ava yena ākārena ayam acalaḥ anaḥ baddhaḥ hutvā  nisinnaḥ idam assa etissā nisajjāya kammaṭṭhānam anucchavikam ti cintetvā evam āha
translated: but he is sitting here unalert and unattentive. So I shall tell him that this meditation subject is suitable to his posture.”

original: Tattha ānāpānassatinti assāsapassāse pariggahetvā tattha catukkapañcakajjhānaṃ nibbattetvā
analyzed: tattha āna apāna ssatim ti assāsa passāse pariggahetvā tattha catukka pañcaka jjhānam nibbattetvā
translated: Herein, mindfulness of breathing means that he should generate the fourfold or fivefold mindfulness of breathing and develop it, and then

original: vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ gaṇhāhīti dasseti.
analyzed: vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam gaṇhāhi iti dasseti
translated: he should extend it into absorption and reach Arahantship by augmenting insight that has that (absorption) as its proximate cause.

original: Mahapphalā hotīti kīvamahapphalā hoti? Idha bhikkhu ānāpānassatiṃ anuyutto ekāsane
analyzed: mahapphalā hoti iti kīva mahapphalā hoti idha bhikkhu āna apāna ssatim anuyuttaḥ eka āsane
translated: It is of great fruit: how great is its fruit? Here a bhikkhu who is devoted to mindfulness of breathing

original: nisinnova sabbāsave khepetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti, tathā asakkonto maraṇakāle samasīsī
analyzed: nisinnaḥ iva sabba asave khepetvā arahattam pāpuṇāti tathā a sakkontaḥ maraṇa kāle samasīsī
translated: attains Arahantship while sitting in the same way. If he cannot do that, he lies down, thinking, “I shall attain it at the time of my death.”

original: hoti, tathā asakkonto devaloke nibbattitvā dhammakathikadevaputtassa dhammaṃ sutvā
analyzed: hoti tathā a sakkontaḥ deva loke nibbattitvā dhamma kathika deva puttassa dhammam sutvā
translated: If he cannot do that, he is reborn in the Brahmā-world and there he hears the Dhamma from the Elder Mahāmoggallāna and attains Arahantship.

original: arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti, tato viraddho anuppanne buddhuppāde paccekabodhiṃ sacchikaroti,
analyzed: arahattam pāpuṇāti tatas viraddhaḥ anuppanne buddhuppāde paccekabodhim sacchikaroti
translated: He reaches Arahantship. Failing to do that, when no Buddha has arisen he realizes the Hermit Buddha’s enlightenment.

original: taṃ asacchikaronto buddhānaṃ sammukhībhāve bāhiyattherādayo viya khippābhiñño hoti,
analyzed: tam a sacchikarontaḥ buddhānam sammukhībhāve bāhiya thera ādayaḥ viya khippa abhiññaḥ hoti
translated: Failing to realize that, he becomes one of quick understanding in the presence of Buddhas like the Elder Bāhiya.

original: evaṃ mahapphalā. Mahānisaṃsāti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Vuttampi cetaṃ –
analyzed: evam mahapphalā mahā nisaṃsā ti tassa iva vevacanam vuttam pi ca itam
translated: So it is ‘of great fruit’ and ‘of great advantage’ are synonyms for it. And this is said:

original: “Ānāpānassatī yassa, paripuṇṇā subhāvitā;
analyzed: āna apāna satī yassa paripuṇṇā su bhāvitā
translated: ‘When mindfulness of breathing is fulfilled and well developed,

original: Anupubbaṃ paricitā, yathā buddhena desitā;
analyzed: anupubbam paricitā yathā buddhena desitā
translated: Grasped in due order as the Enlightened One explained,

original: Somaṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti, abbhā muttova candimā”ti. –
analyzed: somam lokam pabhāseti abbhā muttaḥ uva candimā iti
translated: It sheds its light on the world, just as the moon when freed from cloud’ .

original: Imaṃ mahapphalataṃ sampassamāno thero saddhivihārikaṃ tattha niyojeti.
analyzed: imam mahapphala tam sampassamānaḥ theraḥ saddhivihārikam tattha niyojeti
translated: Seeing this great fruit, the Elder directed his pupil to that.

original: Iti bhagavā rūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ, thero ānāpānassatinti ubhopi kammaṭṭhānaṃ ācikkhitvā
analyzed: iti bhagavā rūpa kammaṭṭhānam theraḥ āna apāna ssatiṃ ti ubho api kammaṭṭhānam ācikkhitvā
translated: So the Blessed One and the Elder both gave him a meditation subject, namely, the body and mindfulness of breathing respectively,

original: gatā, rāhulabhaddo vihāreyeva ohīno. Bhagavā tassa ohīnabhāvaṃ jānantopi neva attanā
analyzed: gatā rāhulabhaddaḥ vihāreya iva ohīnaḥ bhagavā tassa ohīna bhāvam jānantaḥ api na iva attanā
translated: and they went away. Rāhulabhaddanta stayed on in the monastery. Although the Blessed One knew that he was staying on, he did

original: khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ gahetvā agamāsi, na ānandattherassa hatthe pesesi, na pasenadimahārājaanāthapiṇḍikādīnaṃ
analyzed: khādanīyam bhojanīyam gahetvā agamāsi na ānanda therassa hatthe pesesi na pasenadi mahārāja anāthapiṇḍika ādīnam
translated: and he took the food himself and went to the Elder. He did not send it by the hand of the Elder Ānanda, nor did he give notice to King Pasenadi, to Anāthapiṇḍika, or to anyone else.

original: saññaṃ adāsi. Saññāmattakañhi labhitvā te kājabhattaṃ abhihareyyuṃ. Yathā ca bhagavā,
analyzed: saññam adāsi saññā mattakam hi labhitvā te kājabhattam abhihareyyum yathā ca bhagavā
translated: For if they had received notice, they would have brought food for the Elder. And just as the Exalted One did,

original: evaṃ sāriputtattheropi na kiñci akāsi. Rāhulatthero nirāhāro chinnabhatto ahosi.
analyzed: evam sāriputta theraḥ api na kiñci akāsi rāhula theraḥ nirāhāraḥ chinna bhattaḥ ahosi
translated: so also the Elder Sāriputta did nothing at all. The Elder Rāhula was without food and without a meal.

original: Tassa panāyasmato – “bhagavā maṃ vihāre ohīnaṃ jānantopi attanā laddhapiṇḍapātaṃ
analyzed: tassa pana āyasmataḥ bhagavā mam vihāre ohīnam jānantaḥ api attanā laddha piṇḍapātam
translated: But no thought arose in the Elder’s mind: “The Exalted One, knowing that I am staying in the monastery,

original: nāpi sayaṃ gahetvā āgato, na aññassa hatthe pahiṇi, na manussānaṃ saññaṃ adāsi, upajjhāyopi
analyzed: na api sayam gahetvā āgataḥ na aññassa hatthe pahiṇi na manussānam saññam adāsi upajjhāyaḥ api
translated: has not come himself and brought the alms food, nor has he sent it by the hand of another, nor has he given notice to people. And my preceptor,

original: me ohīnabhāvaṃ jānanto tatheva na kiñci akāsī”ti cittampi na uppannaṃ, kuto tappaccayā
analyzed: me ohīna bhāvam jānanto tathā iva na kiñci akāsi iti cittam pi na uppannam kutas tad paccayā
translated: knowing that I am staying in the monastery, has done nothing at all.”

original: omānaṃ vā atimānaṃ vā janessati. Bhagavatā pana ācikkhitakammaṭṭhānameva purebhattampi
analyzed: omānam vā atimānam vā janessati bhagavatā pana ācikkhita kammaṭṭhānam eva purebhattam pi
translated: No thought arose in him, much less any sign of pride or conceit. But the Exalted One had given him a meditation subject.

original: pacchābhattampi – “itipi rūpaṃ aniccaṃ, itipi dukkhaṃ, itipi asubhaṃ, itipi anattā”ti🔽aggiṃ abhimatthento viya nirantaraṃ manasikatvā sāyanhasamaye cintesi – “ahaṃ upajjhāyena
analyzed: pacchābhattam pi iti pi rūpam aniccam iti pi dukkham iti pi asubham iti pi anatta ati  aggim abhimatthentaḥ viya nirantaram manasikatvā sāyanha samaye cintesi aham upajjhāyena
translated: and in the evening he thought: “I have been told by my preceptor to develop mindfulness of breathing, but I have not done what he said.

original: ānāpānassatiṃ bhāvehīti vutto, tassa vacanaṃ na karissāmi. Ācariyupajjhāyānañhi vacanaṃ
analyzed: āna apāna ssatim bhāvehi iti vutto tassa vacanam na karissāmi ācariya upajjhāyānam hi vacanam
translated: For one who does not do what his teacher and preceptor say is called ‘ill-mannered.’

original: akaronto dubbaco nāma hoti. ‘Dubbaco rāhulo, upajjhāyassapi vacanaṃ na karotī’ti
analyzed: a karontaḥ dubbacaḥ nāma hoti dubbacaḥ rāhulaḥ upajjhāyassa api vacanam na karoti iti
translated: And there is no worse affliction than the reproach ‘The novice Rāhula is ill-mannered; he does not do what his preceptor says.’ ”

original: ca garahuppattito kakkhaḷatarā pīḷā nāma natthī”ti bhāvanāvidhānaṃ pucchitukāmo bhagavato
analyzed: ca garahu uppattito kakkhaḷatarā pīḷā nāma natthi iti bhāvanā vidhānam pucchitu kāmaḥ bhagavataḥ
translated: So he went to the Blessed One to ask him to explain the development of mindfulness of breathing.🔽To show that, it is said: “Then the venerable Rāhula … .”

original: santikaṃ agamāsi. Taṃ dassetuṃ atha kho āyasmā rāhulotiādi vuttaṃ.🔽114. Tattha paṭisallānāti ekībhāvato. Yaṃkiñci rāhulāti kasmā? Bhagavā ānāpānassatiṃ
analyzed: santikam agamāsi tam dassetum atha kho āyasmā rāhulaḥ tiādi vuttam  tattha ekībhāvataḥ kasmai bhagavā āna apāna satim
translated: Herein, in seclusion means in solitude.🔽Why does he say “whatever”?🔽The Blessed One was asked about mindfulness of breathing and he expounded a meditation subject consisting of a material form.

original: puṭṭho rūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ kathetīti. Rūpe chandarāgappahānatthaṃ. Evaṃ kirassa ahosi
analyzed: puṭṭhaḥ rūpa kammaṭṭhānam katheti iti rūpe chanda rāga ppahāna attham evam kirassa ahosi
translated: For the purpose of abandoning desire and lust for material forms.

original: – “rāhulassa attabhāvaṃ nissāya chandarāgo uppanno, heṭṭhā cassa saṅkhepena rūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ🔽kathitaṃ. Idānissāpi dvicattālīsāya ākārehi attabhāvaṃ virājetvā visaṅkharitvā taṃnissitaṃ
analyzed: rāhulassa atta bhāvam nissāya chanda rāgaḥ uppanno heṭṭhā ca ssa saṅkhepena rūpa kammaṭṭhānam  kathitam dvicattālīsāya ākārehi atta bhāvam virājetvā visaṅkharitvā tat nissitam
translated: “Rāhula’s desire and affection have arisen in regard to his own person. The meditation subject of foulness was given to him in brief below . Now, in order to make him disenchant with his person by means of the thirty-two aspects and to make him unbind his affections,🔽🔽

original: chandarāgaṃ anuppattidhammataṃ āpādessāmī”ti. Atha ākāsadhātuṃ kasmā vitthāresīti?
analyzed: chanda rāgam an uppatti dhamma tam āpādessāmi iti atha ākāsadhātum kasmai vitthāresi iti
translated: “Rāhula’s desire and lust have arisen in dependence on his own person. The meditation subject consisting of the thirty-two aspects of the body has been given in brief below. Now I shall make him disenchant with his own person by means of the forty aspects and lead him to the state of non-arising by causing desire and lust not to arise in dependence on it.” Why did he expound the space element in detail?

original: Upādārūpadassanatthaṃ. Heṭṭhā hi cattāri mahābhūtāneva kathitāni, na upādārūpaṃ.🔽Tasmā iminā mukhena taṃ dassetuṃ ākāsadhātuṃ vitthāresi. Apica ajjhattikena ākāsena
analyzed: upādā rūpa dassana attham heṭṭhā hi kathitāni na upādā rūpam  tasmai iminā mukhena tam dassetum ākāsa dhātum vitthāresi api ca ajjhattikena ākāsena
translated: Because of the need to show derived materiality. For only the four great primaries were mentioned below, not derived materiality.

original: paricchinnarūpampi pākaṭaṃ hoti.
analyzed: paricchinna rūpam pi pākaṭam hoti
translated: So he expounded the space element by way of this door in order to show that. Furthermore, materiality delimited by the internal space element is evident.🔽Materiality delimited by space

original: Ākāsena paricchinnaṃ, rūpaṃ yāti vibhūtataṃ;
analyzed: ākāsena paricchinnam rūpam yāti
translated: Is seen to vanish away;🔽So to show this vanishing

original: Tassevaṃ āvibhāvatthaṃ, taṃ pakāsesi nāyako.
analyzed: tassa ivam āvi bhāva attham tam pakāsesi nāyakaḥ
translated: The Leader expounded it.

original: Ettha pana purimāsu tāva catūsu dhātūsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ mahāhatthipadopame vuttameva.
analyzed: ettha pana purimāsu tāva catūsu dhātūsu yam vattabbam tam mahā hatthi pada upame vuttam eva
translated: Herein, what is to be said has already been said in the Mahāhatthipadopama Sutta in the case of the first four elements.

original: 118. Ākāsadhātuyaṃ ākāsagatanti ākāsabhāvaṃ gataṃ. Upādinnantiādinnaṃ gahitaṃ parāmaṭṭhaṃ,
analyzed: ākāsa dhātuyam ākāsa gatanti ākāsa bhāvam gatam gahitam
translated: In the space element, “gone to space” means become the nature of space. “Held on to” means seized and clung to.

original: sarīraṭṭhakanti attho. Kaṇṇacchiddanti maṃsalohitādīhi asamphuṭṭhakaṇṇavivaraṃ. Nāsacchiddādīsupi
analyzed: sarīraṭṭhakam ti maṃsa lohita ādīhi a samphuṭṭha kaṇṇa vivaram nāsa chidda ādīsu pi
translated: The meaning is “in the physical frame.” “In the ear-holes” means in the ear-cavities unmixed with flesh and blood, etc.;🔽the same method applies in the case of the nose-holes, etc.

original: eseva nayo. Yena cāti yena chiddena. Ajjhoharatīti anto paveseti, jivhābandhanato
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ yena ca ati yena chiddena ajjhoharati iti antar paveseti jivhā bandhanato
translated: “By which” means by which hole. “He swallows” means he brings inside;

original: hi yāva udarapaṭalā manussānaṃ vidatthicaturaṅgulaṃ chiddaṭṭhānaṃ hoti. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ🔽vuttaṃ. Yattha cāti yasmiṃ okāse. Santiṭṭhatīti patiṭṭhāti. Manussānañhi mahantaṃ
analyzed: hi yāvaḥ udara paṭalāḥ manussānam vidatthi catur aṅgulam chiddaṭṭhānam hoti tam sandhāya itam  vuttam yattha ca ati yasmin okāse santiṭṭhati iti patiṭṭhāti manussānam hi mahantam
translated: for in human beings the place for the passage of food is a hole a span and a half long from the binding of the tongue down to the stomach-flap. That is what is meant here.🔽“Where it settles down” means where it comes to rest;🔽for in human beings the stomach-flap is called the “great turning-back” and is the size of a man’s hand with fingers outstretched. That is what is meant here.

original: paṭaparissāvanamattañca udarapaṭalaṃ nāma hoti. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Adhobhāgaṃ
analyzed: paṭa parissāvana mattam ca udarapaṭalam nāma hoti tam sandhāya itam vuttam adhobhāgam
translated: “Comes out below” means by which it comes out below.

original: nikkhamatīti yena heṭṭhā nikkhamati. Dvattiṃsahatthamattaṃ ekavīsatiyā ṭhānesu vaṅkaṃ
analyzed: nikkhamati iti yena heṭṭhā nikkhamati dvattiṃsa hattha mattam ekavīsatiyā ṭhānesu vaṅkam
translated: The end is called the “intestines” and is thirty-two hands long with twenty-one bends. That is what is meant here.

original: antaṃ nāma hoti. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Yaṃ vā panaññampīti iminā sukhumasukhumaṃ
analyzed: antam nāma hoti tam sandhāya itam vuttam yam vā pana aññam pi iti iminā sukhuma sukhumam
translated: “Or any other” is said with reference to the most subtle.

original: cammamaṃsādiantaragatañceva lomakūpabhāvena ca ṭhitaṃ ākāsaṃ dasseti. Sesametthāpi
analyzed: camma maṃsa ādi antara gatam ca iva lomakūpa bhāvena ca ṭhitam ākāsam dasseti sesam ettha api
translated: and the space that is inside the skin, flesh, etc., and is situated as the openings of the pores of the head-hairs and body-hairs. The rest is as already stated.

original: pathavīdhātuādīsu vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.🔽119. Idānissa tādibhāvalakkhaṇaṃ ācikkhanto pathavīsamantiādimāha. Iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu
analyzed: pathavī dhātu ādīsu vutta nayena iva veditabbam  idāni issa ta ādi bhāva lakkhaṇam ācikkhantaḥ pathavīsamanti ādim āha iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu
translated: and the space that is inside the skin, flesh, etc., and is situated as the openings of the pores of the head hairs and body hairs. The rest should be understood here in the way already described under the earth element, etc.

original: hi arajjanto adussanto tādī nāma hoti. Manāpāmanāpāti ettha aṭṭha lobhasahagatacittasampayuttā
analyzed: hi a rajjantaḥ a dussantaḥ tādī nāma hoti manāpā amanāpā ati ettha aṭṭha lobha sahagata citta sampayuttā
translated: Now, in order to point out the characteristic of its being such, he said, “He is impartial and unprejudiced” . For one who is not biased and prejudiced towards what is agreeable and disagreeable is such. “Agreeable and disagreeable” : here, the eight kinds of consciousness accompanied by greed🔽are called “agreeable” ; the two kinds of consciousness accompanied by grief are called “disagreeable” .

original: manāpā nāma, dve domanassacittasampayuttā amanāpā nāma. Cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassantīti
analyzed: manāpāḥ nāma dve domanassa citta sampayuttāḥ amanāpāḥ nāma cittam na pariyādāya ṭhassanti iti
translated: “Will not invade and dwell in the heart” :

original: ete phassā uppajjitvā tava cittaṃ antomuṭṭhigataṃ karonto viya pariyādāya gahetvā
analyzed: ete phassāḥ uppajjitvā tava cittam antomuṭṭhi gatam karontaḥ viya pariyādāya gahetvā
translated: these contacts will not be able to invade and dwell in your heart, making your heart turbid, as it were.

original: ṭhātuṃ na sakkhissanti “ahaṃ sobhāmi, mayhaṃ vaṇṇāyatanaṃ pasanna”nti puna attabhāvaṃ
analyzed: ṭhātum na sakkhissanti aham sobhāmi mayham vaṇṇa āyatanam pasannanti puna atta bhāvam
translated: “I am beautiful, my sense-base of visible form is clear” — desire and lust will not arise again in dependence on the individual essence.

original: nissāya chandarāgo nuppajjissati. Gūthagatantiādīsu gūthameva gūthagataṃ. Evaṃ sabbattha.
analyzed: nissāya chanda rāgaḥ nu uppajjissati gūtha gata nti ādīsu gūtham eva gūtha gatam evam sabbattha
translated: “In the excrement” , etc.: the excrement itself is “in the excrement” ; so with all the rest.

original: Na katthaci patiṭṭhitoti pathavīpabbatarukkhādīsu ekasmimpi na patiṭṭhito, yadi hi🔽pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhito bhaveyya, pathaviyā bhijjamānāya saheva bhijjeyya, pabbate
analyzed: na katthaci patiṭṭhitaḥ ti pathavī pabbata rukkha ādīsu ekasmin pi na patiṭṭhitaḥ yadi hi  pathaviyam patiṭṭhitaḥ bhaveyya pathaviyā bhijjamānāya saha iva bhijjeyya pabbate
translated: He is not established anywhere: he is not established in any one of the earth, mountains, trees, etc.; for🔽if he were established in the earth, he would perish when the earth perishes. If he were established in a🔽mountain,

original: patamāne saheva pateyya, rukkhe chijjamāne saheva chijjeyya.
analyzed: patamāne saha iva pateyya rukkhe chijjamāne saha iva chijjeyya
translated: He is not established anywhere : he is not established in any one of the earth, mountains, trees, etc. For if he were established in the earth, he would perish when the earth perishes; if in a mountain, he would perish when the mountain perishes; if in a tree, he would perish when the tree perishes.

original: 120. Mettaṃ rāhulāti kasmā ārabhi? Tādibhāvassa kāraṇadassanatthaṃ. Heṭṭhā hi tādibhāvalakkhaṇaṃ🔽dassitaṃ, na ca sakkā ahaṃ tādī homīti akāraṇā bhavituṃ, napi “ahaṃ uccākulappasuto
analyzed: kasmai ārabhi tādi bhāvassa kāraṇa dassana attham heṭṭhā hi tādi bhāva lakkhaṇam  dassitam na ca sakkā aham tādī homi iti akāraṇā bhavitum na pi aham ucca ākula ppasutaḥ
translated: Why did the Exalted One begin with “Rāhula, be a person who is full of loving-kindness”? In order to show the reason for such a state. For the characteristic of such a state was shown above ,

original: bahussuto lābhī, maṃ rājarājamahāmattādayo bhajanti, ahaṃ tādī homī”ti imehi kāraṇehi🔽koci tādī nāma hoti, mettādibhāvanāya pana hotīti tādibhāvassa kāraṇadassanatthaṃ

translated: and it is not possible to be such a person without a reason. Nor is anyone such a person because of such reasons as “I was born in a high family,” “I am learned,” “I am wealthy,” “I am honored by kings, royal ministers, etc.,” “I am such a person.”

original: imaṃ desanaṃ ārabhi.
analyzed: imam desanam
translated: But one becomes such a person through the development of loving-kindness, etc. Therefore the Exalted One began this teaching in order to show the reason for such a state.

original: Tattha bhāvayatoti upacāraṃ vā appanaṃ vā pāpentassa. Yo byāpādoti yo satte kopo,
analyzed: tattha bhāvayato ti upacāram vā appanam vā pāpentassa yaḥ byāpādaḥ ti yaḥ satte kopo

translated: that will be abandoned. “Hurt” is the hurting of living beings by hand, etc. “Discontent” is dissatisfaction with the wilderness dwellings and with the higher profitable states. “Repugnance” is the defilement of resistance in regard to any living beings or things. “The foul” is the meditation subject of foulness consisting of a bloated corpse, etc. The meditation subject of foulness consisting of a bloated corpse, etc.,🔽is given in detail in the Visuddhimagga. “Lust” is lust for the five cords of sense desire. “Perception of impermanence” is the perception of impermanence in what is impermanent.

original: aniccānupassanāya sahajātasaññaṃ. Vipassanā eva vā esā asaññāpi saññāsīsena saññāti🔽vuttā. Asmimānoti rūpādīsu asmīti māno.🔽121. Idāni therena pucchitaṃ pañhaṃ vitthārento ānāpānassatintiādimāha. Tattha idaṃ
analyzed: anicca anupassanāya sahajāta saññam vipassanā eva vai esā asaññā api saññā sīsena saññā ti  vuttā rūpa ādīsu asmi iti mānaḥ  idāni therena pucchitam pañham vitthārentaḥ āna apāna sati nti ādim āha tattha idam
translated: that will be abandoned. “Hurt” is the hurting of living beings by means of hand, etc., “Discontent” is dissatisfaction with the wilderness abode and with the higher profitable states. “Repugnance” is the defilement of resistance to any living being or to determinations. “The foul” is the meditation subject consisting of a bloated corpse, etc., “The bloated” is the first of the ten foul things. The meditation subject consisting of a bloated corpse, etc., is called “the foul.” It is given in detail in the Visuddhimagga. “Lust” is lust for the five strands of sense desire. “Perception of impermanence” is perception conascent with the contemplation of impermanence. Or this is insight itself, which is called “perception” by the same manner of expression as when it is called “the noble truth of knowledge and vision” . “I-making” is the conceit “I am” in regard to form, etc.

original: kammaṭṭhānañca kammaṭṭhānabhāvanā ca pāḷiattho ca saddhiṃ ānisaṃsakathāya sabbo sabbākārena
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānañca kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanā ca pāḷi attho ca saddhim ānisaṃsa kathāya sabbo sabba ākārena
translated: Now, in the passage beginning “The meditation subject of in-breaths and out-breaths” he gives the answer to the question asked by the elder. Herein, this meditation subject, the development of the meditation subject, the meaning of the text, and the benefits, are all given in detail

original: visuddhimagge anussatiniddese vitthāritoyeva. Imaṃ desanaṃ bhagavā neyyapuggalavaseneva pariniṭṭhāpesīti.
analyzed: visuddhi magge anussati niddese imam desanam bhagavā neyya puggala vasena iva pariniṭṭhāpesi iti
translated: In the Path of Purification, in the Description of Recollection of the Buddha, it is given in detail. The Blessed One concluded this teaching only with reference to the person to be trained.

original: Papañcasūdaniyā majjhimanikāyaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: papañcasūdaniyā majjhima nikāya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: In the Commentary on the Majjhima Nikāya called Papañcasūdanī,

original: Māhārāhulovādasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: māhārāhulovāda sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: the exposition of the Discourse on the Great Advice to Rāhula is finished.

original: 3. Cūḷamālukyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: cūḷamālukya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Shorter Discourse with Māluṅkyaputta

original: 122. Evaṃ me sutanti mālukyasuttaṃ. Tattha mālukyaputtassāti evaṃnāmakassa therassa.🔽Ṭhapitāni paṭikkhittānīti diṭṭhigatāni nāma na byākātabbānīti evaṃ ṭhapitāni ceva
analyzed: evam me sutanti mālukya sutam tattha mālukya puttassa ati evaṃnāmakassa therassa  ṭhapitāni paṭikkhittāni iti diṭṭhi gatāni nāma na byākātabbāni iti evam ṭhapitāni ca iva
translated: Thus I heard. This is the Māluṅkyaputta Discourse. Herein, Māluṅkyaputta’s means the Elder of that name.

original: paṭikkhittāni ca. Tathāgatoti satto. Taṃ me na ruccatīti taṃ abyākaraṇaṃ mayhaṃ na🔽ruccati. Sikkhaṃ paccakkhāyāti sikkhaṃ paṭikkhipitvā.
analyzed: paṭikkhittāni ca tathāgato ti satto tam me na ruccati iti tam a byākaraṇam mayham na  ruccati sikkham paccakkhāya ati sikkham paṭikkhipitvā
translated: They are set forth, they are rejected: views are not to be explained, and so they are set forth and rejected. The Tathāgata: a being. That does not appeal to me: that unexplainable matter does not appeal to me. Having rejected the training: having rejected the training.

original: 125. Ko santo kaṃ paccācikkhasīti yācako vā hi yācitakaṃ paccācikkheyya, yācitako vā yācakaṃ. Tvaṃ neva yācako na yācitako, so dāni tvaṃ ko santo kaṃ paccācikkhasīti attho.
analyzed: kaḥ santaḥ kam paccācikkhasi iti yācakaḥ vā hi yācitakam paccācikkheyya yācitakaḥ vā yācakam tvam na iva yācakaḥ na yācitakaḥ saḥ dāni tvam kaḥ santaḥ kam paccācikkhasi iti attho
translated: Who, being what, would you reject? For a beggar might reject a supplicant, or a supplicant might reject a beggar. But you are neither a beggar nor a supplicant, so who, being what, would you reject? is the meaning.

original: 126. Viddho assāti parasenāya ṭhitena viddho bhaveyya. Gāḷhapalepanenāti bahalalepanena.
analyzed: viddhaḥ assa ati para senāya ṭhitena viddhaḥ bhaveyya gāḷha palepanena ati bahala lepanena
translated: ‘Pierced’: he would be pierced by the army of the enemy. ‘With a thick plaster’: with a thick layer.

analyzed: maruva a khīra paṇṇīnam pi karonti tena vuttam yadi vā maruvāya yadi vā khīra paṇṇinā iti  gacchanti pabbata gaccha nadī gaccha ādīsu jātam ropimanti ropetvā vaḍḍhitam sara vanataḥ
translated: They make it with the bamboo itself. That is why it is said ‘if of bamboo, if of reed.’🔽‘A saw’: it grows in mountains, in streams, and in rivers. ‘Planed’: it is made by taking a piece of wood that has been cut down and planed.

translated: The Great Forty🔽Thus I heard. This is the Great Forty.

original: 129. Evaṃ me sutanti mahāmālukyasuttaṃ. Tattha orambhāgiyānīti heṭṭhā koṭṭhāsikāni🔽kāmabhave nibbattisaṃvattanikāni. Saṃyojanānīti bandhanāni. Kassa kho nāmāti kassa
