translated: Herein, lower fetters means fetters in the sense of bonds.

original: devassa vā manussassa vā desitāni dhāresi, kiṃ tvameveko assosi, na añño kocīti?
analyzed: devassa vā manussassa vā desitāni dhāresi kim tvam eva ekaḥ assosi na añño koci iti
translated: Whose are they? Whose are they, Blessed One, taught? Do you alone hear them, or does anyone else?

original: Anusetīti appahīnatāya anuseti. Anusayamāno saṃyojanaṃ nāma hoti.
analyzed: anuseti iti appahīna tāya anuseti anusayamāno saṃyojanam nāma hoti
translated: They follow means they follow because they are not abandoned. When they follow, they are called fetters.

original: Ettha ca bhagavatā saṃyojanaṃ pucchitaṃ, therenapi saṃyojanameva byākataṃ. Evaṃ santepi
analyzed: ettha ca bhagavatā saṃyojanam pucchitam therena api saṃyojanam eva byākatam evam sante pi
translated: And here the Blessed One asked about a fetter, and the Elder replied about a fetter. Even so,

original: tassa vāde bhagavatā doso āropito. So kasmāti ce? Therassa tathāladdhikattā. Ayañhi
analyzed: tassa vāde bhagavatā dosaḥ āropitaḥ saḥ kasmā iti ce therassa tathā laddhika ttā ayan hi
translated: and the Exalted One has found fault with his view. Why? Because the Elder has that opinion.

original: tassa laddhi “samudācārakkhaṇeyeva kilesehi saṃyutto nāma hoti, itarasmiṃ khaṇe asaṃyutto”ti.
analyzed: tassa laddhi samudācāra kkhaṇeya iva kilesehi saṃyuttaḥ nāma hoti itarasmin khaṇe asaṃyuttaḥ ti
translated: For this is his opinion: “One is called ‘associated with defilements’ only at the moment of their actual presence; at other moments one is ‘dissociated.’ ”

original: Tenassa bhagavatā doso āropito. Athāyasmā ānando cintesi – “bhagavatā bhikkhusaṅghassa🔽dhammaṃ desessāmīti attano dhammatāyeva ayaṃ dhammadesanā āraddhā, sā iminā apaṇḍitena
analyzed: tena assa bhagavatā dosaḥ āropitaḥ atha āyasmai ānandaḥ cintesi bhagavatā bhikkhu saṅghassa  dhammam desessāmi iti attanaḥ dhamma tāya iva ayam dhamma desanā āraddhā sā iminā apaṇḍitena
translated: Therefore the Exalted One has found fault with him. Then the venerable Ānanda thought: “The Exalted One has said that he will teach the Dhamma to the bhikkhu-saṅgha.

original: bhikkhunā visaṃvāditā. Handāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ yācitvā bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ desessāmī”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhunā visaṃvāditā handa aham bhagavantam yācitvā bhikkhūnam dhammaṃ desessāmi iti
translated: This teaching of the Dhamma has been begun by the Exalted One according to his own nature. It has been interrupted by this unwise bhikkhu. Let me request the Exalted One to teach the Dhamma to the bhikkhus.”

original: So evamakāsi. Taṃ dassetuṃ “evaṃ vutte āyasmā ānando”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Tattha sakkāyadiṭṭhipariyuṭṭhitenāti sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā gahitena abhibhūtena. Sakkāyadiṭṭhiparetenāti
analyzed: saḥ evam akāsi tam dassetum evam vutte āyasmai ānandaḥ tiādi vuttam  tattha sakkāya diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhitena ati sakkāya diṭṭhiyā gahitena abhibhūtena sakkāya diṭṭhi paretena ati
translated: He did so, and in order to show that, it is said: “When this was said, the venerable Ānanda” .

original: sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā anugatena. Nissaraṇanti diṭṭhinissaraṇaṃ nāma nibbānaṃ, taṃ yathābhūtaṃ
analyzed: sakkāyadiṭṭhiyāḥ anugatena nissaraṇanti diṭṭhi nissaraṇam nāma nibbānam tam yathābhūtam
translated: Herein, beset by the view of self means seized by the view of self, overwhelmed by the view of self. Associated with the view of self means followed by the view of self. Escape means the escape from views, which is Nibbāna. As it really is means as it is in actuality.

original: nappajānāti. Appaṭivinītāti avinoditā anīhaṭā. Orambhāgiyaṃ saṃyojananti heṭṭhābhāgiyasaṃyojanaṃ🔽nāma hoti. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Sukkapakkho uttānatthoyeva. “Sānusayā pahīyatī”ti
analyzed: na pajānāti appaṭivinītā ati avinoditā anīhaṭā orambhāgiyam saṃyojananti heṭṭhābhāgiya saṃyojanam  nāma hoti sesa padesu pi esā iva nayaḥ sukka pakkhaḥ sa anusayā pahīyati iti
translated: He does not understand. Not abandoned: not removed, not destroyed. The fetter that is a lower fetter: the fetter that is a fetter of the lower part.🔽The same method of explanation applies in the case of the other terms. The bright side is self-evident. But because of the words “with their underlying tendencies” some say that a fetter is one thing and an underlying tendency another.🔽Just as when it is said “with relish” the relish is something different from the food, so too, because of the words “with their underlying tendencies” the underlying tendencies must be something different from the fetters.

original: vacanato panettha ekacce “aññaṃ saṃyojanaṃ añño anusayo”ti vadanti. “Yathā hi sabyañjanaṃ
analyzed: vacanataḥ pana ittha ekacce aññam saṃyojanam aññaḥ anusayaḥ ti vadanti yathā hi sa byañjanam
translated: This is their view. They should be refuted thus: “Is not the underlying tendency to lust an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So a fetter is not necessarily an underlying tendency.”🔽“But is not the fetter of ill will an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of conceit an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of adherence an underlying tendency?

original: bhatta”nti vutte bhattato aññaṃ byañjanaṃ hoti, evaṃ “sānusayā”ti vacanato pariyuṭṭhānasakkāyadiṭṭhito
analyzed: bhattam ti vutte bhattataḥ aññam byañjanam hoti evam sa anusayā ati vacanato pariyuṭṭhāna sakkāya diṭṭhito
translated: But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of views an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of lust an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of greed an underlying tendency?

original: aññena anusayena bhavitabbanti tesaṃ laddhi. Te “sasīsaṃ pārupitvā”tiādīhi paṭikkhipitabbā.
analyzed: aññena anusayena bhavitabbanti tesam laddhi te sa sīsam pārupitvā ati ādīhi paṭikkhipitabbā
translated: But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of greed for sense desires an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”

original: Na hi sīsato añño puriso atthi. Athāpi siyā – “yadi tadeva saṃyojanaṃ so anusayo,
analyzed: na hi sīsataḥ aññaḥ purisaḥ atthi atha api siyā yadi tat eva saṃyojanam saḥ anusayaḥ
translated: “But is not the fetter of greed for existence an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of wrong view an underlying tendency?

original: evaṃ sante bhagavatā therassa taruṇūpamo upārambho duāropito hotī”ti. Na duāropito,
analyzed: evam sante bhagavatā therassa taruṇa upamaḥ upārambhaḥ du āropitaḥ hoti iti na du āropitaḥ
translated: But it is a fetter too. So an underlying tendency is not necessarily a fetter.”🔽“But is not the fetter of adherence to rules and vows an underlying tendency?🔽But it is a fet

original: kasmā? Evaṃladdhikattāti vitthāritametaṃ. Tasmā soyeva kileso bandhanaṭṭhena saṃyojanaṃ,
analyzed: kasmai evaṃladdhikattā ati vitthāritam etam tasmai saḥ yā iva kilesaḥ bandhana ṭṭhena saṃyojanam
translated: Why? Because it is in this way that they are found. This is the detailed explanation. Therefore the defilement itself is a fetter in the sense of binding,

original: appahīnaṭṭhena anusayoti imamatthaṃ sandhāya bhagavatā “sānusayā pahīyatī”ti evaṃ
analyzed: appahīna ṭṭhena anusayo ti imam attham sandhāya bhagavatā sa anusayā pahīyati iti evam
translated: and it is a latent tendency in the sense of not being abandoned. This is the meaning of the words of the Exalted One: “It is abandoned together with its latent tendency.”

original: vuttanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam iti veditabbam
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: 132. Tacaṃ chetvātiādīsu idaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ – tacacchedo viya hi samāpatti daṭṭhabbā,
analyzed: tacam chetvā ati ādīsu idam opamma saṃsandanam taca chedaḥ viya hi samāpatti daṭṭhabbā
translated: In the passage beginning, “Having cut off the top,” the application of the simile should be understood in this way. The attainment should be regarded as the cutting off of the top,

original: pheggucchedo viya vipassanā, sāracchedo viya maggo. Paṭipadā pana lokiyalokuttaramissakāva
analyzed: pheggu chedaḥ viya vipassanā sāra chedaḥ viya maggo paṭipadā pana lokiya lokuttara missakā ava
translated: insight as the cutting off of the trunk, and the path as the cutting off of the heartwood. But the practice is applicable both to the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: vaṭṭati. Evamete daṭṭhabbāti evarūpā puggalā evaṃ daṭṭhabbā.🔽133. Upadhivivekāti upadhivivekena. Iminā pañcakāmaguṇaviveko kathito. Akusalānaṃ🔽dhammānaṃ pahānāti iminā nīvaraṇappahānaṃ kathitaṃ. Kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyāti
analyzed: vaṭṭati evam ete daṭṭhabbā ati evarūpāḥ puggalāḥ evam daṭṭhabbā  upadhi viveka ati upadhi vivekena iminā kathitaḥ  dhammānam pahānā ti iminā nīvaraṇa ppahānam kathitam kāya duṭṭhullānam paṭippassaddhiyā
translated: This is how these persons should be regarded.🔽“Seclusion from acquisitions”: seclusion from the five aggregates as objects of clinging. By this he shows the seclusion from the five strands of sensual pleasure.🔽“Abandoning of unwholesome thoughts”: by this he shows the abandoning of the hindrances.

original: iminā kāyālasiyapaṭippassaddhi kathitā. Vivicceva kāmehīti upadhivivekena kāmehi
analyzed: iminā kāya alasiya paṭippassaddhi kathitā vivicca iva kāmehi iti upadhi vivekena kāmehi
translated: “Allaying of bodily torments”: by this he shows the allaying of bodily feebleness.🔽“Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states”:

original: vinā hutvā. Vivicca akusalehīti akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānena kāyaduṭṭhullānaṃ paṭippassaddhiyā
analyzed: vinā hutvā vivicca akusalehi iti akusalānam dhammānam pahānena kāya duṭṭhullānam paṭippassaddhiyā
translated: ‘Apart from the unprofitable’ means with the abandoning of unprofitable ideas, with the stilling of bodily and verbal misdeeds,

original: ca akusalehi vinā hutvā. Yadeva tattha hotīti yaṃ tattha antosamāpattikkhaṇeyeva
analyzed: ca akusalehi vinā hutvā yat eva tattha hoti iti yam tattha antar samāpatti kkhaṇeya iva
translated: ‘apart from the unprofitable’. ‘Whatever there is there’ means whatever there is there in the moment of the attainment itself,

original: samāpattisamuṭṭhitañca rūpādidhammajātaṃ hoti. Te dhammeti te rūpagatantiādinā nayena
analyzed: samāpatti samuṭṭhitam ca rūpa ādi dhamma jātam hoti te dhamme iti te rūpa gata nti ādinā nayena
translated: and whatever there is in the form of ideas arisen with the attainment. ‘Those ideas’ means the ideas stated in the way beginning ‘form, etc.’.

original: vutte rūpādayo dhamme. Aniccatoti na niccato. Dukkhatoti na sukhato. Rogatotiādīsu🔽ābādhaṭṭhena rogato, antodosaṭṭhena gaṇḍato, anupaviddhaṭṭhena dukkhajananaṭṭhena
analyzed: vutte rūpa ādayaḥ dhamme aniccato ti na niccataḥ dukkhato ti na sukhataḥ rogato tiādīsu  ābādha ṭṭhena rogataḥ antar dosa ṭṭhena gaṇḍataḥ an upaviddha ṭṭhena dukkha janana ṭṭhena
translated: ‘Impermanent’: not permanent. ‘Painful’: not pleasant. As regards ‘sickness’, etc.,🔽it is ‘sickness’ in the sense of affliction, ‘a tumour’ in the sense of internal corruption, ‘a dart’ in the sense of being deeply embedded and in the sense of causing pain,

original: ca sallato, dukkhaṭṭhena aghato, rogaṭṭhena ābādhato, asakaṭṭhena parato, palujjanaṭṭhena
analyzed: ca sallataḥ dukkha ṭṭhena aghataḥ roga ṭṭhena ābādhataḥ asaka ṭṭhena paratas palujjana ṭṭhena
translated: ‘a plague’ in the sense of pain, ‘a disease’ in the sense of sickness, ‘alien’ in the sense of not being one’s own, ‘subject to change’ in the sense of decaying,

original: palokato, nissattaṭṭhena suññato, na attaṭṭhena anattato. Tattha aniccato, palokatoti
analyzed: palokataḥ nissatta ṭṭhena suññataḥ na atta ṭṭhena anattataḥ tattha aniccataḥ palokataḥ ti
translated: ‘void’ in the sense of being uninhabited, ‘not self’ in the sense of being not a self. Herein, ‘impermanent’ and ‘subject to change’ are two terms for the characteristic of impermanence,

original: dvīhi padehi aniccalakkhaṇaṃ kathitaṃ, dukkhatotiādīhi chahi dukkhalakkhaṇaṃ, parato
analyzed: dvīhi padehi anicca lakkhaṇam kathitam dukkhato ti ādīhi chahi dukkha lakkhaṇam paratas
translated: and ‘painful’ and the other four terms are four terms for the characteristic of pain, and ‘alien’ and ‘subject to cankers’ are two terms for the characteristic of not-self.

original: suññato anattatoti tīhi anattalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: suññataḥ anattataḥ ti tīhi anatta lakkhaṇam
translated: “Empty” and “non-self” are the three characteristics of non-self.

original: So tehi dhammehīti so tehi evaṃ tilakkhaṇaṃ āropetvā diṭṭhehi antosamāpattiyaṃ pañcakkhandhadhammehi.
analyzed: saḥ tehi dhammehi iti saḥ tehi evam ti lakkhaṇam āropetvā diṭṭhehi antosamāpattiyam pañca kkhandha dhammehi
translated: “With those ideas”: with those five aggregates of clinging that he has seen in the attainment of cessation by imputing the three characteristics to them in this way.

original: Cittaṃ paṭivāpetīti cittaṃ paṭisaṃharati moceti apaneti. Upasaṃharatīti vipassanācittaṃ🔽tāva savanavasena thutivasena pariyattivasena paññattivasena ca etaṃ santaṃ nibbānanti
analyzed: cittam paṭivāpeti iti cittam paṭisaṃharati moceti apaneti upasaṃharati iti vipassanā cittam  tāva savana vasena thuti vasena pariyatti vasena paññatti vasena ca etam santam nibbānanti
translated: “He turns his mind away”: he withdraws his mind, he releases it, he removes it. “He directs it”: he directs the insight consciousness🔽to the unformed, deathless element, thinking: “This is peaceful, this is sublime, that is, the stilling of all formations, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.”

original: evaṃ asaṅkhatāya amatāya dhātuyā upasaṃharati. Maggacittaṃ nibbānaṃ ārammaṇakaraṇavaseneva
analyzed: evam asaṅkhatāya amatāya dhātuyā upasaṃharati magga cittam nibbānam ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena iva
translated: He directs the path consciousness to Nibbāna only by making it the object.

original: etaṃ santametaṃ paṇītanti na evaṃ vadati, iminā pana ākārena taṃ paṭivijjhanto tattha
analyzed: etam santam etam paṇītam ti na evam vadati iminā pana ākārena tam paṭivijjhantaḥ tattha
translated: He does not say: “This is peaceful, this is sublime, that is, the stilling of all formations … cessation, Nibbāna,” in this way. But he penetrates it in this way.

original: cittaṃ upasaṃharatīti attho. So tattha ṭhitoti tāya tilakkhaṇārammaṇāya vipassanāya
analyzed: cittam upasaṃharati iti attho saḥ tattha ṭhitaḥ ti tāya tilakkhaṇa ārammaṇāya vipassanāya
translated: The meaning is that he directs his mind to it. “Standing upon that”: standing upon the insight that has Nibbāna as its object by means of the three characteristics.

original: ṭhito. Āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇātīti anukkamena cattāro magge bhāvetvā pāpuṇāti. Teneva
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ āsavānam khayam pāpuṇāti iti anukkamena cattāraḥ magge bhāvetvā pāpuṇāti tena iva
translated: “He reaches the destruction of the cankers”: he reaches it by developing the four paths in due succession.

original: dhammarāgenāti samathavipassanādhamme chandarāgena. Samathavipassanāsu hi sabbaso
analyzed: dhamma rāgena ati samatha vipassanā dhamme chanda rāgena samatha vipassanāsu hi sabbaso
translated: “Passion for Dhamma” is passion for the Dhamma of serenity and insight. For in the case of serenity and insight,

original: chandarāgaṃ pariyādātuṃ sakkonto arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti, asakkonto anāgāmī hoti.
analyzed: chanda rāgam pariyādātum sakkontaḥ arahattam pāpuṇāti a sakkontaḥ anāgāmī hoti
translated: ‘Passion for ideas’: passion for the ideas of serenity and insight. For one who is able to eliminate passion for serenity and insight completely reaches Arahantship, while one who is unable is a Non-Returner.

original: Yadeva tattha hoti vedanāgatanti idha pana rūpaṃ na gahitaṃ. Kasmā? Samatikkantattā.
analyzed: yat eva tattha hoti idha pana rūpam na gahitam kasmā
translated: ‘Whatever feeling there is’: materiality is not included here. Why? Because it has been surpassed.

original: Ayañhi heṭṭhā rūpāvacarajjhānaṃ samāpajjitvā rūpaṃ atikkamitvā arūpāvacarasamāpattiṃ🔽samāpannoti samathavasenapinena rūpaṃ atikkantaṃ, heṭṭhā rūpaṃ sammadeva sammasitvā
analyzed: ayam hi heṭṭhā rūpāvacara jhānam samāpajjitvā rūpam atikkamitvā arūpāvacara samāpattim  samāpanno ti rūpam atikkantam heṭṭhā rūpam sammat eva sammasitvā
translated: For this meditator, having entered upon the fine-material jhānas below, has surpassed materiality by attaining immaterial jhānas,🔽and he has also surpassed materiality by the serenity that comes with the attainment of the immaterial jhānas.

original: taṃ atikkamma idāni arūpaṃ sammasatīti vipassanāvasenapinena rūpaṃ atikkantaṃ. Arūpe
analyzed: tam atikkamma idāni arūpam sammasati iti vipassanā vasena pinena rūpam atikkantam arūpe
translated: And he has also surpassed materiality by the insight that comes with the attainment of the immaterial jhānas, since he has already thoroughly discerned materiality below and has now surpassed it and is discerning the immaterial.

original: pana sabbasopi rūpaṃ natthīti taṃ sandhāyapi idha rūpaṃ na gahitaṃ.
analyzed: pana sabbaso pi rūpam natthi iti tam sandhāya api idha rūpam na gahitam
translated: But in the immaterial states there is no materiality at all, and so materiality is not included here.🔽‘But what is it? ‘: he asks, ‘What is it that I am to ask about? ‘

original: Atha kiñcarahīti kiṃ pucchāmīti pucchati? Samathavasena gacchato cittekaggatā dhuraṃ
analyzed: atha kiñcarahi iti kim pucchāmi iti pucchati samatha vasena gacchataḥ citta ekagga tā dhuram
translated: For one who goes by the way of serenity, unification of mind is the principal thing,

original: hoti, so cetovimutto nāma. Vipassanāvasena gacchato paññā dhuraṃ hoti, so paññāvimutto
analyzed: hoti so cetaḥ vimutto nāma vipassanā vasena gacchataḥ paññā dhuram hoti so paññā vimutto
translated: He is called “liberated by understanding.” When one goes by way of insight, understanding is the chief thing, and he is called “liberated by understanding.”

original: nāmāti ettha therassa kaṅkhā natthi. Ayaṃ sabhāvadhammoyeva, samathavaseneva pana
analyzed: nāma ati ettha therassa kaṅkhā natthi ayam sabhāva dhammoya iva samatha vasena iva pana
translated: Here the Elder had no doubt. This is just the way things are. But when they go by way of serenity,

original: gacchantesu eko cetovimutto nāma hoti, eko paññāvimutto. Vipassanāvasena gacchantesupi
analyzed: gacchantesu ekaḥ cetaḥ vimutto nāma hoti ekaḥ paññā vimutto vipassanā vasena gacchantesu pi
translated: one is called “liberated by mind” and one is called “liberated by understanding.” And when they go by way of insight,

original: eko paññāvimutto nāma hoti, eko cetovimuttoti ettha kiṃ kāraṇanti pucchati.🔽Indriyavemattataṃ vadāmīti indriyanānattataṃ vadāmi. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, na tvaṃ, ānanda,
analyzed: ekaḥ paññā vimutto nāma hoti ekaḥ cetaḥ vimutto ti ettha kim kāraṇam ti pucchati  indriya vemattatam vadāmi iti indriya nānattatam vadāmi idam vuttam hoti na tvam ānanda
translated: one is called “liberated by understanding” and one is called “liberated by mind.” Here he asks the reason for this.

original: dasa pāramiyo pūretvā sabbaññutaṃ paṭivijjhi, tena te etaṃ apākaṭaṃ. Ahaṃ pana paṭivijjhiṃ,
analyzed: dasa pāramiyaḥ pūretvā sabbaññu tam paṭivijjhi tena te etam apākaṭam aham pana paṭivijjhim
translated: “I declare that it is due to a difference in faculties”: I declare that it is due to a difference in the kinds of faculties. This is what he means: “You, Ānanda, did not reach omniscience by fulfilling the ten perfections. Therefore this is not clear to you. I reached it,

original: tena me etaṃ pākaṭaṃ. Ettha hi indriyanānattatā kāraṇaṃ. Samathavaseneva hi gacchantesu
analyzed: tena me etam pākaṭam ettha hi indriya nānatta tā kāraṇam samatha vasena iva hi gacchantesu
translated: and therefore this is clear to me. Here the difference in faculties is the reason. For when they go by way of serenity,

original: ekassa bhikkhuno cittekaggatā dhuraṃ hoti, so cetovimutto nāma hoti. Ekassa paññā
analyzed: ekassa bhikkhuno citta ekagga tā dhuram hoti so cetovimuttaḥ nāma hoti ekassa paññā
translated: in one bhikkhu unification of mind is the chief thing, and he is called “liberated by mind.” In another understanding is the chief thing, and he is called “liberated by understanding.”

original: dhuraṃ hoti, so paññāvimutto nāma hoti. Vipassanāvaseneva ca gacchantesu ekassa paññā
analyzed: dhuram hoti so paññā vimuttaḥ nāma hoti vipassanā vasena iva ca gacchantesu ekassa paññā
translated: And of those who go by way of insight, one’s understanding is the burden,🔽he is called “liberated by understanding.” One’s unification of mind is the burden,

original: dhuraṃ hoti, so paññāvimutto nāma hoti. Ekassa cittekaggatā dhuraṃ hoti, so cetovimutto
analyzed: dhuram hoti so paññā vimuttaḥ nāma hoti ekassa citta ekagga tā dhuram hoti so cetaḥ vimuttaḥ
translated: he is called “liberated by mind.”

original: nāma hoti. Dve aggasāvakā samathavipassanādhurena arahattaṃ pattā. Tesu dhammasenāpati
analyzed: nāma hoti dve aggasāvakā samatha vipassanā dhurena arahattam pattā tesu dhammasenāpati
translated: The two chief disciples reached Arahantship with the burden of serenity and insight.🔽The General of the Dhamma was liberated by understanding, and the Elder Maha Moggallana was liberated by mind.

original: paññāvimutto jāto, mahāmoggallānatthero cetovimutto. Iti indriyavemattamettha kāraṇanti
analyzed: paññā vimuttaḥ jātaḥ mahāmoggallāna thero cetaḥ vimuttaḥ iti indriya vemattam ettha kāraṇam ti
translated: So the reason here is the difference in their faculties.

original: veditabbaṃ. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: veditabbam sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati
translated: The rest is clear in all ways.

original: Papañcasūdaniyā majjhimanikāyaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: papañcasūdaniyā majjhima nikāya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the Majjhima Nikaya, called “The Food of the Wise,”

original: Mahāmālukyasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahāmālukya sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: is finished.

original: 5. Bhaddālisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhaddāli sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Discourse with Bhaddiya

original: 134. Evaṃ me sutanti bhaddālisuttaṃ. Tattha ekāsanabhojananti ekasmiṃ purebhatte
analyzed: evam me sutanti bhaddāli suttam tattha eka āsana bhojanam ti ekasmin purebhatte
translated: Thus have I heard. This is the Bhaddiya Discourse. Herein, one-session eating is eating at one sitting in the morning.

original: asanabhojanaṃ, bhuñjitabbabhattanti attho. Appābādhatantiādīni kakacopame vitthāritāni.
analyzed: asana bhojanam atthaḥ appa ābādha tanti ādīni ka kaca upame vitthāritāni
translated: The meaning is that the meal should be eaten. The words “health” and so on are given in detail in the Kakudha Simile .

original: Na ussahāmīti na sakkomi. Siyā kukkuccaṃ siyā vippaṭisāroti evaṃ bhuñjanto yāvajīvaṃ
analyzed: na ussahāmi iti na sakkomi siyā kukkuccam siyā vippaṭisāro ti evam bhuñjantaḥ yāvajīvam
translated: I am not able to do so. I might have scruples, I might have regrets. If I eat thus, will I be able to live the holy life all my life? Or will I have scruples and regrets?

original: brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ sakkhissāmi nu kho, na nu khoti iti me vippaṭisārakukkuccaṃ
analyzed: brahmacariyam caritum sakkhissāmi nu kho na nu kho iti iti me vippaṭisāra kukkuccam
translated: The meaning is: will I have doubts and regrets?

original: bhaveyyāti attho. Ekadesaṃ bhuñjitvāti porāṇakattherā kira patte bhattaṃ pakkhipitvā
analyzed: bhaveyya ati attho eka desam bhuñjitvā iti porāṇaka therā kira patte bhattam pakkhipitvā
translated: Having eaten a portion: the ancient elders, it seems, put rice in a bowl,

original: sappimhi dinne sappinā uṇhameva thokaṃ bhuñjitvā hatthe dhovitvā avasesaṃ bahi nīharitvā
analyzed: sappimhi dinne sappinā uṇham eva thokam bhuñjitvā hatthe dhovitvā avasesam bahi nīharitvā
translated: and when ghee was given, they ate a little of the hot ghee, washed their hands, took out the remainder,

original: chāyūdakaphāsuke ṭhāne nisīditvā bhuñjanti. Etaṃ sandhāya satthā āha. Bhaddāli, pana
analyzed: chāyūdaka phāsuke ṭhāne nisīditvā bhuñjanti etam sandhāya satthā āha bhaddāli pana
translated: and sat down in a place in the shade, near water, and near a resting place. With reference to this the Teacher said:

original: cintesi – “sace sakiṃ pattaṃ pūretvā dinnaṃ bhattaṃ bhuñjitvā puna pattaṃ dhovitvā
analyzed: cintesi sace sakim pattam pūretvā dinnam bhattam bhuñjitvā puna pattam dhovitvā
translated: But Bhaddāli thought: “If he eats the rice given in the bowl all at once, washes the bowl,

original: odanassa pūretvā laddhaṃ bahi nīharitvā chāyūdakaphāsuke ṭhāne bhuñjeyya, iti evaṃ
analyzed: odanassa pūretvā laddham bahi nīharitvā chāyūdaka phāsuke ṭhāne bhuñjeyya iti evam
translated: and takes out the remainder after filling the bowl with rice, it will be all right for him to eat it in a place in the shade, near water, and near a resting place. Otherwise, who could do it?”

original: vaṭṭeyya, itarathā ko sakkotī”ti. Tasmā evampi kho ahaṃ, bhante, na ussahāmīti āha.
analyzed: vaṭṭeyya itarathā kaḥ sakkoti iti tasmai evam pi kho aham bhante na ussahāmi iti āha
translated: That is why he said: “I am not able to do so, venerable sir.”

translated: “Bhaddāli, don’t worry. This sort of thing happens. Come, ask the Teacher for forgiveness.”🔽The Sangha of monks also sent a monk to invite Bhaddāli to come to them. When he had come, they said,🔽“Bhaddāli, don’t worry.

original: nāma hotī”ti evaṃ satthusantikāpi anuggahaṃ paccāsīsati. Tato “bhikkhusaṅghenāpi🔽na samassāsito, satthārāpī”ti cintetvā evamāha.
analyzed: nāma hoti iti evam satthu santikā api anuggaham paccāsīsati tatas bhikkhu saṅghena api  na samassāsito satthārā api iti cintetvā evam āha
translated: “Bhaddali, do not worry. Such things happen. Come, ask the Teacher for forgiveness.” The Order of Bhikkhus sent a bhikkhu to summon him to their presence. They said to him: “Bhaddali, do not worry. Such things happen. ” Thus the Teacher also promised to help him. Then, thinking: “I have not been consoled by the Order of Bhikkhus, nor by the Teacher,” he spoke thus.

original: Atha bhagavā bhikkhusaṅghopi satthāpi ovaditabbayuttameva ovadati, na itaranti dassetuṃ
analyzed: atha bhagavā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ api satthā api ovaditabba yuttam eva ovadati na itarat ti dassetum
translated: Then, in order to show that the Teacher and the Order of Bhikkhus admonish only those who are fit to be admonished, and not others,

original: idha, bhaddāli, ekaccotiādimāha. Tattha aññenāññantiādīni anumānasutte vitthāritāni.🔽Na sammā vattatīti sammā vattampi na vattati. Na lomaṃ pātetīti anulomavatte na vattati,
analyzed: idha bhaddāli ekacco ti ādim āha tattha aññena añña nti ādīni anumāna sutte vitthāritāni  na sammā vattati iti sammā vattam pi na vattati na lomam pāteti iti anuloma vatte na vattati
translated: he said: “Here, Bhaddali, someone does not behave rightly towards another. ” Herein, “By another” and so forth are explained in the Discourse on Inference .

original: vilomameva gaṇhāti. Na nitthāraṃ vattatīti nitthāraṇakavattamhi na vattati, āpattivuṭṭhānatthaṃ
analyzed: vilomam eva gaṇhāti na nitthāram vattati iti nitthāraṇaka vattamhi na vattati āpatti vuṭṭhāna attham
translated: “Does not behave rightly” : he does not behave rightly even though he behaves rightly. “Does not cause his hair to bristle” : he does not behave in a way that is in conformity with the Dhamma. He takes only what is contrary to the Dhamma. “Does not behave in a way that is decisive” : he does not behave in a way that is decisive in the sense of resolving an offense.

original: turitaturito chandajāto na hoti. Tatrāti tasmiṃ tassa dubbacakaraṇe. Abhiṇhāpattikoti
analyzed: turita turitaḥ chanda jātaḥ na hoti tatra ati tasmin tassa dubbaca karaṇe abhiṇhāpattikaḥ ti
translated: He is not quick to take delight. Therein: in that which makes him difficult to admonish. He is one who is constantly offending:

original: nirantarāpattiko. Āpattibahuloti sāpattikakālovassa bahu, suddho nirāpattikakālo
analyzed: nirantara āpattikaḥ āpatti bahulo ti bahu suddhaḥ nirāpattika kālo
translated: he is one who offends without interval. He is one who has many offences: the time for him to be with offences is much, the time for him to be without offences is little.

original: appoti attho. Na khippameva vūpasammatīti khippaṃ na vūpasammati, dīghasuttaṃ hoti.🔽Vinayadharā pādadhovanakāle āgataṃ “gacchāvuso, vattavelā”ti vadanti. Puna kālaṃ
analyzed: appaḥ ti atthaḥ na khippam eva vūpasammati iti khippam na vūpasammati dīgha suttam hoti  vinaya dharā pāda dhovana kāle āgatam gaccha āvuso vattavelā ati vadanti puna kālam
translated: The meaning is: he is one who has no time. He is not one who quickly makes amends: he does not quickly make amends, he is one who is slow to make amends.🔽When the Vinaya experts have come to the time for washing the feet, they say: “Go away, friend, it is time for the duties.”

original: maññitvā āgataṃ “gacchāvuso, tuyhaṃ vihāravelā, gacchāvuso, sāmaṇerādīnaṃ uddesadānavelā,
analyzed: maññitvā āgatam gaccha āvuso tuyham vihāra velā gaccha āvuso sāmaṇera ādīnam uddesa dāna velā
translated: Again, thinking it is the time, he comes, and they say: “Go away, friend, it is time for you to go to your own dwelling, it is time for you to teach the novices, etc.,

original: amhākaṃ nhānavelā, therūpaṭṭhānavelā, mukhadhovanavelā”tiādīni vatvā divasabhāgepi
analyzed: amhākam nhāna velā therū upaṭṭhāna velā mukha dhovana velā ati ādīni vatvā divasa bhāge pi
translated: it is time for us to bathe, it is time for the elders to attend to the duties, it is time for us to wash our faces, etc.”🔽Even if he comes during the day or during the night, they send him away.

original: rattibhāgepi āgataṃ uyyojentiyeva. “Kāya velāya, bhante, okāso bhavissatī”ti vuttepi
analyzed: ratti bhāge pi āgatam uyyojentiyā iva kāya velāya bhante okāsaḥ bhavissati iti vutte pi
translated: When he asks: “Venerable sirs, when will there be an opportunity?”

original: “gacchāvuso, tvaṃ imameva ṭhānaṃ jānāsi, asuko nāma vinayadharatthero sinehapānaṃ
analyzed: gaccha āvuso tvam imam eva ṭhānam jānāsi asukaḥ nāma vinaya dhara theraḥ sineha pānam
translated: they say: “Go away, friend, you know this place. The elder who is an expert in the Vinaya is drinking a cordial.

original: pivati, asuko virecanaṃ kāreti, kasmā turitosī”tiādīni vatvā dīghasuttameva karonti.
analyzed: pivati asukaḥ virecanam kāreti vatvā dīghasuttam eva karonti
translated: They say, “So-and-so is drinking alcohol. So-and-so is taking a purgative. Why are you so excited?” and they make it last a long time.

original: 141. Khippameva vūpasammatīti lahuṃ vūpasammati, na dīghasuttaṃ hoti. Ussukkāpannā
analyzed: khippam eva vūpasammati iti lahum vūpasammati na dīgha suttam hoti ussukka āpannā
translated: It is quickly settled: it is settled quickly, not made to last a long time.🔽The monks who have taken sides

original: bhikkhū – “āvuso, ayaṃ subbaco bhikkhu, janapadavāsino nāma gāmantasenāsane vasanaṭṭhānanisajjanādīni
analyzed: bhikkhū āvuso ayam subbacaḥ bhikkhu janapadavāsinaḥ nāma gāmanta senāsane vasana ṭṭhāna nisajjana ādīni
translated: think, “This monk Subbacamo is a good speaker. It is not easy for those who live in the countryside to find a place to stay, a place to walk, a place to sit, and so on, in a monastery in a village.

original: na phāsukāni honti, bhikkhācāropi dukkho hoti, sīghamassa adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamemā”ti
analyzed: na phāsukāni honti bhikkhā ācāraḥ api dukkhaḥ hoti sīgham assa adhikaraṇam vūpasamema ati
translated: It is difficult for them to go for alms. Let us quickly settle this legal issue.”

original: sannipatitvā āpattito vuṭṭhāpetvā suddhante patiṭṭhāpenti.
analyzed: sannipatitvā āpattitaḥ vuṭṭhāpetvā suddhante patiṭṭhāpenti
translated: They gather together, clear him of the offense, and establish him in purity.

original: 142. Adhiccāpattikoti kadāci kadāci āpattiṃ āpajjati. So kiñcāpi lajjī hoti pakatatto, dubbacattā panassa bhikkhū tatheva paṭipajjanti.🔽144. Saddhāmattakena vahati pemamattakenāti ācariyupajjhāyesu appamattikāya gehassitasaddhāya
analyzed: adhiccāpattikaḥ ti kadāci kadāci āpattim āpajjati so kiñcā api lajjī hoti pakatatto dubbaca ttā panassa bhikkhū tathā iva paṭipajjanti 🔽saddhā mattakena vahati pema mattakena ati ācariya upajjhāyesu appamattikāya geha ssita saddhāya
translated: He commits an offense only occasionally: he commits an offense only once in a while. Although he is conscientious and has a sense of conscience, the monks behave in the same way because of his difficulty in learning.

original: appamattakena gehassitapemena yāpeti. Paṭisandhiggahaṇasadisā hi ayaṃ pabbajjā nāma,
analyzed: appamattakena geha sita pemena yāpeti paṭisandhi ggahaṇa sadisā hi ayam pabbajjā nāma
translated: For this going forth is like the taking of a rebirth-linking.

original: navapabbajito pabbajjāya guṇaṃ ajānanto ācariyupajjhāyesu pemamattena yāpeti, tasmā
analyzed: nava pabbajitaḥ pabbajjāya guṇam a jānantaḥ ācariya upajjhāyesu pema mattena yāpeti tasmā
translated: A newly gone forth one who does not know the benefits of the going forth lives on affection for his teacher and preceptor.🔽Therefore

original: evarūpā saṅgaṇhitabbā. Appamattakampi hi saṅgahaṃ labhitvā pabbajjāya ṭhitā abhiññāpattā🔽mahāsamaṇā bhavissanti. Ettakena kathāmaggena “ovaditabbayuttakaṃ ovadanti, na itara”nti
analyzed: evarūpā saṅgaṇhitabbā appamattakam pi hi saṅgaham labhitvā pabbajjāya ṭhitā abhiññā pattā  mahāsamaṇāḥ bhavissanti ettakena kathāmaggena ovaditabba yuttakam ovadanti na itaranti
translated: such people should be gathered in. For having obtained gathering in, even though it be little, they will remain in the going forth, and will become great ascetics who have attained direct knowledge.

original: imameva bhagavatā dassitaṃ.
analyzed: imam eva bhagavatā dassitam
translated: By this much of a discourse it is shown by the Blessed One that “those who are fit to be advised are advised, not others.”

original: 145. Aññāya saṇṭhahiṃsūti arahatte patiṭṭhahiṃsu. Sattesu hāyamānesūti paṭipattiyā
analyzed: aññāya saṇṭhahiṃsu iti arahatte patiṭṭhahiṃsu sattesu hāyamānesu iti paṭipattiyā
translated: . “They settled down with understanding”: they were established in Arahantship.🔽“As beings declined”: as practice declined, beings are said to decline.

original: hāyamānāya sattā hāyanti nāma. Saddhamme antaradhāyamāneti paṭipattisaddhamme antaradhāyamāne.
analyzed: hāyamānāya sattāḥ hāyanti nāma saddhamme antaradhāyamāne iti paṭipatti saddhamme antaradhāyamāne
translated: “As the true Dhamma disappeared”: as the true Dhamma of practice disappeared.🔽For when there are no beings who fulfil the practice, the true Dhamma of practice is said to disappear.

original: Paṭipattisaddhammopi hi paṭipattipūrakesu sattesu asati antaradhāyati nāma. Āsavaṭṭhānīyāti
analyzed: paṭipatti saddhammaḥ api hi paṭipatti pūrakesu sattesu asati antaradhāyati nāma āsava ṭṭhānīyā ti
translated: “As the bases for taints increased”:

original: āsavā tiṭṭhanti etesūti āsavaṭṭhānīyā. Yesu diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikā parūpavādavippaṭisāravadhabandhanādayo
analyzed: āsavā tiṭṭhanti etesu iti āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ yesu diṭṭhadhammika samparāyikā parūpavāda vippaṭisāra vadha bandhana ādayo
translated: “The asavas abide in them” means “the asavas’ stations.” In them the asavas of the present life and the future life, such as the censure of others, the censure of the Dhamma, killing, binding, etc.,

original: ceva apāyadukkhavisesabhūtā ca āsavā tiṭṭhantiyeva. Yasmā nesaṃ te kāraṇaṃ hontīti🔽attho. Te āsavaṭṭhānīyā vītikkamadhammā yāva na saṅghe pātubhavanti, na tāva satthā
analyzed: ca iva apāya dukkha visesa bhūtā ca āsavā yasmā na īsam te kāraṇam honti iti  attho te āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ vītikkama dhammāḥ yāva na saṅghe pātubhavanti na tāva satthā
translated: and the special sufferings of the states of deprivation, abide. The meaning is that they are the cause of those .

original: sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapetīti ayamettha yojanā.🔽Evaṃ akālaṃ dassetvā puna kālaṃ dassetuṃ yato ca kho, bhaddālītiādimāha. Tattha yatoti
analyzed: sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti iti ayam ettha yojanā  evam akālam dassetvā puna kālam dassetum yatas ca kho bhaddāli iti ādim āha tattha yatas iti
translated: As long as those asavas’ stations are not manifest in the Sangha, the Teacher does not lay down a training precept for the disciples. This is the construction here.

original: yadā, yasmiṃ kāleti vuttaṃ hoti. Sesaṃ vuttānusāreneva veditabbaṃ. Ayaṃ vā ettha🔽saṅkhepattho – yasmiṃ kāle āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammāti saṅkhaṃ gatā vītikkamadosā saṅghe
analyzed: yadā yasmin kāle iti vuttam hoti sesam vutta anusārena iva veditabbam ayam vā ettha  saṅkhepa atthaḥ yasmin kāle āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammā ati saṅkham gatāḥ vītikkama dosā saṅghe
translated: Having thus shown the wrong time, he now said “But when, Bhadali,” etc., in order to show the right time. Herein, when means when, at what time, on what occasion. The rest can be understood by the method stated. Or the meaning here in brief is this:

original: pātubhavanti, tadā satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti. Kasmā? Tesaṃyeva āsavaṭṭhānīyadhammasaṅkhātānaṃ
analyzed: pātubhavanti tadā satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti kasmā tesam yeva āsava ṭṭhānīya dhamma saṅkhātānam
translated: When the faults of transgression, called “the asavas’ stations,” become manifest in the Sangha, then the Teacher lays down a training precept for the disciples. Why? Because those faults, called “the asavas’ stations,”

original: vītikkamadosānaṃ paṭighātāya.
analyzed: vītikkama dosānam paṭighātāya
translated: for the purpose of warding off the offence of transgression.

original: Evaṃ āsavaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppattiṃ sikkhāpadapaññattiyā akālaṃ, uppattiñca🔽kālanti vatvā idāni tesaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppattikālañca uppattikālañca dassetuṃ “na🔽tāva, bhaddāli, idhekacce”tiādimāha. Tattha mahattanti mahantabhāvaṃ. Saṅgho hi yāva🔽na theranavamajjhimānaṃ vasena mahattaṃ patto hoti, tāva senāsanāni pahonti, sāsane🔽ekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā na uppajjanti. Mahattaṃ patte pana te uppajjanti, atha
analyzed: evam āsava ṭṭhānīyānam dhammānam anuppattim sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ akālam uppattiñca  kālanti vatvā idāni tesam dhammānam anuppatti kālañca uppatti kālañca dassetum na  tāva bhaddāli idha ekacca iti ādim āha tattha mahattanti mahanta bhāvam saṅghaḥ hi  na thera nava majjhimānam vasena mahattam pattaḥ hoti senāsanāni pahonti sa āsane  ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti mahattam patte pana te uppajjanti atha
translated: Thus the appearance of things that are a basis for cankers is not the time for the announcement of a training precept, but their appearance is the time.

original: satthā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti. Tattha mahattaṃ patte saṅghe paññattasikkhāpadāni –🔽“Yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena uttaridvirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya pācittiyaṃ.
analyzed: satthā sikkhāpadam paññapeti tattha mahattam patte saṅghe paññatta sikkhāpadāni  yaḥ pana bhikkhu an upasampannena uttari dviratta tirattam sahaseyyam kappeyya pācittiyam
translated: Having said this, he now said “Bhaddāli, it is not yet the time for that in this case” in order to show the time for the non-appearance of those things and the time for their appearance. Herein, greatness is greatness of number. For as long as the Sangha has not reached greatness by means of the elders, the middle-aged, and the young, for that long the dwellings are sufficient and some things that are a basis for cankers do not appear in the Dispensation. But when greatness has been reached they do appear, and then the Master announces a training precept. Herein, the training precepts announced in the Sangha when it has reached greatness are these:🔽“If a bhikkhu should lie down more than two or three times in the night on the same sleeping place with one who is not fully admitted to the Order, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Yā pana bhikkhunī anuvassaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya pācittiyaṃ. Yā pana bhikkhunī ekavassaṃ dve
analyzed: yā pana bhikkhunī anuvassam vuṭṭhāpeyya pācittiyam yā pana bhikkhunī eka vassam dve
translated: “If a bhikkhunī should give the full admission to a woman less than twelve years after she has gone forth, she commits an offense entailing confession. If a bhikkhunī should give the full admission to a woman

original: vuṭṭhāpeyya pācittiya”nti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhāpeyya pācittiyanti
translated: The offense entailing confession is finished.

original: Iminā nayena veditabbāni.
analyzed: iminā nayena veditabbāni
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: Lābhagganti lābhassa aggaṃ. Saṅgho hi yāva na lābhaggapatto hoti, na tāva lābhaṃ paṭicca āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā uppajjanti. Patte pana uppajjanti, atha satthā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti –
analyzed: lābha aggam ti lābhassa aggam saṅgho hi yāva na lābhagga patto hoti na tāva lābham paṭicca āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti patte pana uppajjanti atha satthā sikkhāpadam paññapeti
translated: The peak of gain: the peak of gain is the Sangha. As long as the Sangha has not reached the peak of gain, the things that are the basis for corruptions do not arise in dependence on gain. But when it has reached the peak, they do. The Buddha then laid down a training rule:

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya pācittiya”nti.
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā dadeyya pācittiyam ti
translated: ‘If a monk gives fresh or cooked food with his own hands to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: Idañhi lābhaggapatte saṅghe sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.
analyzed: idam hi lābhagga patte saṅghe sikkhāpadam paññattam
translated: This training rule was laid down by the Buddha with regard to the Sangha when it had reached the peak of gain.

original: Yasagganti yasassa aggaṃ. Saṅgho hi yāva na yasaggapatto hoti, na tāva yasaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: yasaggam ti yasassa aggam saṅghaḥ hi yāva na yasagga patto hoti na tāva yasam paṭicca
translated: The peak of fame: the peak of fame is the Sangha. As long as the Sangha has not reached the peak of fame, the things that are the basis for corruptions

original: āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā uppajjanti. Patte pana uppajjanti, atha satthā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti
analyzed: āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti patte pana uppajjanti atha satthā sikkhāpadam paññapeti
translated: do not arise in dependence on fame. But when it has reached the peak, they do. The Buddha then laid down a training rule:

original: “surāmerayapāne pācittiya”nti. Idañhi yasaggapatte saṅghe sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.
analyzed: surā meraya pāne pācittiyan ti idam hi yasagga patte saṅghe sikkhāpadam paññattam
translated: ‘The drinking of alcohol is an offense entailing confession.’” This training rule was laid down by the Buddha with regard to the Sangha when it had reached the peak of fame.

original: Bāhusaccanti bahussutabhāvaṃ. Saṅgho hi yāva na bāhusaccapatto hoti, na tāva āsavaṭṭhānīyā
analyzed: bāhusaccam ti bahu ssuta bhāvam saṅghaḥ hi yāva na bāhusacca pattaḥ hoti na tāva āsava ṭṭhānīyā
translated: Bahusaccanti bahussutabhāvaṃ: “As long as the Order has not reached the state of being learned,🔽the things that are the basis for the cankers do not arise. But when the state of being learned has been reached,

original: dhammā uppajjanti. Bāhusaccapatte pana yasmā ekaṃ nikāyaṃ dve nikāye pañcapi nikāye
analyzed: dhammāḥ uppajjanti bāhu sacca patte pana yasmai ekam nikāyam dve nikāye pañca api nikāye
translated: then, having learned one collection, two collections, and even all the five collections,

original: uggahetvā ayoniso ummujjamānā puggalā rasena rasaṃ saṃsandetvā uddhammaṃ ubbinayaṃ🔽satthu sāsanaṃ dīpenti, atha satthā – “yo pana bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya tathāhaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: uggahetvā ayonisaḥ ummujjamānāḥ puggalāḥ rasena rasam saṃsandetvā uddhammam ubbinayam  satthu sāsanam dīpenti atha satthā yaḥ pana bhikkhu evam vadeyya tathā aham bhagavatā
translated: and being unreasonable, they will be like a person who, when he is thirsty, drinks water mixed with oil. They will mix one taste with another taste, and they will expound the Teacher’s Dispensation in a way that is contrary to the Dhamma and contrary to the Discipline.

original: dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi …pe… samaṇuddesopi ce evaṃ vadeyyā”tiādinā nayena sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti.
analyzed: dhammam desitam ājānāmi pe samaṇuddeso pi ce evam vadeyya ati ādinā nayena sikkhāpadam paññapeti
translated: Then the Teacher will lay down a training precept in this way: ‘But if a bhikkhu should speak thus: “As I understand the Dhamma taught by the Blessed One thus … even a novice who spoke thus … ” ‘ .

original: Rattaññutaṃ pattoti ettha rattiyo jānantīti rattaññū. Attano pabbajitadivasato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: rattaññu tam patto ti ettha rattiyaḥ jānanti iti rattaññū attano pabbajita divasato paṭṭhāya

analyzed: veditabbam saḥ ha ayasmai ūna dasa vasse bhikkhū upasampādente disvā eka vassaḥ saddhivihārikam  upasampādesi atha bhagavā sikkhāpadam paññapesi na bhikkhave ūna dasa vassena

original: upasampādetabbo, yo upasampādeyya āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti. Evaṃ paññatte sikkhāpade🔽puna bhikkhū “dasavassamhā dasavassamhā”ti bālā abyattā upasampādenti. Atha bhagavā

original: aparampi sikkhāpadaṃ paññapesi – “na, bhikkhave, bālena abyattena upasampādetabbo,
analyzed: aparam pi sikkhāpadam paññapesi na bhikkhave bālena abyattena upasampādetabbaḥ
translated: After the training rule had been laid down, the monks again gave the full admission to those who had ten years’ seniority. But they were ignorant and incompetent. The Buddha then laid down another training rule:🔽“You should not give the full admission to anyone who is ignorant and incompetent.

analyzed: yaḥ upasampādeyya āpatti dukkaṭassa anujānāmi bhikkhave byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena

analyzed: tattha puthujjano sotāpanno sakadāgāmī anāgāmī iti ime cattāro janāḥ na pajahanti nāma  puthujjana ādayo tāva mā pajahantu anāgāmī katham na pajahati iti saḥ api hi yāvadevassa
translated: Herein, the four kinds of persons who are called “non-abandoners” are the worldling, the stream-enterer, the once-returner, and the non-returner.

original: bhavalobho atthi, tāva ahosukhaṃ ahosukhanti abhinandati. Tasmā nappajahati nāma.🔽Eteyeva pana cattāro janā pajahanti nāma. Sotāpannādayo tāva pajahantu, puthujjano🔽kathaṃ pajahatīti? analyzed: bhava lobho atthi tāva ahosukham ahosukhanti abhinandati tasmā na ppajahati nāma  pajahanti nāma sotāpanna ādayo tāva pajahantu puthujjano  katham pajahati iti āraddha vipassakaḥ hi sati sammosena sahasā kilese uppanne mādisassa  nāma bhikkhuno kilesaḥ uppannaḥ ti saṃvegam katvā vīriyam paggayha vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā
translated: Now, let the worldling and the rest be non-abandoners. How is the non-returner a non-abandoner? He too delights in the pleasure of existence as long as he has the greed for existence. The worldling who has begun insight suddenly arouses defilements. He is alarmed, thinking: “A defilement has arisen in me, a bhikkhu who is a worldling.” He exerts energy and develops insight, and he eradicates the defilements by the path. Thus he is called an abandoner.

original: maggena kilese samugghāteti. Iti so pajahati nāma. Teyeva cattāro khippaṃ pajahanti
analyzed: maggena kilese samugghāteti iti saḥ pajahati nāma te yeva cattāraḥ khippam pajahanti
translated: These same four kinds of persons are called “quick-abandoners.”
